Reviews.Title: “Garden House is nice”
Reviews.Author: yuko m
Reviews.Content: First I could`nt get Garden Hotel. I ask some people where the hotel is. Many kind people tell me the place. But I can not find. A rug shop owner call the hotel and at last I can get the Hotel. How kind Turkish people is !! The hotel is full of branch of rose. If it is rose season. I feel very happy surely ! The room is so lovery. And staff is friendly, Next time I would like to come rose season !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice located, good service, reasonnable price”
Reviews.Author: ramseshub
Reviews.Content: I liked very much the attention of the manager. He tries to take care of all his guests like someone could do it in a 5* Hotel. The prices are pretty reasonnable for such hotel, everybody is nice. Good cosy place to stay no more than 300 meters from the Blue Mosquee. Breakfast are pretty good, with various choice

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: siolae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Garden House Hotel in February. The room overlooking the courtyard was really lovely: warm, comfortable and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was delicious and the hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The hotel is in the heart of Istanbul and an easy walk to major sites but is also on a very quiet street so quiet at night. Would definitely return and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A "must stay" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pLeungkh
Reviews.Content: The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel like family. The food is amazing, the pool is over the top. Our room was completely private and relaxing. i cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our "home" in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mol161
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel in the historic part of Istanbul! We felt so much at home that we were sad to leave after four nights. Great location with all the historic sites- all within walking distances. We took the taxi only once to go to Eminonu and realised it is only walking distance. The hotel staff was extremely helpful . Mr Seljuk was so helpful that we felt he is one of our longlost friends. Bora was very kind. Suvat and the team in the restaurant were wonderful- excellent food. Fresh meat/ lovely fruits/ cakes/ sweets. The breakfast spread was amazing. Thanks to Abbas and Moran who helped with the baggage and all our heavy purchases. Everyone was so polite, nothing was too much trouble for them. Blue mosque, Hagia sophia (Big & Little), Topkapi Palace & Suleimaniye mosque were wonderful. Turkish Bath was wonderful too. Grand Bazar was an experience, to say the least. Once we got the hang of the haggling it was great fun. I got so used to it I have even started bargaining with the local fruit seller in my town in U.K, much to his annoyance (. He is hoping that I will stop this bizarre behaviour soon.) We bought lamps, Iznik plates, Iznik pomegranates, small jewellery sets, perfumes,curios etc. Well, we will certainly be going back to buy some carpets when we will be staying at the Rose Garden house again, nowhere else for us now. We have travelled widely and have stayed in many many hotels in all continents . This stay was one of the best.Excellent hotel and staff indeed! Will happily recommend it to anyone who visits Istanbul. C & SJ

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: yi g
Reviews.Content: In fact we booked the hotel was Raymond hotel, but when we arrived at the raymond, we was informed that the room was leaking, so raymond transfered us to rose garden house. Rose Garden is good than our expect it. the old man of reception is very lovely. he give us lot of helps. rose garden located at blue mosque nearly, it has brightness lounge areas, beautiful garden, nice rooms and delicious foods. We are very happy to stay at there. Thank's every staff,they are very friendly and efficiently. we will choose rose garden house if we go to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Author: DearOldOakParker
Reviews.Content: This was a great location. Kucuk Ayasofya is a well known neighboirhood and was all that you needed to tell cab drivers. I also reached it using the subway from the IST airport. Our rooms were very romantic. We had our own Hamam in our room. The staff, Seljuk and Ayhan were friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast as well. Good place to take a spouse, significant other, or family. No fitness center but I ran under the tracks and in the park along the Sea of Marmara (this is not for the faint of heart). Exploring the area requires hiking up fairly steep streets (this is Istanbul). Nearby are restaurants, Grand Bazaar, Cemberlitas Baths, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and all the SultanAhmet has to offer. Don't miss visiting the Kucuk Ayasofya (Little Hagia Sophia) as it is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Airportroamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 5 star cruise, and our expectations were high, even though this was a completely unknown hotel and a new city for us. My goodness, we were not disappointed! We were met by the charming and efficient manager, Mr Selcuk, who, despite our early arrival at the hotel, gave us an upgrade to a beautiful large room and directed us to the breakfast patio whilst the room was readied. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly; nothing was too much trouble, and we were made to feel very much at home. We had an 0330 call, and the pre-arranged taxi was there as ordered, help was on hand with luggage etc and a completely hassle-free check out. Absolutely recommend this little gem. Only watch word is to make sure you remember the location. We got a little lost on the way back from shopping, but a call to the hotel for directions saw one of the staff walking to our location to guise us back! Outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Geoff W
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in handy position for sightseeing. Fantastic choices available for breakfast with lots of delicious fresh breads/savoury pastries, cheeses fruits etc. Hardworking, attentive and helpful staff. 'Silver package ' for off season travellers an amazing bargain. Lived up to all their promises-and more! Rooms characterful and comfortable, very clean and practical. Struggled a bit with shower which was not completely enclosed so water on floor in bathroom after every shower but staff always available to clean room in morning, if requested. Great relief to find such a super, well run and pleasant place to stay in Istanbul, a very large, busy and exotic city. We can thoroughly recommend this delightful hotel and look forward to returning in future.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quite”
Reviews.Author: YvApache
Reviews.Content: I spend one night . The hotel was very quite. the room was very clean and conformtable. the hotel is well situated at a short distance from the blue mosque. Definitely a good quality /rice choice to stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A lovely central place”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: It was our third trip to Istanbul. Firts time in this hotel but not the last time. A very nice oasis in the middle of the old town. A short walk to the main historical buildings, to the harbour or to the tram. The manager and all of the staff are very kindly and help you for privat trips or booking your special trips. We were with our friends for 3 nights in the first class rooms. This rooms and the bathroom are beautiful. The organisation of the airport transfer was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel .... recommended”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia1808
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite very . The staff very very kind (nice idea for a small buffet of biscuits always available in the afternoon). The room was very cozy, comfortable and very clean (no carpet). Breakfast is buffet, good and plentiful, prevails where the salty rather than sweet (eg croissants), fried eggs or omelets made â€‹â€‹at the time. Also the position the hotel is strategically in the heart of Sultanahmet, within walking distance Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern and the bus stop tram. We shoot everything on foot, reaching the part new town, with no problems

Reviews.Title: “a lovely Oasis of peace in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Martin M
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul; really enhanced by this wonderful little hotel. Very well presented with real character and lots of welcoming touches all around. The courtyard area was spacious; and although it was snowing when we were there it would be a beautiful secluded spot in warmer times. The restaurant area was suoerb; with large mural photos of the city to whet our appetite for the day's sightseeing. The breakfasts were plentiful and varied, the omelettes cooked to order were our favourite! Very attentive and courteous staff, and a perfect location just a couple of minutes from the Blue Mosque. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl C
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms; staff/service/food is great. We had a great stay and the hotel has a central location.

Reviews.Title: “In the historical center of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ca14rs
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the historical center of Istanbul. What distinguishes this hotel from others is how much the staff cares about you and your experience at Istanbul. When you arrive, you are greeted by the hotel manager who answers questions, provide maps, and give you an orientation of the hotel. The rooms are simple, but very clean and functional. The location is excellent, just in the middle of the historical center. Although it can be difficult to orient yourself in the historical center (as all old quarters, it's a a bit of a labyrinth), after you get your bearings, it's a very short walk to the main attractions (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and museums) and the tram. Oh, and the breakfast at the hotel is really good: a large buffet with both international and Turkish food plus eggs cooked to order. The historical center may not be for everybody, but If you are looking for a hotel there, the Garden House is the place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A well deserved good review”
Reviews.Author: Alberto A
Reviews.Content: I strongly recomand this hotel: its location in the heart of Istanbul, the beauty of its structure along with the kindness of its staff make it a perfect place to stay in beautiful Istanbul. All the tips I asked for were perfect and they even send back to me the gloves I forgot at their counter. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff easily make this one of the best hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Joseph B
Reviews.Content: From the second you walk in, you are greeted by the hotel's manager. Who walks you through the grounds and provides you with maps and all the information necessary to make the best of your time in Istanbul. The rooms are spacious, and clean, with classy yet comfortable furnishings. The breakfast is delicious with traditional turkish dishes as well as standard continetal cuisine. One of the best parts about the service is the greetings you recieve from the same staff members every morning who are willing to help you make the best of your time. The hotel itself is located less than a 5 minute walk from the blue mosque and old town square, allowing you to easily access all the attractions without the hassel of taxis. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about visiting Istanbul, you really get a bang for your buck

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make this hotel really special”
Reviews.Author: BeeB0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for a long weekend at the start of Feb. One thing that makes this hotel special is the friendly staff who really make you feel welcome. We had to move rooms during our stay as maintenance had to be carried out, and although our original room was fine, the new room was more modern and quite luxurious in comparison. from my understanding you get given the improved rooms when you book direct with the hotel. Within the room you have dressing gowns, slippers, complimentary water, fruit bowl and small bottle of red wine. Toiletries include shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body loofah, shower cap and sewing kit. The hotel has free wifi, and although we couldn't connect in our original room, we could in the 2nd and also in communal areas. The hotel has a conservatory area with complimentary cake, biscuits and water. Breakfast was fine, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, fresh omelette stand and some hot options (boiled eggs, sausages), lots of differ juices and teas. The hotel is very close to the Blue Mosque and a short (15 walk) to the tram lines which will take you up to Taskim Square (2 Turkish Lira (72p) the 2 Turkish Lira on the funicular). We also visited a Turkish baths (for massage and body scrub), the spice market, Grand Bazar and Bascillia Cistern which were all walking distance from the hotel. Meals out can be quite reasonable, we paid 22 Turkish Lira (Â£8) for a 3 course meal close to the hotel, but one thing to bear in mind is that wine is quite expensive in comparisson and will therefore increase your bill. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would live to revisit, although I would recommend booking through the hotel to guarantee the best (more modern) rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Eesti”
Reviews.Author: GÃ¶kÃ§en A
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast, friendly and helpful staff (especially Mr. Selcuk), perfect hospitality what else we could ask more! Hotel is so close to historical places. We will definitely visit Garden House in summer again. I strongly recommend everyone to stay there and feel the comfort. Thanks Garden House!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: sreinblatt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, relaxing and comfortable atmosphere, delicious food, free wine and fruit in the room, and the most friendly staff I have ever met in my life. What else could you ask for? Plus, it is close to all the most popular tourist attractions. Very clean, too, and they serve all the meals there at the hotel....all were delicious :-) Also, we had a beautiful hamam for our bathroom! Talk about incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff, great breakfastâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Amir M
Reviews.Content: Garden House in Istanbul was definitely a perfect choice for anyone to stay in. Its in the heart of Sultanhamet with the blue mosque 2 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room spoilt by it's size and smelly drain”
Reviews.Author: map170
Reviews.Content: Pros â€¢ Nice location and attractive building 5 mins walk from red and blue mosques â€¢ Welcome bottle of wine, fruits, water, tea and coffee â€¢ Cakes and biscuits â€˜on tapâ€™ â€¢ Staff generally friendly and helpful â€¢ Delicious breakfast â€¢ Clean room Cons â€¢ On arrival it was quite obvious our booking (placed with Expedia months before) hadnâ€™t been logged. There followed some obvious panic among the staff about what to do with us as it seemed like the hotel was full. After 20 minutes waiting in reception for the staff to deal for us (who spoke in Turkish about the booking so we couldnâ€™t understand) the hotel manager greeted us and said a room was ready as if nothing was wrong. He kept on referring to the fact that our Expedia booking was for an â€˜economyâ€™ room (repeated this 5 times) before showing us to our room (as if to justify what type of room he was about to lead us to). The room was ground level and we were initially unsatisfied with the quality in accordance to what we had paid. We actually asked to move but were told the hotel was full. â€¢ The room was a small corner room. It was next to the street so street noises were very loud. Passers by could see into the room quite well, especially because the curtains were not big enough to cover the windows. There was no TV remote and all TV channels were very fuzzy (we didnâ€™t watch TV but think this is worth mentioning). â€¢ The bathroom was very smelly. There was a horrible smell from the drains which took over the entire room. It was especially noticeable when returning to the room after a long day outside (as no other rooms were available we cannot vouch to wether this was the case for the rest of the hotel). Overall the stay could have been memorable. However, this was spoilt by some small but significant factors. Would question before rebooking here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely sublime”
Reviews.Author: Azra7
Reviews.Content: Garden House in Istanbul was definitely a perfect choice for anyone to stay in. Its in the heart of Sultanhamet with the blue mosque 2 minutes away. All the interesting tourist spots such as the hagia sofiya, topcapi, grand bazaar are walking distance from the hotel thus making it the prime vacationers dream! The hotel itself had superb service with great hosts such as Serhat and Bora who always took care of us and made sure we were comfortable, drew us maps, got us taxis and any other services we required. They were definitely the most friendly hosts we met in Istanbul. The rooms were comfortable and spacious and the food was excellent. Defintely highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Simplulo
Reviews.Content: In January 2012 I stayed a few days in Garden House, left for Cappadocia, and then came back, so I must have liked it. ;) I stayed in three separate rooms, one standard and two economy, and all were quite pleasant. The entire staff team is quite friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was something to look forward to, with quite a variety (compliments to the omelet girl!). Short walk to the Sultanahmet sites and the tram stop, from which you can easily ride to Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “Class act in a quiet area of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: BeirutMoores
Reviews.Content: On a small street (can be a little challenging to find) not as super convenient to the tramway as some others, but very near the Blue Mosque (behind and down hill a bit), Aya Sofia and restaurants. Free airport pick up was brilliant, and free dinner very nice--both are available with three nights stay. Excellent service and lovely attitude on the part of all staff make this an exceptional place. The breakfast spread is very good, and includes omelettes and good coffee. We were upgraded to Rose Garden Suites so didn't see the regular rooms, but the suites were lovely, with all the amenities of a 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karina_Sotnik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden House early in January of 2012. This hotel is very well situated just minutes from the main attractions in the old city. We were two adults and two kids (9 ans 11). The stuff at the hotel was so wonderful and friendly that kids declared Turkey to be the "most kids-friendly country". Our rooms were close to each other and very large by the European standards. We had a bottle of wine and a fruit basket "on the house" in each room every day. Their breakfast had a very large selection of savories and sweets and there are always a selection of cookies downstairs for guests to munch on in the guests lobby. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before our trip to Cappadocia and one more night at the end of that trip. We were given a Sultan suite to stay in on our trip back. It is a beautifully decorated very large room with an enormous "sultan" bed and curtains around it. The bathroom was a spectacularly large room separated from the sleeping area by a glass wall. This could be a problem for some people ans we wished there were a curtains or some other way to "hide' in the bathroom :) It is also a problem as you can see the door from the toilet (and, of course, you can see the toilet from the door)... Other than that this hotel is a gem! Oh, one more thing, the eating area is a little walk through the garden and there are little handy umbrellas in case it rains.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal B
Reviews.Content: Garden House is a beautiful and cosy hotel located near the most important sights in Istanbul. The hotel offers a great standard at a reasonable price. The garden house staff offers exceptional hospitality and awesome service..We travel often and have rarely experienced such friendliness in a hotel. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mhoma
Reviews.Content: we recently visited turkey during december organised by TRAVEL SHOP TURKEY.our stay at garden house hotel was most warm and hospitable with excellent service esp by manager mr.seljuk.the hotel has a homely atmosphere and the highlight is that the guest is made to feel special.a definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Karpal0
Reviews.Content: We booked the room (romantic penthouse) via istanbulhotels.com for a nice price. Once we got to the hotel, they didn't find our reservation which was confirmed by e-mail from the website saying that the hotel had confirmed it as well. The hotel told us the promised price was too low and that they had sent us two e-mails about it - which we never received. After a short discussion, they promised the room for the confirmed price. Luckily they had an empty room, which was a suite in the 5th floor. What a view over the rooftops and to the Bosphorus! First we were promised one night in the suite, but spent after all three nights there before a switch to a regular room. Both of the rooms were cosy and nice, but especially some details in the suite were a bit worn out. We liked especially the Ottoman style in the regular room. Breakfast was plentyful with e.g. olives, pastries, juices, pies etc; almost a brunch actually with no need for lunch. The staff was very nice and helpful. We spent New Year in Istanbul and the hotel offered all of its' guests a reception in the afternoon with sparkling wine and mezes, which was a nice gesture. The location is very nice if you're interested in the historical sights in Sultahnatmet. The neighbourhood seemed a bit shabby but felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “dlv”
Reviews.Author: di lauro v
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nice hotel with my family from 30-12-2011 to 2-01-2012. The facilities and its location are perfect to the centre area about 10 minutes walking.The staff in this hotel exceptionally friendly and helpful.We had the biggest room executive room it was clean and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bayer B”
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this nice hotel with my family in the executive room from 20-12-2011 to 23-12-2011. The facilities and its location are perfect to the centre area about 10 minutes walking.The staff in this hotel exceptionally friendly and helpful.We had the biggest room executive room it was clean and nice.We thank them all and in the future if i visit istanbul i will sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kmfplatt
Reviews.Content: For a tourist stay in Istanbul this is a perfect choice. The hotel is well maintained, sparkling clean, and housed in a beautifully restored older building. The location is a picturesque neighborhood of winding little streets in the old city, a short walk from the major tourist points of interest such as the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the palaces of the Ottoman Sultans. Service was wonderfully attentive and pleasant. We were given a great deal of personal attention by the staff as we planned our stayâ€”they booked a visit to the baths for us, arranged transportation, and were very flexible about a late check out. The breakfast was tasty and abundant. The lobby lounge always has free cookies, cake and bottled water, which our girls loved. The only, very minor complaint: the wi-fi signal was *very* weak in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Owen M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of December and found the staff in this hotel exceptionally friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is near all the sights in istanbul and I would recommend to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “â€œA perfect hotel at reasonable price, extremely nice staffâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Joanna U
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a great time in Istanbul and the hotel far exceeded our expectations. We booked the hotel online on its website, so we didnâ€™t know what to expect. The hotel has an excellent location, in the centre of a tourist area, up to a 10-minutes walk from all the most interesting monuments and places. Rooms are spacious, very clean and well-decorated. When we arrived (transfer from the airport was organised by the hotel) we were welcomed with a basket of fruits, vine and water waiting in the room. Room equipment includes tea- and coffee-making kit. We went to the hotel restaurant twice. Breakfasts are very diverse, there is a broad selection of vegetable dishes, cheeses, eggs in various forms (excellent omelettes!), fruits, sweets, drinks. We strongly recommend delicious fish dishes. The hotel offers very interesting promotion packages (we used one are were very satisfied with it). The staff are well qualified, helpful and speak English fluently (special thanks to the elderly mister at the reception desk). We will definitely come back next time we visit Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JROY13
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been better: friendly, professional, and helpful....they genuinely cared about the quality of their service and about making my stay as pleasant as possible. If you're in Istanbul to sight-see, which I was, the location can't be beat. VERY close to the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, and all the other places to visit in the old city. Also great if you're a runner, as it's quite easy to get onto the seaside running trail from here. The space actually consists of two hotels (Garden House and Rose Garden Suites) connected by a nice exterior walkway and outdoor courtyard...it must be amazing in the Spring and Summer. The room I was in (upper floor) was quite spacious and well appointed. Had a minor issue with a drain not draining, but the top-notch staff fixed the issue immediately. I can also vouch for the kitchen - good food and excellent staff (I highly recommend their fish offerings). In summary: I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Nissa R
Reviews.Content: Garden house experience was really nice :) Staff was very friendly and always at ur service ! The distance from the important places wasnot so much and theres a tramp station near by from you can go to taksim sq (modern turkey in about 10mins). Overall Garden house is a place i myte book again if i visit to Turkey again :)

Reviews.Title: “Very personalized attention and a great location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dec 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Garden House. This was our fourth time to Istanbul and this was by far the best hotel. Very kind staff, excellent breakfast. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dagan P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden House in August 2011 and had a fantastic time. The staff was very kind and attentive to our needs. The rooms on the top floor are well appointed and are sized well for a couple. Breakfast in the morning was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and kindly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lediane
Reviews.Content: Location is great, walking distance to important ( and beautiful) places. The staff was very kindly and helpful. I didn`t have problems when asked to change the room. I used the pick up service and it was very good. The internet was free and worked very well. I had problems one day because there was no hot water in the shower, sometimes it happens there but i wasn`t informed about it in the check in, but I loved the hotel and would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for my first visit to Istanbul ,the staff are very helpful”
Reviews.Author: Vivnich
Reviews.Content: good location..walking distance to main attractions. the rooms are very comfortable with a lovely bathroom.Breakfast was nice and all the staff are helpful .Will definetly return to the Garden House Hotel and will Highly recomend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: turkeyfan t
Reviews.Content: location was very good, 5 min walk to the main attractions like hagia sophia, blue mosque, cisterne, etc. the hotel room ("superior room" on 2nd floor) was very clean and nicely decorated. also the bathroom was very nice with marble stone floor. internet was working fine and was for free. airport pick up worked without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and will not be our last, what a fantastic place. One of the highlights of the trip was staying at the Garden House. The staff were friendly, very helpful and no matter what time of day or night would help in any way possible. The room was great , very clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The meals were very nice and the whole stay was very enjoyable, we will be back again and once again thankyou for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm,Wonderful,and quite luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: janebyrne410
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, who were informative, friendly, and this hotel gets 5 stars for being an intimate boutique hotel, with a fantastic buffet breakfast. The rooms were spacious,ours had a ham-mam,(a Turkish bath),with marble benches, as well as a modern shower,great fun.The hotel has a great location for old Istanbul, but is also minutes walk to the metro line from which you can easily travel anywhere in this fascinating city.The sheets and furnishings are luxury, the beds soft, and we were there in winter, and it was toastie warm, the bathroom had underfloor heating. I would highly recommend Garden House. Well done,and price is excellent for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L
Reviews.Content: This is a real surprise for us! We stayed behind istanbul after traveling with a tour group in turkey. Garden house is a very cute hotel, the warm welcome, very attentive and friendly staff making us feeling so comfortable after a hectic tour. Room is spacious and clean, breakfast is brilliant. The hotel is at the best location in old sultanamet, the street is quitet but just minutes away from major tourist attractions and tram station. Have to mention Selcuk - he is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, friendly and very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: P-and-L_Travel
Reviews.Content: Interesting part of Istanbul with Blue Mosque, fish markets and other sights all fairly close by. Character rooms, quite spacious and very clean. We stayed in the main older block, recently refurbished and nice towels - great shower. Breakfast was good, usual continental with omelette made to order. Staff good.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bernardlunn
Reviews.Content: great neighberhood, friendly people, nice touches like free coffee and juice. Some rooms in need of reservation and food was not great. But overall, we liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in great part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TripBahrain
Reviews.Content: The garden house was a lovely hotel reasonably price in a great part of city. Within walking distance of hagia sophia and blue mosque. Hotel mgt were lovely and very helpful. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About Our Stay at the Garden House”
Reviews.Author: KTtravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice last April at the beginning and ending of our tour in Turkey. Our first visit was wonderful. We were upgraded to a lovely room, the staff was kind and friendly and we enjoyed our stay. Our second visit was a completely different experience. The hotel seemed surprised to see us and initially didn't have a room ready for us. After a short while we were told we could have the same room we had stayed in before and it would be ready in a few hours (which was fine.) When we returned we were instead given an ordinary room which had construction going on right outside of it for several hours. We didn't mind the room as we knew we had been upgraded the first time, but no explanation was given for the change in plans and the noise was quite loud. The staff person at the desk during this visit (a man in his 30s) was yelling at several people he seemed to be doing business with that evening and then again the next morning. He was also fairly unfriendly to us which was completely different from how we had been treated by the other staff we met on our first visit. We had not been difficult or complained about anything and wondered if he just didn't like Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: italo1881
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train late at night, and had some trouble finding the hotel as it is in a small street and most locals didn't know it. However, once we arrived, we loved the place. The hotel is clean and the room was amazing. We were lucky to get the top floor room which had a very comfortable bed, a lounge area, a Whirlpool tub, and a balcony overlooking Sulthanamet. The hotel is centrally located. Also everyone at the hotel was very welcoming and helpful. Would recommend the hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fab staff and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joss8
Reviews.Content: Wonderful friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in one of the Suites and loved the furnishings. The room was spacious and quiet. The buffet breakfast was fab. There was also complimentary dried and fresh fruit, plus cookies to top up energy levels after sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - should have booked a better room”
Reviews.Author: eggbap47
Reviews.Content: A short walk from this hotel up a steep cobbled street takes you to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofya and the Tramway which will take you cheaply to Eminonu (harbour from where you can take a Bosphorus trip departing 10:30 am daily 10TL (Â£4) The trams cost 2TL (less than Â£1) per trip regardless of distance. Anyway back to the Hotel, our room was not one of the best (standard) small and down three flights of exterior steps so no view however, there are other choices of rooms and suites. Ours had an extremely uncomfortable 'sultan' style bed i.e. a sort of a raised up four poster with three steps up to it, a bit of a palaver if you need to get out in the night. There is also only one comfortable chair, and no bedside lights so main lights have to be turned off before getting into bed oops. A little annoying was the early morning step scrubbing about 7 am just outside the window. The resident cats although very endearing slink around trying to steal food from the breakfast buffet. Now for the good points, very helpfull staff, rooms cleaned daily, standard contintental style breakfast with eggs cooked to your liking. Tea making in the rooms, a complementary fresh fruit basket and bottle of wine on arrival. Tea, coffee, juice, fresh fruit, biscuits etc available all day in the lounge at no charge - great after a long day sightseeing. The guest manager will arrange trips for you should you disire. From Ataturk Airport take the Metro to Aksaray Square then the Tramway to Sultanahmet to get to the main sights and the hotel. The return journey can be made by booking a hotel collection from one of the airport transfer kiosks for Â£5euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good value”
Reviews.Author: Daniel L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the garden house last weekend with my girlfriend. Our overall opinion is that the garden house is a good option for the price. Highlights: Staff are fantastic, very helpful, will do anything to make sure your stay is pleasant. Better than I have experienced in many hotels before. The bed was very comfortable, and the quality of the rooms was pretty high. Should be improved: Our bathroom had a slight smell of sewage sometimes (I think the smell came up through the drain in the bathroom). Wasn't bad enough to make us want to change rooms, but wasn't ideal Good, but not the best: Breakfast was OK, but only OK. Omelettes to order, quite a lot of choice. Bedroom was relatively small. Big enough for us, but if you like huge rooms, could be a problem. Thanks guys - we had a great stay. If you can make the improvements suggested above, we'll definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, fabulous location and a friendly personable and professional staff made for a great week in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of peace and excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CarolineandGM
Reviews.Content: If you want to lay back and enjoy Istanbul at your own pace, stay at Garden House. The staff were excellent and and made us feel completely at home. We are particularly grateful to Selcuk for all his assistance and hospitalty. We moved to Garden House on a friend's recommendation after we found our initial hotel too claustrophobic. We spent five wonderful nights and wished we could have stayed longer. We were even upgraded to the suite on the top floor which was gloriously spacious especially after the cramped little room in our first hotel. The setting is charming with a communal lounge in the garden where free soft drinks fruit and pastries are provided. It truly was an oasis of peace and hospitality in a vibrant and fascinating city. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, charming, committed staff and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Mamacasu
Reviews.Content: Friendly, charming, committed staff and quiet location, very near to most important historic areas.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, luxurious and well worth every Euro!”
Reviews.Author: Paula H
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by close friends, so trusted their judgment. There are so many hotels to choose from on here, this is why I felt compelled to write this review more than ever. CHOOSE THIS HOTEL, dont waste time looking elsewhere. I had one nights stop over in Istanbul, shame it wasnt longer. I was met by a smart looking young man who was my driver; the car was spotless, the driving was safe and easy despite the busy traffic. On arrival at the hotel I was greeted by a friendly Receptionist and The Manager (Mr Selcuk) met me and advised I had been upgraded. After a weeks healthy retreat in Gocek I was seeking some pampering. I didnt know what to expect. A guide through the hotel facilities (including free flowing snacks and drinks in the lounge area, sadly I didnt enjoy this but it looked great), and a walk through the beautiful, spacious gardens, up 2 flights of beautifully decorated stairs, and I was at my room. I felt like a princess, the room was fabulous - gold and decorated chair set and table, the biggest bed (was the comfiest bed Ive slept in, wish I couldve taken it home with me). There was a jacuzzie bath (which I enjoyed and floated in it was that big) and the floor was heated - sheer indulgence. There was a bottle of wine and water and fruit platter. TV was a bit limited but I wasnt in the room to watch a square screen. I opened the windows and enjoyed the sights, sounds and fresh air and smells of old town. The hotel was quiet, safe, comfortable, luxurious and exactly what I needed. It was spotlessly clean, the staff were impeccably dressed and respectful. As a sola traveller, I could not have felt more welcomed and relaxed, and in-place. Breakfast was amazing, and more than my requirements, home made omlettes a special favourite. My bags were stored safely for the day, I got changed and was chased as my car transfer was waiting for me to head to the airport. I can safely say with hand on heart that this was THE best hotel Ive stayed in, Ive travelled well and Im an ex HR Manager for Intercon Hotels, and I wish I had worked in a hotel like this. The management and staff couldnt do enough for me and were very personable. There are MANY hotels in the world that could learn a lot from this team. Thank you also to Mr Ayhan who I did not meet, who took my booking with faith and trust in me showing up. Next time Im more than happy to pay in advance to ensure I never miss out on staying at this hotel again. Istanbul, I will be back, but only if can stay in this hotel. Huge thanks Selcuk and Team, you were all amazing! The only issue was getting taxis to find its location - even with the business card map. I wasnt there long enough to suss out my location.

Reviews.Title: “Selcuk is the perfect host.”
Reviews.Author: Paddy G
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this hotel and had a very pleasant stay. The staff are extremely helpful and courteous. Selcuk offered us a lot of advice and upgraded us to a lovely room overlooking the courtyard. The double economy room we had to start with was below pavement level, small and damp. Other guests have commented on the amount of noise in the building and this is true. We unfortunately had a baby in the next room for four nights and it cried incessantly throughout the night. Why take a baby to a hotel where people have paid a lot for their rooms? One other point is that it is a fair walk to the main sites, which is a problem if you have mobility issues. Otherwise it is in a quiet residential area where you will not be harassed by traders.

Reviews.Title: “I was lucky staying in Garden House Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wassim J
Reviews.Content: The reason i chose this hotel is the ranking and reviews '' comments'' on the internet. i saw that everybody loved his stay there. i searched for the price, it was reasonable, but when i went there, I loved it. Clean, quiet, nice service, excellent breakfast, delicious food, perfect location to visit old Istanbul. I advised two of my relatives to go to Garden House when traviling to Turkey, and they went there and had the same feedback, they enjoy it. Wish to be there again, and wish you all the best.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Yanipr
Reviews.Content: It's a very charming hotel!! The staff is excellent and very helpful. The hotel is 10-15 minutes away of most of the important tourist sites. The rooms were very clean and well decorated. The staff was available 24/7 and helped us with anything we needed, even the guest relations Mgr. there is complimentary breakfast, snacks and beverages all the time and the restaurant is excellent for lunch and dinner, too!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish We Had Longer to Enjoy This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatNap9
Reviews.Content: We found the Garden House Hotel by accident when one of the neighboring hotels misplaced our reservation, but they took care of us by putting us up in the Garden House Hotel. We sure weren't disappointed. The hotel is tastefully decorated, clean and the staff were only too happy to help with anything that was needed. Our room was a special treat. The first King Sized bed we saw out of our whole 6 week vacation and so comfortable. The only regret is that we had to wake up at 4:45 am to head to the airport. And because of this we never got to experience the breakfast. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Garden House Hotel and we would definitely stay there again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous adress”
Reviews.Author: herve l
Reviews.Content: Really excellent address. Very nice rooms, top decoration, confortable, perfectly clean, people nice and always helpfull 24hours a day, good food at breakfast, well situed. If the weather is in a good mood, you shall have a wonderfull journey in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: haribo_13
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 Nights at the Garden House. The Hotel is perfect located near the important sights of the "old City". The Garden House is small but everything is clean and nice. The rooms are larger than expected and well equipped, therefore it's a very good quality at that price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: cmaitre
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel with friendly staff, nice rooms and perfect location close to the attractions. Go there you won't be disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: linda k
Reviews.Content: i spent 4 days in istanbul on my own and stayed at the garden house. their welcome was very warm and selcuk, the guest relations manager, took a lot of time to explain me and tell me about the city and the sights and gave me other advise. i've never experienced such a personal service at a hotel! the hotel itself is pretty, very clean, nice and small and has a beautiful terrace to chill out, to talk to selcuk, eat/drink or read. i would recommend the hotel to everyone and go there again!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana T
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, good location. I would definitely choose it again for another trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Traintravellers”
Reviews.Author: Hanne S
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a friendly staff and very good service. Charming outdoor area with trees and roses. We enjoyed the tea and coffee, fruits and nuts always available. Good sleep with good beds, the rooms are nice and clean, but many steps (no elevator). The location is very good with walking distance to historic sites and to the tram.

Reviews.Title: “perfect city-hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elsbeth en Bert B
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Garden House. A perfect location for visiting the old city with a warm welcome at the end of the day in the unique garden of the hotel. The facilities of the hotel are excellent and the staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “a charming place”
Reviews.Author: Hughes393
Reviews.Content: Charming place. I felt at home, the crew helped me a lot finding what I was looking for (musicians for a concert) They translated for me, proposed to accompany me at some appointments. The backyard is quiet and very comfortable. Excellent address, right in the historical center.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert v
Reviews.Content: The location was great and all major sights are on walking distance. Both diner and breakfast were good. transfer from airport and to cruise terminal was perfect arranged. The manager was very helpful in giving advice what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Cova O
Reviews.Content: Little bit hidden in the Sulatnahmet area. We were walking distance from all the main places to visit. The hotal staff was very helpfull. It was a great experience! The garden and the common zones was very homely. Ah! and nice breakfast, too!

Reviews.Title: “Condition of Washroom Poor”
Reviews.Author: Stars_Sky
Reviews.Content: Service was good. Manager of Hotel was very helpful and kind. Location was okay - a long walk to the tram but close to the historical sites near blue mosque. Breakfast was good as they had bread, fruit and an egg station. Decor of hotel and rooms appear old. There is a lovely garden room outside which offers free juice and water throughout the day - which is nice. The really bad aspect of our stay was the washrooms. Horrible condition of the tubs (mold, dirt, unclean) which made no sense as the toilets and sinks were new. We had to chance the first room because of the washroom and it really didn't make a difference as the second room's washroom was not that much better. In fact, I got an infection on my foot because of the condition of the bathtub. It was not worth the money we pay for the room. Because of the condition of the washroom I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the middle of Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Maria T
Reviews.Content: A fabulous place to stay! The hotel staff were just great, really helpful with eveything. The rooms were quiet and rather luxurious - a very nice surprise! We enjoyed the buffet breakfasts that included traditional dishes and thought that the complimentary terrace service was lovely. We were walking distance from all the main sights and we will certainly stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Garden House!”
Reviews.Author: Joan H
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Garden House during our 4 nights in Istanbul. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the rooms were very clean, and the location was great. It was nice to have a buffet breakfast every morning and a place to lounge and have drinks if we wanted. No worries about anything while staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: MoMo60
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of the main attractions in Sultanahmet, this hotel has a wonderful neighborhood feel and relaxing ambience. The terrace offers respite from the crowds and noise of the city at the end of the day, when guests can help themselves to light refreshments and soft drinks. Our third floor room was spacious and comfortable; despite street activity during the day, it was quiet at night. The staff was very friendly. Mr. Selcuk provided a map and a good orientation to the city upon our arrival as well as detailed directions to different sites during our stay. Breakfasts are sumptuous -- lots of fresh fruits and vegetables, cheeses, pastries, and more. We will return here if we come to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Garden House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayakmom1
Reviews.Content: My husband I and I stayed here for 4 nights and we loved this hotel. The rooms were very nice and the location was wonderful. The quite location was surprising. We were able to walk to all the major sites and return to a very quiet place in a very busy city. The garden out back was a refreshing place to sip tea after a busy day touring. The complementary wine and fruit was a nice touch. We would both stay here again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirikova
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for 1 night but we liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: florentins
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there for 5 nights. We've changed the room 2 times, first because they gave us a better room than our reservation and the second time because they gave us a poor room and we've asked them to change it. The floor rooms are very noisy, they're right near the street's sidewalk. The rooms look more like they belong to a 3* star hotel instead of 4. Breakfast was average, little diversification. The staff was friendly and helpful. Good location, near the Sultanahmet's center. Parking nearby.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in busy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Fs123
Reviews.Content: Close to a number of the main historic sites including the Blue Mosque, this Sultanahmet located small hotel takes you away from the hustle and bustle of the city for a refreshing break in its attractive and comfortable garden. Rooms meet the basic needs and the service is good overall - the aim is to please including a welcoming drink, arranging tours and recommending restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: R T
Reviews.Content: The great location in the heart of Sultanahmet is not what made this hotel excellent, rather the fantastic staff, who bent over backwards to make our stay as comfortable as possible and more like a home away from home. The maids kept our room spotless, the front desk assisted us in everything from booking tours to restaurant/club recommendations, and the wait staff not only kept our wine glasses full but we're more than gracious when tutoring us in our Turkish phrases crash course. Our room was typically small though still comfortable. The courtyard was always welcoming and fully stocked with water, fresh fruit, cookies, etc, free of charge. The simple breakfast buffet was a more than adequate beginning to the day. The free wifi was also a huge convenience. Walking distance to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, as well as the tram which will take you to Taksim for more restaurants or nightlife. Look forward to staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for yours Great hospitality;)”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixNy
Reviews.Content: I believe we stayed in the most perfect hotel in blue mosque area. me and my husband loved garden house. They have excellent service and staff. You gonna find there what you wish as a vocation. You gonna love their Turkish style breakfast. Also when you want to take a little rest, their lovely garden gonna help you for that.

Reviews.Title: “A very good base for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Arjar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the cheaper ground level rooms. The room was excellent (immaculately clean; enormous 4 poster bed; plenty of storage; large 'wet room' marble floored bathroom). The hotel facilities were excellent (copious buffet breakfast and free coffee, soft drinks and snacks through the day; free internet or wi-fi). The staff were very professional and keen to help. It's a 10 minute walk to the Hippodrome but in a nice quiet area. They picked us up from the airport for free and made the return trip easy. All in all, a very good base from which to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “What a 'fabulous experience'”
Reviews.Author: steven g
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 glorious nights & 4 days at this beautiful boutique hotel. In our opinion it's a 5 star hotel. The room at the top with balcony couldn't have been better prepared. The bed was comfy, with fresh soft pillows. The view could have been slightly more pictureseque, if some of the high level tree branches where trimmed. The breakfast was the best we've experienced and the staff ultra friendly, courtious and professional. Champagne & flowers (red roses) where in the room as per request. Airport transfers where spot on.What more can we say. See you again next spring...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: EUnsal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Garden House Hotel in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul and it was a pleasure. The location is very convenient for a tourÄ±stic holiday: 10 min walk to Grand Bazaar, Ayasofya, Blue Mosque. Easy access to Sirkeci where you can easily take the boat to the Asian side or take any other cruise to explore the city further. The hotel itself is great, clean, comfortable, the food is delicious. The hotel has a garden where you can relax and enjoy refreshments, fresh fruits, some turkish delicasies all day (and free of charge too). Most importantly the staff is extremely friendly, and they are ready to help with anything. The owner Aziz Bey and the manager Selcuk Bey are always present in the premises and make sure their guests are welcome. I stayed there with my family and it felt like home. It is a great place for everybody who wants to enjoy their time in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Benn Cyprus”
Reviews.Author: Zane17
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel, very relaxing place. The staff could not do enough for you. near all the tourist attractions. I can say only positive things about this hotel and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gabriela551
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location, very nice stuff, we really enjoyed staying there. We really appreciated breakfast that was delicious and varied, perfect for all tastes. The interior garden is wanderful and we loved having a drink there. I totally loved this place, I will recommend it to my friends and I would recommend it to anyone that wants to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring, plus a lovely place to relax.”
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for exploring Istanbul on foot. It was a short walk to the city's most famous sights, as well as many fascinating streets and alleyways within just a few blocks. The quiet garden courtyard - where we could sit and have a beverage and a snack at any time - was the ideal spot for relaxing and refreshing ourselves for the next adventure. For those evenings when we ran out of steam, we were glad for the hotel restaurant as an alternative to going out. We also really appreciated the staff's help with making recommendations and booking tours, performances and transportation. We felt well-taken care of throughout our stay. My only complaint is the early morning call to prayer that sounded daily around 5am - very "atmospheric" but not always welcome at that time of day!

Reviews.Title: “Rose Garden House - "A Rose, by any other name, is still a Rose!"”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, composed of a few buildings around a rose garden. The staff is very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't the best nor the worst of times....”
Reviews.Author: Fillanderer
Reviews.Content: Lets get things straight.... If you are looking for a luxury boutique hotel then this isn't it. But its very nice, very friendly, comfortable rooms, nice touches but luxury it isn't. I only ever stay in boutique hotels and I would class the Garden House as a 3 star european standards. The reception area needs to be changed as first impressions are very important and unfortunately the reception lets the hotel down. There is a pleasant decked area for breakfast, dinner or just sipping tea and spending downtime from the bustle of Istanbul. We stayed in an 'ottoman' styled room in the new annex - nicely appointed, great bathroom, great shower (which tended to flood the floor), flat screen tv, minibar, soft towels etc etc. Downside was that if you are elderly or a small child the steps would be a serious challenge. Reception staff were really friendly and helpful - breakfast staff less so - a bit surly at times. Breakfast was fine - can't understand why there are a few complaints. There were european options and local delicacies. They could do with providing cappucino's but Turkish coffee was fine. The only downside is that to get to the main tourist areas is a short 15 minute walk - but its up a very steep hill. So by the time you've done it 2 or 3 times a day it starts to get annoying... very annoying... or maybe I was just becoming too indolent. Stay at the Garden House - set your expectations first - its a nice place, the rooms are fine, staff are friendly. Its good value for money and do take advantage of the airport - hotel transfer service.

Reviews.Title: “The best, the staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aryndel_Aram
Reviews.Content: After trabeling a lot all ober the world, this year we decided to go to Turkey. We reserved for three nights and we stayed four because we were very comftable in this hotel. It was a very important trip for my husband and I, a kind of honey moon and we were very happy of ou choise. When we read about kidness of the staff we couldn't imagine how true it is. They worried about us at all moment. Even the manager helped us with our next destination, Capadocia. He really worried about it. The hotel is clean and well decorated. The breakfast was very complete! Even they do omelettes at the moment. We will recommend this hotel to everyone we know!!! And we recomend it to everyone who wants to go to Istambul for quality/price, because of it's ubication, but most of it because of it's staff. See you soon around the world! "Sorry if my english is not perfect..."

Reviews.Title: “to find your expectations”
Reviews.Author: lancelot17
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel two months ago and then i read some bad reviews about rose garden that its page. although i frightened this hotel because of reviews, i stayed here. i think that reviews are unfair and wrong. my room was large had a very comfortable bed and a balcony overlooking the garden. It is a small friendly hotel and staff. The location is perfect, it really is located on a less than 5-minute stroll from the Blue Mosque in a quiet, peaceful, safe area. certainly, some reviews don't reflect facts. i have never regret to stay garden house. whenever i go to istanbul stay garden house.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: walshie82
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the hotel, the hotel is beautiful and in a very nice location. The restaurant at the end of the road CESME is the best food at the best price. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jayar930
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Garden House 5 times in the past few years, and it's like coming home each time. As a woman traveling alone or with a friend, that is huge. My travel agent first recommended it, so I had no personal reco,but since then the staff has become like friends. They make me feel welcome and valued as a customer. They know Istanbul inside out - tours, directions -plus everyone's English is amazing- even the night staff and kitchen staff. But the quality & attention to detail is what I value - everything is spotless, beds are super-comfortable, rooms are quiet and spacious for a city hotel, and very beautiful. Details matter- like free fruit in your room every day, water bottles, free snacks in the afternoon and an overwhelming breakfast spread literally from fruit to nuts! (I watched the staff re-fill each platter of fruit, cereal, eggs, yoghurt or cheese on the buffet the instant it gets even a little low-) Location is prime- just down the hill from the Blue Mosque- but the people set the tone. The garden has tripled in size in the past 3 years.A great place for a quiet read, a drink or dinner. I think it's the best kept small-hotel secret in Istanbul, for vacation or business.

Reviews.Title: “will stay here again when in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: anainasia
Reviews.Content: I stayed only for a night transiting for 24 hours in Istanbul but it was a great experience! Fresh fruit and wine in the room when I arrived - lovely room and bathroom. I had 8hours till going to the airport and could leave my laguge at the hotel and hang out several hours in the evening enjoying free coffee and juice and fruit in the courtyard, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I will be back and recommended garden house to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch + little extra”
Reviews.Author: olgaktv
Reviews.Content: Before booking this hotel Iâ€™ve read reviews on internet and my expectations were high. But upon arrival they managed to exceed them! Needless to say â€“ it has all what you expect: clean and friendly with cozy shaded terrace (blooming roses!) + rooms are very tastefully decorated. But on top of that hotel offers these little extras, which make your stay truly relaxed and pleasurable, like fruit basket on arrival, complimentary snacks and drinks buffet to enjoy between visit to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia (both just few minutes on foot) and help with bookings / taxi if you need one. Even towels are super-soft and high quality! Better than we had in Four Seasons/Sydney and that is a good standard! At the end of the visit they have arranged our shuttle to the airport that was fast, convenient and hassle free for as little as 5 EUR / person. During our stay we felt like precious guests â€“ canâ€™t get an attitude like that in a chain hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Gretel798
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent, and was on a leisure trip with my husband through Germany and Switzerland, before spending the last 2 nights in Istanbul before returning home. I had used this hotel often for clients, all of whom were very satisfied, and many of whom made repeat visits. So of course I had to experience it for myself. This is a little gem! Very well located in the Sultanahmet area, with all the major sights no more than a 30 minute walk away. The room was beautifully appointed, the breakfast excellent, with the added value of access to fruit, cookies, tea and coffee throughout the day free of charge. The staff, all of whom we saw, are young, willing and helpful. I will have no hesitation to continue booking this hotel for my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ivan L
Reviews.Content: We recently made our first trip to Istanbul and chose Garden Suites Hotel off the net because it was close to major historical sites, had a garden and was describes as gay friendly. We were very happy without choice. Our room was large had a very comfortable bed and a balcony overlooking the garden. It is a small friendly hotel and attracted a mature clientele. Staff gave us great advice, arranged transfers and for laundry to be done at a very reasonable rate. The hotel is low key and we were not pressured to buy tours. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and more, definitely recommend it to my friends”
Reviews.Author: Lisette R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom for a long weekend. The hotel had everything we wanted. The location is perfect, it really is located on a less than 5-minute stroll from the Blue Mosque in a quiet, peaceful, safe area. The Mehmet Pasa Mosque is situated a 100 m away, another beautiful spot (and no prayer calls from loudspeakers). The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, they made us feel at home in Istanbul. The hotel is beautiful (due to the all wooden building), the lovely interior, the comfortable nice rooms and a real treat is the cool and flowery garden for a quiet start in the morning or a relaxed drink at the end of a sightseeing day. And not to be forgotten: an abundant breakfast with pastries, fresh fruits, eggs made to order and so much more and coffee/tea and cookies all day long (on the house...). When I go back to Istanbul, they will be the first on my list to contact for availability of rooms !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Niklas T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Garden House for a week and we really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is cozy and the rooms are nice, even though we did'nt get the one displayed on the picture of our order. The breakfeast on the hotel was delicous and included pretty much everything you could desire. The biggest plus about the hotel is the service. Especially the regular night receptionist named Bora was obliging and welcoming everytime we arrived at the hotel. The restaurant staff was really serviceminded aswell. The hotel is really close (like 7-10 mins walking time) to most attractions, like Sultan Ahmed Mosque and Haya Sofia. The only minus (and probably the only minus about the hotel) is that everytime you have to go to the center there is huge hill you have to walk which really drains your energy early in your day. All in all a great experience at hotel Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveler123028
Reviews.Content: In a wonderful, old part of Istanbul, the location was splendid; close to shopping and the major sites that we were interested in. It felt really safe and was very interesting to walk and browse. The hotel manager was accommodating and warm. He upgraded our room at his own initiation. The breakfast was bountiful and delicious. Go there! You'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “We really love it, and wish come back again.”
Reviews.Author: atailkegode
Reviews.Content: Great Boutique and Honeymoon Hotel in Sultanahmet:))) The Garden House Hotel offers friendly and attentive service at its great location in Old City Istanbul near the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The hotel has a very romantic. They offer a full breakfast with omelets to order. We loved it and recommend it warmly

Reviews.Title: “If we return to Istanbul, we'll stay at Garden House.”
Reviews.Author: tatyana90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient location. It has a very hospitalary atmosphere! Very clean and neat. The personal is very helpfull.They offer a full breakfast with omelets to order.. The hotel restaurant was good.Room came with a small complimentary bottle of wine, a fruit basket (with banana, kiwi,Ananas etc), and a 1.5 liter bottle of water. If we return to Istanbul, we'll stay at Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with exemplary service. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dvs112
Reviews.Content: Garden House is a great hotel, made totally wonderful by the warmth of its staff. The staff goes out its way to make your stay pleasant. As we were vegetarians, our restaurant host made special vegetarian dishes for the complimentary breakfast. The guest relations person guided us to the best attractions and clubs in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is perfect if you are a tourist. Its 200 mts from the Blue Mosque and Aga Sophia. There are great restaurants and cafes in the surrounding. The housekeeping staff was extremely efficient. The rooms were made spic and span everyday. The sheets and towels provided in the rooms were of the highest quality. In all, we loved our stay and will love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: annrow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden House twice and was very happy there. The rooms are nice and the people are helpful and friendly. The location is perfect for getting to all the tourist sites. The hotel provides a complementary fruit basket and bottle of wine which was lovely. The restaurant was good too. The staff is really great. I would go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “You cant go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: MelonPete
Reviews.Content: This hotel is working very hard to provide what city visitors need. Rooms are modern but in an old building, service excellent, breakfast good, air-con silent, fruit in the room, free bottle of wine, masses of hot water (we had a jacuzzi) and really close to the Blue Mosque. Its slightly difficult to find on the first occasion so get them to pick you up / arrange transport to and from the airport. This is cheaper than public transport. Only one thing might disturb you. Its close enough to a mosque to hear the call to prayer late at night and very early in the morning but then so are most of the hotels in this lovely quarter of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Littlesimba21
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is just a short walk to the blue mosque, grand bazaar and various restruants. It is located in a quiet neighborhood. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Staff is friendly and provided little unexpected free extras (e.g., large bottle of water, 1/2 bottle of wine, fruit basket, etc.). Breakfast was plentiful and they were able to accomadate our early depature breakfast starting time. Had a nice garden area to sit and relax in after a long busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: YouWentWhere
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Garden House is wonderful. They are very helpful and thoughtful. We mentioned that it was our daughter's birthday and they arranged for a delicious birthday cake and helped us celebrate by singing happy birthday. The sincere hospitality is a rare occurrence at many hotels and we can honestly say we felt very comfortable at this hotel. Our room was in the new building so it was updated, clean and a good size for 3 adults. There is no lift so be prepared for stairs. The walk to many main attractions was not far and because it is slightly removed from the action it was quiet. We are very happy we stayed here and highly recommend the Garden House!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: hiitraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice staff and garden. The rooms were also very comfortable. Close to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet gem in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: CPWagga
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Garden House, the rooms were very comfortable and staff, particularly Melis, very pleasant and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel as it was in a very quiet area Sultanahmet away from the noise and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and hospitable.”
Reviews.Author: MsMDesai
Reviews.Content: We zeroed in on Garden House after seeing the reviews and pictures on tripadvisor. Not only was the location excellent the hotel too was a delight. Unlike big hotels which are often impersonal this hotel is charming and the staff very friendly. A definite YES for those planning a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Istanbul stay. So central to everything.”
Reviews.Author: mcdougall48
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this place. Well priced, 5-10 min walk to many venues...Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Sophia, Palace, a thousand restaurants, tram line. Great staff, (English translation for most of them a problem but can usually make do). Good breakfast bar and garden area, rooms are fine (we stayed on two occasions in different rooms, both good). Old city location is best for all round touristing in Istanbul. From here can tram or walk to Galata Bridge and access ferries to Asia. Would recommend to anyone wishing to stay in mid range boutique family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Manuel_planta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient location. It has a very hospitalary atmosphere! Very clean and neat. The personal is very helpfull. We had a complicated trip: the volcano in chile just exploded, and all the planes where delayed. The hotel help us a lot in changing our bookings. both with them and also with our following trip. i would go back to this hotel for sure! the breakfast are in a beautifull backyard. traditional turkish breakfast, and contenital style aswell. A+!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: upsolsen
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect and within walking distance from all atractions. Breakfast was good and the staff did all they could to make us enjoy the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JumeirahJenny
Reviews.Content: The Garden House is located within walking distance of the main attractions: the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Sultanahment Square, the Covered Bazaar, and many other great sites. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The front desk staff helped book me on a cruise on the Bosporus and made recommendations to me in regards to a visit to a haman. I stayed in a Junior Suite. It featured a balcony and a haman-like bathroom. The furniture was nice and the bed was quite comfortable. The room was decorated simple, but nice with lots of pillows. A special bonus was the breakfast and afternoon snacks provided by the hotel. Breakfast included: breads, made-to-order omelets, fresh fruit, dried fruits, tea, coffee, and juice. Fruits and cheeses were also provided throughout the afternoon at no charge. Lunch and dinner are available to purchase, however the meals are overpriced and the many options found around town are a better choice. Overall, I had a pleasant stay at the Garden House and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Gret Staff”
Reviews.Author: Raulmanny
Reviews.Content: It is with absolute pleasure that I recommend this cozy hotel. The location is perfect: walking distance from the Blue Mosque and AyaSofia as well as the Sultanahmet Tran stations. The staff is VERY helpful. They organized for us a trip (decided at the last moment) to Ephesus and help us with visits to the Galate Tower and the Turkish Baths.. The accommodations are very good and breakfast buffet is succulent! If you go please visit the Arasta Bazaar (closeby too)

Reviews.Title: “This is a charming hotel, close to major attractions, with a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Redshino
Reviews.Content: Melis, the customer relations person on duty the night we arrived went way beyond the call of duty in helping me track down my daughter whose plane was delayed. We loved sitting in the leafy courtyard sipping wine & reading after a long day of walking. The breakfast was very good. The hotel restaurant was good if somewhat expensive. If we return to Istanbul, we'll stay at Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: ZigZagGuy
Reviews.Content: The Garden House Hotel offers friendly and attentive service at its great location in Old City Istanbul near the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. After an exhausting day of seeing the city, enjoy snacks and a drink on the rose garden patio. They offer a full breakfast with omelets to order. The third floor junior suite is spacious and well appointed. We enthusiastically recommend the Garden House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be”
Reviews.Author: jem029
Reviews.Content: A perfect location to begin a visit of the town. Very nice room. Everybody very kind. We loved it and recommend it warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWidow
Reviews.Content: This is a really pretty little hotel. The staff were nice and friendly. Good value with free wi-fi broadband throughout hotel and free-flow snacks and drinks throughout the day at the restaurant. I would definitely come back here. Just to add, do let the hotel know in advance if your luggages are big. The hotel has no lifts and it may be a problem if you are placed on the 4th Floor like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: Qays_Haji
Reviews.Content: I spent one week with family and I can say they have very friendly & helpful staff. From the very first moment we arrived they give us the feel we are home specially for my 7 years daughter. For sure my next trip to Istanbul I'll come to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If all hotels could be this accommodating”
Reviews.Author: hannahCambridge_nz
Reviews.Content: A real high-light of our recent trip was the warm welcome and lovely atmosphere of the garden courtyard on our first day in Istanbul. While recieving complimentary refreshments all options and questions on site-seeing were at our fingertips from the well organised team. Then the rooms, the newly renovated suites were a delight and something to look forward to each evening we returned to the hotel. Lots of attention to detail with complimentary fruits and drinks, an all day buffet of ,local foods - no this was not a 5 start internatinal hotel, but a great 5 star local family hotel doing a fantastic job!!

Reviews.Title: “Started bad, ended good. Very helful staff”
Reviews.Author: Budapest09
Reviews.Content: The story started very bad with Garden House, because when I arrived, the room I had booked was occupied (the small suite with a balcony and a sea view). I was proposed several rooms, but I rejected all of them (no balcony, no sea view). Then I was proposed by the hotel owner (I guess) to look on the internet, and I could find the hotel I wanted in Istanbul, they would pay the transfer and the hotel bill whatever are the costs (very generous offer). Still my criteria were terrace and sea view in Sultanahmet, so no thousand of rooms like this. At the end, because I had difficulties to find something, they proposed me to go to the hotel next door, very very nice one, and I had a very big room, WITH my terrace and my sea view, so I was HAPPY! The next day, they proposed me to stay at the hotel nex door, or to move back to their hotel, and I moved back. And I had the room I wanted, very nice one also. So frankly speaking, not talking about the hundred of excuses I had from the hotel, from different people (like my story was really unusual), I have to say that it is a crisis situation perfectly handled, for customer satisfaction. I was impressed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bath_UKPatrickL
