Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new annexe (Rose Garden House) which was very nicely fitted out and furnished. Room was quiet and had all the facilities we needed. We suggested a couple of improvements re. cooling and blinds. Our first visit to Istanbul which we found fascinating. Hotel is in excellent location for walking to many of the important sites. One of the managers, Ayhan, was very helpful with advice on where and when to go places. Useful because weekend visitors can get tied up with large crowds from cruise ships and some sites are closed on Monday or Tuesday. Also very helpful with recommending places to eat and arranging visit to Turkish Baths. Hotel had snacks & soft drinks available all day, free of charge. This is a very nice touch. Hotel arranged a private cruise up the Bosphorus for a small group of its guests which was most enjoyable. Lasted about four hours with a guide providing commentary. Departed at a civilised hour and returned in plenty of time to visit the sites around Eminonu. All the staff were helpful and cheerful at all times. We hope to make a return visit before too long to take in more of the sites we didn't have time for.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN SULTANAHMET”
Reviews.Author: GulayErener
Reviews.Content: Please disregard NEGATIVE comments about this hotel because it is not true. I have been to Turkey on many occassions and have stayed in hotels at Sultanahmet but If cleanliness, location, service, convenience, staff helpfulness, amenities, and value are important for you, this hotel is perfect and is the BEST in sultanahmet. I would highly recommend Garden House to anyone travelling to Istanbul. It is perfectly located near both the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Aside from travelling to and from the airport, every major attraction is within walking distance. The staff are extremely courteous and helpful they go out of there way to plan out days providing you with recommendations and directions, and set up transportation for your return to the airport. The quality of service sets this hotel apart from every establishment. If you are at all considering a trip to Turkey I would highly recommend the Garden House hotel to other travellers and gaurantee that you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, pricey and dated. Forget about the so called charming 'old' style hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Capt_James_Crook
Reviews.Content: There's nothing special about the Garden House building. The rooms are clean but dated. All very very much overpriced. Garden House is a so called charming old style building, forget about that and move on to the new Istanbul hotels. Staff by the way is patient, very helpfull and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Great and "beautifull" place to be...”
Reviews.Author: panlaville
Reviews.Content: When you arrive in istanbul the city is to big to understand. The hotel Is near the blue mosque and Hyppodrome. The moment you enter the hotel the person behind the counter takes away all your doubts. He starts by introducing the hotel and the city. The map is all ready to be used and in 2 secs you are in the center of istanbul. the rooms are Beautifull and taken care off every morning. I loved this place and the friendly people who run it. If i go back i am surely ready to have another stay at the garden house.

Reviews.Title: “GH was warm, caring, hospitable, yet quietly efficient, clean and comfortable aestheically done up rooms, dining space,”
Reviews.Author: mondiira
Reviews.Content: Garden House was our entry point to Turkey . It could not have been a better introduction, to the warmth and friendliness, the quiet efficiency, the friendliness,the cleanliness and aesthetics of the Turkish people. The delightful lil' garden inside the hotel which when too cold to sit out in open air, could be enjoyed as the dining hall was in it only warmed by the glass enclosure. I was travelling with my aunt who is over 80,and they made her feel so comfortable, she did not want to move out at all. At the end of our trip she extended her stay and went back to Garden House, and returned as smitten by the warmth, beautifully done up spaces, and the bountiful breakfast, served with great elan by Sybelle, an artist , and it was evident in the way she laid out the table.My accolade is not complete without mentioning Selchuk, who received us, and always available for assistance.We felt as comfortable as staying with old friends.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful room with outstanding, personal service”
Reviews.Author: sundrenchedleaves
Reviews.Content: As we were visiting right at the start of the season, the hotel wasn't full and we were instantly upgraded to the 'executive suite' on the top floor - a beautiful spacious suite with a private balcony and jacuzzi - a fantastic start! The staff were exceptionally helpful and courteous. Breakfast is served in a lovely setting - a conservatory overlooking their courtyard. It was simple but a hearty start to the day. Location - a couple of minutes' walk from the main sites through interesting backstreets. Would definitely return for a quiet, quality and affordable place in stay in central Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Big free breakfast, king beds with down duvets”
Reviews.Author: hihi024
Reviews.Content: Great! They helped a lot with general information and with arrangements in cappadocia. Very kind staff. Included welcome basket with wine. Nice 1st floor terrace with indoor and outdoor seating. I would definately come again. Prompt email replies. Free, fast wi-fi. Fridge in room.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to enjoy your trip - Clean, organized, proactive and generous”
Reviews.Author: BiKO_2011
Reviews.Content: I am visiting Turkey for a honeymoon, and as i stepped into the hotel I thought it is even better than what the reviews indicate. The staff here is very friendly, very generous. I reserved a standard double room, but the hotel gave me a suit as a honeymoon compliment. Their service is very organized and the staff is very helpful, even in recommending, booking, cancelling, delaying trips. They provide more than one option for almost everything. I think they are a good representative of the kind, and funny Turkish people in Istanbul. I had an issue with the phone in my room, and it was fixed once I reported the problem. Room service is one other reason why I liked this hotel. But again, what comes first to my mind as I remember this hotel is the nice hospitality, and proactive help of the staff with their smiling faces esp. Mr. Seljuk at the reception :)

Reviews.Title: “Just, love it!”
Reviews.Author: nerkaj
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, no matter what is the reason for your coming to Istanbul. Even on business trip, I found myself home there. Nothing to complain on, such a warm hospitality, kindness and the service hardly found ever before. Cute, small, nicely furnished, luxury with taste. Lovely garden, delicilous food and wines...what else to say, my God! So spoilling place...easy to get addicted. Just love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Try to upgrade if you can.”
Reviews.Author: OCskipper
Reviews.Content: So I am sitting in the room with nothing to do (7 am). Cannot go to sleep because of all the noise. We arrived in Instanbul last night from Germany. The Hotel is at a great location, very near the attractions (less than 10 min). There is a hill you have to walk up. We took the taxi from the airport and it was 32.50 TL. The reason I am sitting here and writing this is because I am going to see if I can upgrade the room. We are in the annex and the room is next to the street. The street is not too busy but there is some sort of construction outside. Not only do I hear the workers talk, I can also smell their cigarette. Also the annex room is next to the stairs of the hotel. I can hear all the guests coming back at night. If you are a light sleeper you should avoid the rooms that are on the wing. I am not going to complain if I cannot upgrade. I got this great deal from hotels.com at $88 USD per night (economy double). What a bargain! The room has no bath, just a very small shower. It is very basic and small. Just a bed more or less (very similar to a boutique hotel in NYC or Paris). We received a welcome drink. I got a beer and my wife got some juice. There was also a welcome basket in the room. Overall the first night of the three nights has been average. I gave it 4 stars because of the price and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place and Hospitable Host”
Reviews.Author: ChristineN22
Reviews.Content: We booked a comfort double bed for four nights and, to our surprise, the host upgraded us to a suite immediately upon our arrival. It was a beautiful and spacious room with turkish bath and a bottle of wine on the house. The staffs were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is great as it is only a few blocks to the Blue Mosque. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: xaloq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden House Hotel during a 4-day escape to Istanbul with my girlfriend. Our stay couldnÂ´t have been better. We didnÂ´t have to wait one minute to be picked up at the airport. The transfer service is included in the price if you book directly through the hotelÂ´s website. When I arrived, very early in the morning, I was offered to have free breakfast, which I would have typically had to pay in most hotels. Our room was not big but spotless clean, very luminous and had a nice bathroom. The location is fabulous, just 5 min away from the Blue Mosque. Free WiFi internet access at a decent speed. The hotel staff at reception was extremely helpful and friendly. Thank you Selcuk and Bulent! Overall: an excellent pick if youÂ´re looking for a conveniently located boutique hotel to visit the main attractions and donÂ´t mind having to climb some stairs in return for the charming environment. WeÂ´ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: londonhappytripper77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Istanbul, where we stayed at the Garden House Hotel, we booked this hotel based on the positive feedback we read on the TA forum and we werenâ€™t disappointed, the hotel is perfectly located to visit the major tourist attractions in the city and also close to the tram line. The staff is genuinely friendly and courteous. The rooms are very clean and the one we stayed at very spacious and tastefully decorated. The breakfast was just fantastic great choice and abundant, it certainly sets us off for a day of sightseeing. Additionally I will mention a couple of nice places to eat very close to the hotel, The Cesme restaurant which you will find by turning right after exiting the hotel and right again at the bottom of the hill, the restaurant is on your left, it is not pretentiously decorated but it serves very nice food at very reasonable prices, also further along on your left you could try the Siya Baba cafÃ©/restaurant, very basic with excellent food and dead cheap, needless to say in both of these places you will be served with a big smile. Enjoy Istanbul, we certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mack40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden house for one night at the end of a week long stay in Istanbul. Our other hotel couldn't accomodate us on our last night so we switched here as it was nearby. We were disappointed that we hadn't spent the full week here as it was far superior to our other hotel. We arrived shortly after checking out of our other hotel, and as our room wasn't yet ready (understandable at 9am), the receptionist very kindly invited us to have breakfast on the house, before we set off for a few hours into the city. When we arrived back, we were upgraded to an beautiful room overlooking the garden, far superior from the one we left at the other hotel. You have to remenber in the old city that buildings are very small, most have winding staircases with no lifts; so to have a very good size room just 2 flights up was a welcome change. We ate dinner in the hotel that evening because it was our last evening before an early flight the next day, we were tired, needed to pack and it looked good value from the menu. All was satisfactory, but, because there are lots of restaurants nearby, the restaurant was very quiet. I'm sure that would be different in peak season. The hotel is well located in the Old town, about a 5-10min walk (uphill, like everywhere else) from the Blue Mosque and beyond. it's possible to walk to all the major attractions, Grand Bazaar, etc. The tram system is near the Blue Mosque in any event. Breakfast was very good, a decent buffet, and omlettes cooked on request Overall, i was very impressed with this hotel, and have no issue with recommending it. the staff are very helpful, good room, there is internet etc, breakfast very good, good location, nothing else needed

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJBruin
Reviews.Content: - Nice atmosphere - Quiet street - Close to Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Museum of Islamic art - Very helpfull staff! - Perfect breakfast - Lovely room

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: ridwanchandiwala
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay here because its very close to the best monuments to be seen in Istanbul city in Sultanahmet area. The staff was very co-operative & pleasing. I really enjoyed the stay except that the room was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mschneider
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden House for three nights, the first week in March. I had an excellent stay! Rooms were clean, modern and appeared to be recently remodeled. All of the staff including the older gentleman behind the front desk were very friendly. Breakfast was excellent, and there are tasty complimentary pastries available throughout the rest of the day. The city was very cold this time of year, and it was great to return to a cozy hotel at the end of a day of sightseeing. If I return to Istanbul I wouldn't hesitate to return. If you have any mobility issues, unfortunately this hotel isn't appropriate as it's located at the bottom of a very steep hill. If you are taking the light rail/tram from the airport to the hotel, get off at the Ã‡emberlitaÅŸ stop, walk down Peykhane Cd (there is a modern/large cosmetics store on the corner), when you come across a Chinese Restaurant on the right side of the street, turn right, keep walking downhill until the street ends, make a left, and a quick right and you will see the Garden House. It's a very recognizable reddish building.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & service, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KittyMoskow
Reviews.Content: The staff was very attenetive and friendly. Real clean and comfortable rooms. Hamam was very pleasant . Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with extremely helpful staff, perfect position for exploring the culture!”
Reviews.Author: KateH33
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely comfortable with very friendly and welcoming staff. It was in the perfect position to explore the cultural highlights of Istanbul on foot although the tram service was useful and very good value. The hotel was spotlessly clean and there was always a snack available in the dining room to keep you going until dinner at no charge. I was most impressed that when I accidentally left my wallet behind in the room safe, it was sent back to me promptly again at no charge despite my instructions to use the pounds inside it!

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base for enjoying a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: 186370Paul
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in an ideal location for seeing all the sights of this historical city. Mr Selcuk at reception and the Ayhan the business manager were both extremely helpful ensuring our short stay of 3 nights went as smoothly as possible. The availability of a variety of biscuits and fruit throughout the day free of charge was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Reyuae
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic location. What an amazing staff. I am planning to visit again and again. Thank you everyone and huge thanks to Aziz . Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “great getaway - but not for the disabled”
Reviews.Author: pitpat55
Reviews.Content: although we were looking for winter sunshine, decided to go to istanbul regardless of the miserable weather forecast especially as the pics of the garden house were so appealing. as far as decor and location was concerned we were not disappointed - the hotel looks recently refurbished - everything from top to bottom immaculate and decorated in very pleasant colours. the hospitality was great - very friendly and helpful. the buffet breakfast was lovely - a surprisingly wide variety for such a small hotel, with everything fresh every morning. we did eat at the hotel restaurant one evening and the food was lovely - especially as it was cooked on the spot and served the instant it was ready. the location is very handy for the blue mosque and grand bazaar, palace etc etc but the downside to this is that it is not really suitable for those of us less nimble on our feet. i found myself wishing i'd come years ago when i was fit, healthy and able to walk properly because the steepness of the hill on which the hotel is situated is no easy task, especially as the streets are cobbled, very narrow and no pavement to speak of. the hotel would do well to install a handrail to the steps down into the reception from the street and the only other thing i would suggest would be some sort of lounge area. this isn't so much of an issue for summer travellers as i have no doubt the area around the blue mosque is a very pleasant place to sit and relax after a hard day's visiting, but alas not on a cold wet february day or evening, as the rooms didn't have armchairs or sofa and, sadly, the beds were hard and lumpy. my recommendation would come with limits.

Reviews.Title: “The best welcome in the world”
Reviews.Author: LinRugeley
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in all classes of hotels all over the world and this one takes some beating. On arrival we were given an upgrade to a superior room (without asking) the room was fab with everything you could wish for including a complimentary bottle of wine and basket of fruit. There were toiletries, bath robes and slippers and everything was immaculately clean. Breakfast each morning was wonderful with a great selection of food to sustain a days sightseeing in breathtaking Istanbul. All the staff in the hotel were really pleasant but Selcuk on reception was particularly helpful, nothing was too much trouble and he gave us some invaluable information about the city. In my opinion this hotel is 5*

Reviews.Title: “Garden House Hotel great stay”
Reviews.Author: anihoxha
Reviews.Content: Quiet Area although we stayed in February, still i don't think there were bars or stuff around to make noise at night, however close enough to go to noisy places. Hospitality of the Hotel, great. Friendly people with good will to help. Room (our room) Pink Junior Suite, perfect. We didn't expect it to be so nice. A mix of oriental details without lacking the practical everything. You felt what you are supposed to feel in Istanbul, the mix flavor of the European with the Oriental. Buffet/Restaurant, delightful, especially in sunny days; glass surrounded with a little garden in front and very nice peaceful colors inside and out. Breakfast is breakfast so nothing to comment about. Buffet had all you have to eat to be able to endure a touristic day. Overall, strongly recommend from OUR experience.

Reviews.Title: “The staff in Garden House were nicest people I have met in istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: katerynafedorenko
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely happy about everything. nice weather,nice city and nice hotel and very friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “An excellent welcome and a lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: sbrom1ss
Reviews.Content: Two couples stayed for three nights and the welcome we received from Selcuk was superb. He very efficiently booked us in to upgraded rooms and then gave us a very warm introduction to Istanbul, with maps, tour options etc. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were lovely, breakfast excellent and the location was very central for the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar etc. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central location and a warm and frindly welcome, second to none.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous place, i would stay there again and again”
Reviews.Author: beckyviola
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is such a huge city that it's really worth to find a hotel in exactly the right place for all the attractions. Garden House is perfectly situated less than 10 minutes walk to the major places, and only 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. It's not on a main road so relatively quiet, and is located in a safe, peaceful area with good local shops and restaurants. The staff could not be more helpful - we had flu our whole visit and they went out of their way to provide medicine and tea around the clock. The buffet for breakfast is huge and all the staff have excellent knowledge of what to do in the local area. The rooms are individually designed, yet extremely welcoming and comfortable. When we go again, I would not stay anywhere else in Istanbul. This place is great! I cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful introduction to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: shwmcc
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a great trip to Istanbul, staying in the Garden House Hotel. I'd emailed in advance, asking to be met at the airport (about â‚¬30 each way at the time of writing) - which was much simpler than getting a shuttle bus and trying to find our way round the streets with cases. The rooms were fine - two adjoining (with a bowl of luscious ripe fruit in each - and a bottle of wine) - scrupulously clean, too. Our double bed was a shade on the small side, though. Breakfasts were great - good choice, and lots of it; not many concessions to non-Turkish tastes, but that suited us fine. The real bonus of the hotel was the personal attention from the owner, Mr Selzuk. When we'd settled in, he took us through the street plan of the city, with a cup of lovely Turkish tea. He'd got several recommendations for times of day to visit places, and good advice on when to go where. We'd expected to spend the first day just orientating ourselves, but he saved us that time. He booked us a cruise, and organised a table for us at a super restaurant - Hamdi's - but was just as good at suggesting a small local place, which was actually where we went a lot of the time. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Crew. A beatiful hotel with great sightseeing nearby.”
Reviews.Author: casiopaier
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this one especially. A few steps away from Hagia Sophia. Romantic atmosphere. Suitable for pairs and for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for visiting the sights in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireOldfart
Reviews.Content: The Garden House Hotel meets the main requirements of a city centre hotel, it is in a surprisingly quiet, it is close to the main sights and it does a very good breakfast. What more do you need? We were in the Imperial suite which sounded very grand but was actually fairly smallbut perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: der_Roemer
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic few days and could have stayed for many more. Amazing scenary in an area that has a lot to offer. Wonderfull hospitality and Food, what more do you need! Nice crew, beatiful atmosphere ... -

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tania575
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasurable experience staying in this hotel. Very clean and warm hotel, staff is very friendly and very helpful. A good choice for breakfast, which is served in the cozy garden. Even though it was my first time there, i felt like I've been always coming there. I would definitely come back again and would recommend this hotel to my friends and family

Reviews.Title: “I can't praise this hotel or its staff enough.”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaHB
Reviews.Content: I have lived in seven countries, travelled all over the world, and stayed in many hotels in that time, and I cannot praise this wonderful hotel and its staff enough. Although my friend and I arrived a full ten hours earlier than expected, at 2 AM in the morning, the staff were courteous and immediately allocated us a room. (Most 4 star hotels won't let you in the door until mid day!) Our room was delightful, on the third floor, and overlooked the garden as specified in our booking. The beds were very comfortable and there was plenty of space to sit and relax. Everything was spotless and there was great attention to detail, with plenty of toiletries in the bathroom and white towels and robes. The water was hot and the pressure was good. There was a full minibar and a fruit basket and water were provided once the other staff arrived. Breakfast each morning was a wonderful array of cheeses, fruits, meats and bowls of nuts, cereals, plus delicious chocolate cake, croissants and other delights too many to mention. There were fruit juices and a selection of teas. Fresh omelettes were made to order. Many 4 star hotels could boast the same but it was the attitude of Mr Ayhan Akkilic and his staff that made this friendly hotel a real treat to stay in. Nothing was too much trouble. He and his staff, especially the ever smiling Selcuk, were always available and ready to help, even loaning me a cable each evening to recharge my ITouch as I had forgotten mine. (Wi Fi worked well in our room and every where else.) We felt they truly wanted us to enjoy our time in Istanbul and recommended several restaurants and shows which turned out to be excellent value for money as well as giving us a map and directions for all the places of interest. Mr Akkilic was even kind enough to accompany me to a local jewellers when there was something specific I was looking for and even enlisted a friend to do a search for me as well. The location could not have been better either since the hotel is in the heart of the old city with all the attractions well within walking distance. Though there is a hill in one direction there is actually a short cut to the Blue mosque and the tram way is very close too. The hotel was very quiet and although the call to prayer was at first light this was not noticed after the first morning and after all must be expected in a Moslem country! All in all it is one of the best hotels I have stayed in for courteous and friendly staff and a feeling that nothing was too much trouble. i am going back there with my husband the first opportunity I can! Thank you to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “thank you to all staffss for every thing”
Reviews.Author: seny2010
Reviews.Content: it was very nice hotel in every thing in cleaning in serving in location in every thing and the staffs are very friendly they become my friend , location of hotel in estrtigic positon near to blue mosque aya sofia and topkapi palace ..so who want hotel in turkey i give him or her advise to reserve in this hotel ,, it is nice and best in every thing thank you for every thing

Reviews.Title: “Not certified by Istambul Ministry of Tourism”
Reviews.Author: edermorte
Reviews.Content: In my first trip to Istambul, I chose this hotel because I could see it had 4 stars. Since I did not know Istambul I wanted to make sure I was best accommodated. For my surprise, upon arrival I realised the hotel was not a 4*. They only had a certificate from the Trip Advisor saying 4* on it. I decided not to complain as the staff was very friendly and stayed there. On my 3rd night, the hotel had a problem with water. I was told in the reception that the problem was going to be solved within 2 hours. This did not happen and we ended up with no showers for more than 48 hours. As I booked this trip with Expedia.com I was able to receive a refund for two nights for the inconvenient. IMPORTANT: If you are looking for a budget hotel, you will be happy to stay there. If you are looking for a 4 stars, I suggest you search for another area as ALL HOTELS in Sultanahmet will advertise 4 stars but none will be certified. Note that those hotels sometimes charge more than a real 4 stars. Be careful in choosing.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful, friendly hotel in the heart of the Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: EC4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a week's break in thie well placed hotel. All staff were charming: nothing was topo much trouble. Reception had good ideas for things to do and took trouble to find out what our tatses were. Rooms overlooking the garden are quiet but those over the road less so if you are a light sleeper. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was generous and incorporated turkish tastes but also conventional international tastes - omelettes cooked to order. This is an excellent hotel for couples. Close to Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia [10 mins walk] as well as the main tam line tover to Beyoglou

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location, needs a little attention to the finer details”
Reviews.Author: sags1948
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Garden House to be told we had been allocated an Imperial Suite room for 2 nights, no explanantion was given as to why the room we had booked in April 2010 was not available. It was a lovely room and even had a Hammam (Turkish Bath), the bathroom was cold as the heated towel rail was not working. We were then transferred to a room overlooking the hotel garden,( I did specify when I made the booking that we would prefer a quiet room on a high floor) this was rather small and claustrophobic and we asked if there was another room. We were shown a room on the street side of the hotel, which was slightly bigger, we agreed to take this room - big mistake it was very noisy as the street outside is paved with cobbles and the traffic is continual from 0700 until late. The room was cold as the radiator was lukewarn and hidden behind a heavy curtain, we did find a heavy blanket in a basket under the bed - we were not told it was there, the bathroom was cramped and cold and in need of some maintenance as it was rather tired. We had to ask several times for cups and saucers as housekeeping had forgotten to put them in the room. The hotel advertise complimentary water but we did not get any, we did have a bottle of wine in the room and fresh fruit on our first night. There were fluffy bathrobes and paper slippers, good quality toiletries, but the towels were on the thin side and off white. Now on to the restuarant - this is located in an extension to the rear of the hotel, and can be rather chilly, the breakfast choice was good, we cannot comment on lunch or dinner as we were out all day sightseeing. We did have the New Years Eve dinner which was 24.99 euros each and a fixed menu. Prior to the dinner there was a good selection of turkish mezes and wine free of charge, the hotel laid on live entertainment. I would say overall our experience of the hotel was good, however further training of the housekeeping staff to pay a little more attention to detail would be beneficial. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. There is free wifi throughout the hotel and also a laptop in the reception area for the use of guests. The Garden House is in a great location being only between 5 and 15 minutes from all the main tourist attractions. Be prepared to be awakened at 0500 every morning with the call to morning prayers blasting out from every mosque in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant oasis in a fascinating city”
Reviews.Author: katowinetrails
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely week at the Garden House with my sister and nieces. The rooms were very comfortable and beautifully appointed. The hotel staff was very attentive, making sure all was well during our stay and helping arrange dinner reservations and transportation around Istanbul. We had some last-minute panic and scrambling when our departing flights were canceled, and they were very helpful, allowing us to use their computer for several hours while we secured replacement fliights. We enjoyed a very good breakfast buffet in the warm and welcoming hotel dining room each morning, before heading off on foot to tour the city; the hotel is a few short minutes by foot from some of the best-known sites, such as the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. I absolutely loved Istanbul, and staying in such a great hotel was the "icing on the cake." I plan to return in the future with my husband and daughter,

Reviews.Title: “The appropriate place for travellers to Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Kirki77
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in a convient place in the historical center, among the monuments, in a very sympathetic neighbourhood far away from the noises and tourist traffic. The building is a renovated mansion which reflects the native architecture of the late 19th century. The decoration of the rooms respects totally the stylistic structure of the architecture. The service, the clearness, the breakfast are perfect. And the last but not the least the price: Best value for money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Asked for More!”
Reviews.Author: amateurhistorian
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week-long stay at The Garden House. The hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. Back in the summer, when we started planning out trip, communication with the hotel staff was fast and friendly. As our arrival approached, the front desk was in touch to help with final arrangements, such as airport pick up, restaurant reservations, etc. We loved our rooms, the charming deluxe doubles as well as the gorgeous, top-floor executive suite! A bountiful breakfast buffet, included in the price, fortified us for hours of touring...most of the major sites are close at hand and Istanbul as a whole is a very "walkable" city. Special thanks goes out to Ayhan and his colleagues who went to great lengths to make certain that we were enjoying every aspect of our trip -- not just the hotel, but dining and touring, too. As a footnote, we are four women, age 18-55. We felt completely comfortable everywhere in Istanbul, every hour of the day and night. We can't wait to return to the city and we'll be staying at The Garden House!

Reviews.Title: “feels like home”
Reviews.Author: simonidapuhalo
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was perfect and this is the opinnion of the whole group and our business partners. The rooms were comfortable. The location is perfect. You can visit Aya Sofia, Blue mosque, Grand Bazar, spice market and other centre locations by walking. We have used the hotel as a meeting room, which was practical for our business partners and for us since we had acommodation and meeting at the sam place. Also, the equipment was provided to us (laptop, flipchart, screen projector, papers, maps,...). It was a unique experinence - both professional and private in terms of logistic, acommodation and other services.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for us!”
Reviews.Author: blivet
Reviews.Content: If cleanliness, location, service, convenience, staff helpfulness, amenities, and value are important for you, this could be your perfect spot as well. It's little wonder that the Garden House gets positive reviews. We won't belabor the obvious then, but add a couple of worthwhile observations. Mr. Ayhan was most helpful with email assistance before the trip and as the tour expert who put together a wide range of interesting options at prices that easily beat the big tourist operators. These were frequently tours for two with private car, driver, and knowlegeable guide (a school teacher in our case) at rates comparable or less than the standard bus for 60! They also recommended, as do we, a little neighborhood restaurant around the corner called Tarihi Cesme where local cuisine was pretty to look at, delicious, safe to eat, and value priced. The WIFI is best in the dining area (near the router). One quickly acclimates to the early morning calls to prayer; a requirement anywhere in Istanbul given the fact the city has 2500 mosques. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with very helpful and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: gstoeck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated. The neighborhood is quiet and close to restaurants and major tourist attractions. The decor of the rooms is tastefully done and the service is excellent with very reasonable prices. I will certainly return !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed here for three nights recently. On arrival at the hotel, the manager took us into the dining room and gave us each a complimentary glass of wine as he explained what there was to see in Istanbul, complete with maps etc. He even recommended a local tour guide who could take us round the various sights of the old city on what was, in effect, a private tour. Three of our group were upgraded to â€œsuitesâ€�. In reality, the suites were simply slightly larger rooms with a couple of armchairs. One or two of them also had traditional Turkish baths. Unfortunately, the upgrade to the â€œsuitesâ€� was only for one night. On the second and third nights, the people who opted for the â€œsuitesâ€� were then placed into another hotel (the Cesme) across the road. The problem with this is that these people lost the complimentary items, such as wine and fruit, that the rest of us got whilst remaining in the Garden House. And, of course, they had to come back to the Garden House for breakfast etc - which was not a big problem. The rooms were quite nice. Mine was on the third floor and had a double and a single bed. I had four windows and I found the room very cosy and spacious. There was a decent mini-bar and a working, electronic, safe, which is always a good thing. The safe wasnâ€™t actually fastened to anything, though, so a thief could have simply walked out with it under their arm (unlikely, I accept). Bathroom was OK. No bath, but a dedicated and decent shower. The sink was not fixed to the wall very well and my toilet seat fell apart when I touched it (Management, please donâ€™t say this should have been reported to the front desk as thatâ€™s the job of the room cleaners not the customers!). Otherwise, there was a good range of toiletries available and sufficient, but rather thin, towels. There was a good range of food for breakfast which was taken in the small dining area which also doubled up as a bar and restaurant for the evening, though nobody told us about the option of having omelettes as a previous reviewer has described. Watch out for the breakfast waitress. She was so keen, that if you turned your head for a second (or even blinked), your glasses, plates and cutlery were gone, even if not finished, and you had to go up and get some more. We took it in turns to guard each others plates etc when visiting the buffet! Staff were always pleasant and helpful and even exchanged some old, obsolete, Turkish bank notes for one of our group. Some similar old money was then given to another of our group in change the next night. I am assuming this was purely an oversight on the part of the staff member concerned, who, to be fair, swapped it over again when it was queried the next day. Perhaps he knew he had been â€˜rumbledâ€™. Finally, the hotel is in a good location in Sultanahmet old city and we found that it was no problem at all to walk to virtually anywhere within downtown Istanbul. If you walked too far, there was always the tram which came within close proximity of the hotel. There is free wifi but the signal was quite erratic and got weaker and weaker the higher up the hotel you went. But, minor grumbles aside, the hotel represented excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing--better than I could have expected!”
Reviews.Author: danielleerin
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul. It was perfectly located near both the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Aside from traveling to and from the airport, every major attraction was within walking distance. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful--they helped us to plan out our days providing us with recommendations and directions, and set up transportation for our return to the airport. The complimentary breakfast and snacks were perfect treats, especially after a long day of site seeing. The quality of service sets this hotel apart from every establishment I have stayed at during my time in Europe (4 months). If you are at all considering a trip to Turkey, I would recommend Istanbul and the Garden House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, elegant in an authentic location”
Reviews.Author: Ray786000
Reviews.Content: The hotal staff are very friendly and speak very good english. Always on hand to offer advice on your trip itinerary and they even up graded our rooms for free. Breakfast was fantastic each morning with the chef on hand to cook you an omelette to your liking and the best part is the fantastic location which is right behind the Blue mosque so you are less than 5 mins away from the major sites of Sultanahmet. Thoroughly enjoyed staying here and by the end of the trip we had become great friends with the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful management”
Reviews.Author: NMTravelingFool
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Garden House hotel. Had a beautiful room with wine and fruit basket to greet my arrival. The staff was extremely helpful, setting up tours and making suggestions for things to do and places to go. Nice breakfast and several times had meals there. I highly recommend the Garden House. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: veerhere
Reviews.Content: The Garden House Hotel is what I call an unexpected surprise. Located in an area behind the Blue Mosque it made for easy access to the main areas of the Old City. The hotel was clean and the rooms comfortable. Great value. But, what made our stay most memorable was the helpfulness of the staff. They looked after our luggage for a few days while we travelled out of Istanbul and we returned to find everything in tact. I even left the safe open in my room accidently one day and they secured its contents until my return. When all was said and done we had a lovely stay at the Garden House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother. Dishonest, bad service, way overpriced !! Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie811
Reviews.Content: My husband and are big travelers....we travel all over the world and stayed in many many hotels. We aren't too picky either really. Sometimes we stay in $5 a night places, sometimes $500. I have never written a bad review of a hotel of all the places we have gone until now. Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this place. First of all, we booked the executive suite like 3 months in advance. There is only 1 room like this. When we went to check in they directed us to our room. Once we got inside I knew immediatley this was not the room I booked. We headed back to the front desk and told them we booked the executive suite. The man at the front desk proceeded to tell me that the room was occupied and that the room he put us in was just as good (which it was not at all). First of all, he should of told us the room we booked was not available...not just try to send us to another room and hope we don't notice. He claimed the people in the room we booked extended their stay and refused to check out of that room. If you are the hotel manager it is your job to tell them they need to move to another room if someone booked it in advance. Why should that be my problem. We booked this room 3 months in advance. I spent probably an hour researching hotels on trip advisor and picked that room because it had a terrace with a view. I looked at many hotels and decided on this one based on the reviews...big mistake! Here is where it gets really bad...we had pre-paid online. After much arguing with the man he told us he would give us a refund, but claimed the credit card machine was down and they had no cash. He told us to write down our information and he would refund the card when the machine was back up. To this day we are battling with the credit card company and have filed a charge back. I am shocked by the good reviews, I can only guess they are writing them themselves. After seeing the rooms, this place is 1) way overpriced 2) these people don't know the first thing about customer service and 3) a bunch of dishonest crooks!!! Don't bother making a reservation here as it doesn't mean anything. And there are way better hotels in Istanbul. These place was seriously nothing special at all. If I could give it zero stars I would..one star is way too generous!! Worst hotel experience I have ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: kabdelra
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 night stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel. This is in Sultanahmet - the old town, and is where I would recommend any first time tourists stay. This quaint little hotel is tucked in amongst many other hotels and hostels in the area, and was difficult to find at first, but only because we didn't know where we were going, and chose to take public transportation there. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, and was more than happy to recommend places to see and go while in Istanbul. We stayed in a room right next to the courtyard, which I would not recommend only because we could not open the window at night because people were gathered there and it was a little loud, and smoke came in the window. Otherwise, we had a very pleasant stay, and would stay there again if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Afer74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, very close to the main tourist attractions, but not on the main drag, so it is quiet. The rooms are an excellent size for a city hotel, beautifully decorated and maintained to pristine standards. The staff are exceptionally helpful. I only made it to breakfast one day of my visit but it was perfectly nice with more than enough choice to keep even the pickiest of eaters satisfied. The sister hotel Cesme is just as lovely too. I would not hesitate to recommend either of them. The Garden House Hotel has what I would describe as more opulent decor whereas the Cesme Hotel is more chic modern (think Habitat), but each is equally comfortable and a great place to relax after a long day of sight seeing. I also consider both hotels to be very reasonably priced for the quality of the rooms and service (I booked with Thomas Cook).

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing trip i've ever had”
Reviews.Author: ady79
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my trip and I stayed at this lovely hotel. The hotel is this very charming old style Turkish house. The staff kept my room very clean and tidy and I sure was happy about that because I normally am a neat freak. They really had sense for details: when I arrived there was a fruit basket, wine and a big bottle of water waiting for me, just what I needed (I hit that bottle of water pretty hard :) ) Breakfast was ok. Not to sound uptight but I did miss a bit bigger selection of cheeses. I donâ€™t knowâ€¦.maybe some imported cheeses. It would go great with delicious Turkish breads. Donâ€™t be afraid to eat lunch or dinner at the hotel restaurant because it is delicious and not expensive. Location of the hotel is perfect, just next to all attractions. Itâ€™s nice and quiet located in the old city. I read that some people were complaining about the noise, but I couldnâ€™t hear much noise and I was turned to the street side. I can only say that they should be greatful not to be staying in the Asian part :). The staff was very nice, helping at all times. One night, around 11:30PM, restaurant kitchen was closed, so I just asked to have some bread and they went out to buy it for me. That is what I call hospitality and sense for details. Not to forget mentioning that the guy working there was willing to cook for me even though he wasnâ€™t a cook. Rest of the staff was also very nice, specially â€œthe old manâ€� working at the desk during the day (you know who you are :) ). He really went out of his way to make me feel at home. Good service â€œold manâ€�! :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel,everything you could wish for in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tomw58
Reviews.Content: From the efficient private pick up at the airport to the arrival at the hotel, we knew we had found a winner. The hotel which was picked blindly on the internet was excellent value and everything we could wish for , despite being a short stay .The staff were more than helpful, always cheerful, which can be a rare commodity these days, and the small garden restaurant was delightful; The room was very comfortably furnished and tastefully decorated and there was a complimentary welcome basket of local fruits and a bo ttle of wine, a very nice touch; Can recommend this hotel for anyone looking for something special and excellent value close to everything;

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: fastprince
Reviews.Content: There were were five of us, we stayed in 3 rooms for four days from the 20th September 2010.Initially when entering the reception area( its rather small) one had a few qualms,had one made a mistake in choosing the hotel?This had also been compounded by the somewhat untidy lane the hotel was situated in.But all our doubts were dispelled in a jiffy. While waiting for our rooms, we had hot coffee and biscuits in the cafe area compliments of the house.Our rooms were very clean, good quality linen,bathroom a bit small but very clean and good toileteries.A fruit basket and a pretty good bottle of Turkish wine were part of the welcome package. The breakfast was superb with a wide choice, the staff very friendly and helpful .Suggestions given by the desk on sightseeing and places to dine were not 'motivated'.In fact the rate for a taxi to the airport on our last day booked by the hotel was cheaper than the quote given by our 'regular'. The management went out of their way to keep us 'happy' and we felt entirely at home. We would certainly stay again at the Garden and have already recommended it to our friends. The location is terrific and so was the free fruit in the cafe. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great staff and location, shame about the noise and fire safety”
Reviews.Author: Fleabane
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just down the hill from most of what you'd want to see in Sultanahmet - a great location, amidst actual dwellings. The staff are superb, really. But, if you have a street-facing standard/cozy room, you'll have a lot of noise - from outside, from the corridor outside your room, and through the stud-walls. Luckily, I only noticed the absence of those familiar "in case of fire" instructions on the inside of the room door and the absence of fire exit signs on my last day, worse, there was only one way out of my room (windows barred). So, should a fire have started in the reception area, I was in a fire trap... Shame, as the hotel is good otherwise...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: djgs
Reviews.Content: Very well situated hotel. staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, hotel clean and well-appointed. Small, intimate and unpretentious.

Reviews.Title: “lovely relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinbad3
Reviews.Content: Breakfasts good choice of cuisine; nice outdoor location. Staff typical of turkish hospitality: very friendly and keen to embellish visit offering tips and advice. helpful staff; needed to arrange an important business call, whilst on trip. Staff dealt with it smoothly and effectively. watched kitten training in progress

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: eaharryr
Reviews.Content: We stayed two different times on arrival and before we left and both times we had a very plwasant experience. The staff is very helpful, breakfast is very good and the rooms were clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “This is the one of the best hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jpitner
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small hotel that was centrally located as I planned my trip. I was traveling with my youngest sister who had never really been outside of the USA. The Garden House was the perfect choice. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood with shops and resteraunts and is walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque. The room was delightful, uniquely decorated with style and charm, and made to feel like a home away from home. Most importantly is the staff. They went above and beyond in assisting us with suggesting sites and tours and ensuring that we had the best experience of Istanbul and its people. After a busy hot day of sight seeing, we sat in the quiet oasis of a garden to relax away from the busy streets of Istanbul. We inquired about having some ice cream to cool down and the staff went and purchased ice cream for us so that we could sit in the garden of the hotel and enjoy. I am returning to Istanbul this week with my mother and would not consider staying any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice experience - great room!”
Reviews.Author: drmkensington
Reviews.Content: Although the entrance lobby is very basic the hotel is really nice. We loved our room on the 4th floor (no lift) - it was like our own apartment with very tasteful furnishings. Staff were attentive but never intrusive. I would certainly stay there again. The area has a very 'neighbourhood' feel to it (lots of cats roaming the streets) but perfectly safe and friendly. You are 2 mins walk from all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul gem”
Reviews.Author: SouthShieldsRoamers
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in the Sultanamet area of Istanbul was so handy for all the major attractions of the city; literally five minutes walk away from the sights. The hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. There is no lift and if your room is on the forth floor it can be a bit of a stuggle, but it does tone up the legs, ready for Istanbul which is hilly in parts. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Our first room had no full length window, but we were moved the following day as I find it a bit clostrophobic without a window. The area is on the up with some building work going on, but not Spanish stye; small wooden houses being refurbished into appartments and small hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I think the best quality for the best price, sweetest memories”
Reviews.Author: vickykiev
Reviews.Content: Hi guys! This august we were travelling with family & small kid (1 year old) and set n this wonderfull hotel! this is really what we looking for - very clean,cozy, quiet, lovely place. You would like it also if you are travel like romantic couple, also with kids.Very good location-you can find whatever you want nearby. Here you can find professional staff, tasty fresh food, and the view of beautifull garden we really enjoy! very romantic! we definitely come back there next trip to Istambul. It is much better than crowded hotels -here you can find real service and individual attention to you:) Something Special! Thanx for everyone who made this sweet mamories about our journey

Reviews.Title: “Generally a brilliant place to stay,the...”
Reviews.Author: Latzaraknid
Reviews.Content: Generally a brilliant place to stay,the staff were great and always ready to help and give tips on dealing with the locals trying to sell you stuff.The hotels is ideally located and not far from most of the sites.Istanbul is quite hilly as a whole and good, steady shoes are required.Our only issue is with the breakfast (not a great choice of cereal to choose from,only 2)and that's being picky.

Reviews.Title: “lovely clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: patndave54
Reviews.Content: This was the ideal hotel for our first trip to Istanbul. The staff were friendly, welcoming and extremely helpful. The hotel was clean with excellent breakfast and dining facilities. Located slightly away from the main hustle and bustle of the Old City it was a perfect retreat to come back to after a tiring day sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Garden House Hotel was very comfortable, the service was excellent, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: maryjeff
Reviews.Content: Garden House Hotel helped make our visit to Istanbul a great success. The staff were welcoming and always very helpful and accommodating. Manager Ayhan Akkilic and Melisa on the reception desk were very pleasant and always ready to help. We were given a complimentary good quality map of Istanbul that stood up to daily use. Our rooms were excellent, modern, stylish and well equipped, very clean and comfortable. The bed was also very comfortable with a choice of good pillows, the room air conditioned and quiet. The bathroom had a good shower and soft towels with a range of toiletries. There was even a kettle for tea, with a selection of tea bags, (unusual in European hotels in my experience). Also an alarm clock. Plus complimentary fruit and wine on arrival in our rooms. There was a good choice for breakfast in the shady courtyard. The hotel is well located just behind the Blue Mosque so very convenient for sight seeing. Altogether we had a great visit to Istanbul. The hotel was a great find and we would highly recommend it and stay there again. The hotel arranged pick up from the airport which was great after a long journey. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FJD
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in a small street behind the Blue Mosque, this is a small but excellent establishment. The rooms are spotless, well sized and comfortable. The bathrooms/showers are excellent - particularly enjoyed the superb water pressure in the shower. The breakfast served in the pretty courtyard, is plentyfull and delicious, with eggs to order and a good variety of cereal, fruit, breads, preserves, cheeses etc. The service is friendly, cheerful and prompt. We were made very welcome and really enjoyed our stay at the Garden House. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, quiet and clean, terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: CathrynS
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for 4 nights at The Garden Hotel at the end of August. The hotel itself was beautiful, each of the 20 rooms are uniquely decorated, with lovely amenities, including complimentary fruit basket and wine upon arrival. The staff were incredibly helpful, providing tips on places to go, routes to take around the city, and gave great advice on restaurants in or out of the area. Melisa, who works the front desk, was a lovely treat, a friendly face to see each day. The manager was also a fantastic - even remembered our names after staying there one day. Breakfast is included in your stay, with a large variety of traditional Turkish food, as well as some western options. Free internet is available for guests, and shuttle service to and from the airport if you stay more than 3 nights. This hotel provided a great experience for us during our stay in Istanbul. We had a great time and would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberIndia
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Istanbul several times (always staying in the Sultanahmet area) and would rate Garden House Hotel as the best I have stayed in. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet side street with rooms overlooking the street as well as an interior patio. The rooms in the hotel are spacious, extremely well appointed and the beds are super comfy. What is very charming is that each room is different in shape and size. The bathrooms are also very well done. A huge AAA+ rating to Garden House on the rooms and cleanliness. What I found incredibly charming about the hotel was the "garden" of Garden House. It is a lovely space for dining as well as comfortable sofas to hang out. Breakfast is served here every morning and there is an all-day bar service available, as well as complimentary fruits, drinks. The hotel offers a small but complete menu for all-day dining as well. Since my friends and I have been to Istanbul several times, the garden was a focal point of our stay. The breakfast was excellent - Garden House goes beyond the traditional "B+B" fare and offers a cooked breakfast to order. This is the only hotel I have stayed in Istanbul that does this - and it really makes a difference. What makes Garden House truly special is the warmth and friendliness of the staff and the very high level of service. Just to give an example - the sole of one of my shoes came off within five minutes of me stepping out of the hotel. The staff immediately bought me a tube of glue (no charge!) and also offered to fix it. Ayhan - the manager - is an absolute gem. He is very welcoming, very helpful and goes out of his way to ensure that the hotel guests have a good stay. I am definitely planning to stay at Garden House during my next visit to Istanbul (April 2011) and highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: enriquemestre
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel, probably in line with the price paid, but what made the difference was the helpfulness of the staff, always willing to walk the extra mile to help us out! They made a difference in comfort and satisfaction, every single one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: dmirouze
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Garden Hotel before leaving to Bodrum. The staff was very nice and very helpful. We have loved having a place to relax (the garden) after a long hot day walking in the city. We were travelling with 8 kids from 18 to 5 so i can say i saw most of the rooms of the hotel. Some of them are quite small (like in most ottoman style house hotel) but always clean and with a nice decoration. If yu stay longer than 2 days, just don't book an economic double room. Our room had a private hammam ! The staff was very nice with our kids. Breakfast is great. We had a meal at the restaurant. Food was simple and good. The hotel is 5 minutes from the Great Mosquee. We surely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room, good service”
Reviews.Author: stephanieingrid
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with large rooms on a little side street, centrally located with friendly staff. The manager was very knowledgeable and helped us book travel elsewhere in Turkey and gave us good advice about how to use our time in Istanbul. However, the front desk staff was a bit spacy and couldn't remember who we were or the conversation we'd had five minutes earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Mikers_P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days during our little trip to Istanbul. The hotel is really nice - pretty rooms, very clean and stylish, very friendly personnel, good food and perfect situation - near most places to visit and far from noise and big roads.

Reviews.Title: “I will be staying at Garden house Again”
Reviews.Author: kazzap2
Reviews.Content: I have just had a great time staying at Garden House. It was a great room - spacious, clean and with little extras such as a complimentary wine and fresh fruit. The staff were friendly and efficient and I felt they were friends when I left. Being right in the hub of Istanbul was great and I would recommend your stay in Istanbul being at the Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lionatheart
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Istanbul was highlighted by our accommodations at the Garden House hotel. The staff were terrific, from pick-up arrangements from the airport (highly recommended) to greeting you with unprecedented hospitality, we felt immediately at home in this beautiful hotel. The rooms are beautifuly decorated and spacious, clean and comforting after a long days visiting all that Istanbul has to offer. Ayhan, the manager of Garden House, was essential and ever present for our needs. He helped us enjoy Istanbul by making reservations, arranging a guide and booking other hotels and even our flights to Ismir. His knowledge and hard work made it possible to visit wonderful places in Turkey. Special thanks to this wonderful staff, Melisa and all the kind smiles we enjoyed, as well as great food and solice of paradise within the heart of Istanbul. Garden House was wonderful in every way. I hope that many people will benefit from this review and have the experience of Garden House in your trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best in sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: tamim_75
Reviews.Content: I have travelled many times to Istanbul and stayed in sultan ahmet for more than 3 times this July 2010 i really was very lucky when i find out about garden house (i have visited many hotels for self inspection just to check if i really made a good choice, and was very happy to find out that i really did) i am not Turkish bur i am very good in sultan ahmet area , and because i am happy and i promised Mr.Ayhan From the management that i will write about the hotel i want to encourage the hotel to stay always as good as they are because it is hard to stay always good if you think your self is good Why garden house in Istanbul....? 1-The first important thing is that what is mention and photographed in the web site is EXACTLY the same (so they did not make up anything fake to makeup their web site) 2-Rooms are really clean with AC 3-if you want to have a nice view (but to the garden)you have to tell them when you book (i preferred to have a non garden view because it is 100% quiet)that does not mean that the restaurant is noisy at all but i am the one who has extreme light sleeping 4-Excellent breakfast 5-Excellent English spoken staff(WHICH IS VERY VERY IMPORTANT IN TURKEY) 6-Very friendly staff 7-I watched some world cup matches free of charge in the hotel's garden 48 inch LCD 8-Staff very helpful in term of Istanbul information 9-location is quiet (as most the hotels are located in an area which has some night activity (noisy) 10- 10 min from sultan ahmet I hope that they will keep on the same level in the future Dr.Tamim Tulimat

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesleyyell
Reviews.Content: Travelled to the Garden House hotel with four friends and had a fantastic holiday. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from all the main attractions but is on quite a steep hill. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We mentioned it was my birthday during our stay and a large cake was presented to me on the day. Breakfast was excellent with a large choice of meats cheeses and pastries, and freshly cooked omelettes. The rooms were of a very high standard but one of ours was on the ground floor and the windows looked out onto the pavement. (This was the ONLY complaint I would have) so ask for rooms not on the ground floor. Toiletries, bath robes and complementary fruit and wine were provided. Overall an EXCELLENT hotel. We used Backpackers for our transfer from the airport to the hotel. They were also very good. 30 Euros for the five of us.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Chernex
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at the Garden House in Istanbul was on the night of July 8th 2010. In fact, the first time I stayed a at the Garden House was in early January 2008. Have styed there 6 or 7 times (overnight stays) and I have never been disappointed. The reason I keep going back to the GH is that it is very cosy indeed, has plenty of charm and the staff are most helpful and friendly. It has now become a ritual for me to stop over in Istanbul whenever I fly from the Middle East to Europe or vice-versa. It is a great transition. The rooms are very tastefully decorated, with that special "touch". Complimentary tea/coffee, fruits and a bottle of wine. Lavender bags on the night table and rose petals decorate the beds. This is the Middle East at its best! I love it. Simple as that. When I make my reservations, I also ask for transport to pick me up & drop me off at Ataturk International. It is always efficient and practical. I couldn't ask for more! Wondering around the area, like visiting the historical sites (the Blue Mosque, Aghia Sophia, Topkapi etc.) can easily be done. There are interesting sites right in the neighbourhood too. And being off the "touristy" trails, one feels one is in "real" Istanbul. The neighbourhood is great fun to discover and one is within minutes of the Marmara see/Bosphorus and one can walk the quays. I have only one more thing to say:Tesekur!

Reviews.Title: “there is another way to live....”
Reviews.Author: EdouardManet
Reviews.Content: I had a crazy dream that when we visited Istanbul I would find a red brown timber yali, with a garden where we would eat fresh fruit for breakfast under a walnut, 10 minutes from the Aya Sophiaâ€¦. The Garden House Hotel was that fantasy, from one window of our bedroom we could see the roman retaining walls of the hippodrome, from the other, a glimpse of the sea of Marmara, at the bottom of the street ran the Kadirga Liman Cadde, a street from a Turkish village, with gossiping matrons embroidering clothes on up turned buckets, black beemas cruising past blaring Turkish house, old guys playing backgammon. We ate at a different place along the street every night, hot pidde from a hole in the wall cafÃ© for 5 lire, lentil soup with chili oil, tea under a grape arbor, as the sky darkened and the muezzin started calling. I got a haircut from a tiny barber shop at 10 oâ€™clock at night , an hour an half with the most minute snipping followed by a hot and cold shampoo, head massage, face massage and hand massage, finishing with a lit cigarette lighter in the ears, I felt â€¦..Immaculate

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable solo in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Pugletina
Reviews.Content: Garden House Positives Location â€“ no more than 10 minutes stroll to Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Sofia Having a Turkish bath all to myself 24 hours a day Being in between 5 mosque, living breathing and experiencing call to prayers Buying my first silk rug with trustworthy Ayhan Being chaperoned to the bazaar by hotel staff Helpful and cheery staff who will whip out the map and have you scooting around Istanbul and beyond Great Eggs, fresh fruit and juice Garden House not so positives Staying my first couple of nights in an economy rooms then been shown the Turkish bath suite â€“ no going back! Totally worth it. With the renovations trucks delivering stuff into the wee hours No variety in breakfast and dinner but that said all food was fresh The Turkish keyboard and finding the 'i'

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JohnJoA
Reviews.Content: Garden House Hotel was well located, just outside the noisy tourist area, but within easy walking distance of historic sites and many restaurants. The rooms were very clean, light and airy; and we loved our bed sprinkled with rose petals and the complimentary wine and fruit. The staff were welcoming, friendly and very helpful. The breakfasts were a highlight, particularly sitting in the lovely garden terrace where we returned each afternoon for a pre-dinner drink. We have already returned for a second visit, and will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Istanbul hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyites
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife at the Garden House June 27-29. What a great loction this chique little hotel is in, close and within walking distance to all the attractions that one would wish to see in the city. The rooms are so well presented, beautifully furnished in traditional Turkish style, and exceptionally clean and prepared every day of your stay. The staff, especially the manager, are a fountain of knowledge for the local area, and they just cannot do enough for you. The courtyard/restaurant at the rear of the hotel is fantastic, and very relaxing. The food is simple, but very nice and very well presented. If you are just taking a city break, or are in Istanbul for business, I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is a magic hotel! The moment you arrive they make you feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: Eddy88
Reviews.Content: The Garden House Hotel was an excellent choice. It is a very nice Hotel, the rooms are clean and nice. And the personal of the Hotel was very kind and helpful all the time. The Manager and Mrs. Melisa were very helpful. They provide an excellent service and recommendations for the tourists. The breakfast buffet could be better but it is good. The location of the Hotel is perfect. The major tourist attractions like Haya Sofia or the Blue Mosque are very close, ten minutes walk. The Garden House Hotel is a great choice if you want to spend a few days in Istanbul. Best regardas from Mexico Edmundo Ed

Reviews.Title: “Cozy chill atmosphere !”
Reviews.Author: visit33
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, you wonâ€™t feel alone ... Modern atmosphere, just what you need to chill and enjoy. Good food and most important clean.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional, first rate hospitality, a oasis in the SultanAhmet neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Benazarian_3
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! The rooms are well appointed with a Turkish flair for style. All of the staff was welcoming and courteous, offering to help with any questions. The garden area is an oasis. Its great for breakfast with a variety of fresh foods and is wonderful for later in the day to relax. Our friends from Istanbul thought we had discovered a secret- they were equally impressed. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: YmaLondon
Reviews.Content: The staff there were all very friendly and helpful. They helped us to book the restaurant reservation, turkish dancing performance, taxis etc. It was situated at great location, which means the Blue Mosque was only 8 mins walk away. Although the double room was small, but it has all the things you need! They even had a fruit basket and a bottle of wine to welcome you in the room! I really like the hotel and I would definitely stay there again the next time I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful retreat in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: oldnorski
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples wanting to be close to the historical heart of Istanbul. Our usual hotel was booked solid, so we booked the Garden House. It is now our favorite hotel in Istanbul. Large comfortable rooms, good food, and a very helpful staff made for a pleasant stay. we were a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Museum, etc. it was a quiet retreat from the hectic world outside it's walls. The price was a bargain as well. they arranged transportation to and from the airport and to the wedding we were attending- with livery always there on time. Very seamless stay.

Reviews.Title: “everything is very nice..GARDEN HOUSE ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: timmygipson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and caring about fussiness.The rooms are different when i compare with the rooms that i've seen before.Everything in the room is clean and steady.There is a garden to sit and talk with your friends.I think this hotel in Istanbul is worth to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: REBCC
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for 114Euros, but on arrival found that i had been upgraded free of charge to a large double. The staff were very apologetic that i would need to be moved 2 nights into my 4 night stay but this was, once more an upgrade. I ended up in a wonderful room with a huge Hamam style bathroom. The staff were charming and incredibly helpful. Little extras like a complimentary bottle of wine, turndown turkish delights in the evening and free fruit and drinks during the day from the lovely garden restaurant made the stay a real pleasure. The Hotel is about 5 - 10 minutes walk from most of the major sites, so despite the fact that it's tucked away in the back streets, very convenient The only downside for me, as a business traveller, was that the internet signal was not strong in all parts of the hotel and sometimes needed resetting. I would highly recommend it however and will certainly be back myself. Thank you Garden House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lindylou21
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi at the Garden House and were welcomed at the door by the reception staff who dealt with our luggage, then escorted us into the beautiful oasis of a courtyard for a most welcome cup of tea after our long journey. Ayhen the manager who spoke excellent english joined us and took the time to help and advise us on the best way to organise our sightseeing, even helping us with our restaurant choices which were superb. When we were taken to our room where we were greeted by rose petals on the bed, complimentary turkish delight, water,and a basket of fruit. This hotel certainly knows how to give a very good first impression and the lovely thing was this standard continued all throughout our 4 day visit. The breakfast the next morning was a good selection of buffet style fresh food and the chef made a lovely cheese and tomato omlettes. We would certainly recommend this hotel to our friends and family we do not believe we could have have found a better place to stay in Istanbul, excellent location close to all the historic sites and in such a quaint and fascinating part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMCo_Durham
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel and the best welcome we have ever experienced. The hotel manager greeted us and took us through into the garden/bar/restaurant area which is a really pleasant area to sit and relax. He ordered complimentary Turkish teas and coffees and sat down with us to ask us what we were wanting to get out of our stay. We already had a planned itinary so we reviewed this with him. He suggested that we swap a few things around to avoid the most crowded times of day for some of the more popular historical attractions and also suggested some restaurants for the evenings. One in particular (Develi) was exceptional quality and value for money (180 Turkish lira for four including a 50 lira bottle of wine). They also sent a complimentary car to pick us up and bring us back to the hotel - fantastic! Our room was very clean and well presented (complimentary wine and fruit) and the bed extremely comfortable. Breakfast was excellent (although no muesli) with the chef making delicious omelettes to order. The hotel is in the old part of the city, and is a mix of old and new, not commercialised and largely residential and very quaint, giving a real flavour of the traditional Istanbul. It appears to be an up and coming area of the city with quite a few new hotels springing up amongst the old houses and shops, but all done so as not to spoil the feel of the place. We would certainly return to this lovely hotel and can't recommend it highly enough. All staff from the manager, receptionists, waitress, waiters, bar staff to cleaners were the most friendly and helpful people we have ever met while abroad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: twofromHK
