Reviews.Content: We are totally enchanted with Garden House, , the foods, the hospitality, the cleanliness , our wonderful room, (502), the gorgeous cat who had breakfast with us, the flowers, even the prayers in the morning, the huge seagulls, the nest on the roof for baby gulls, the sunshine and clear skies-- we don't see much of this in Hong Kong--, the closeness of all the attractions, the Bosphorous cruise, Ephesus trip. But most of all the incredible STAFF!!! Helpful, friendly, professional, courteous and always happy faces!!!! Thank you, we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: Lynco
Reviews.Content: The welcome we received was second to none and we loved the quiet location even though it was only a 5 minute walk to the buzzy centre of activity. The room on the ground floor was small but comfortable and all the amenities were in good working order. The choice at breakfast was superb with something to suit all tastes. However, the very best thing was the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff which made our trip to Istanbul all the more enjoyable even though it was teeming with tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Scandibird
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded our expectations - the staff were very helpful and friendly! We were made to feel very welcome indeed and nothing was too much for the staff to make our stay memorable. The breakfast was varied and very good. Location of the hotel was good as it was a walking distance from all the attractions we wanted to see. The manager gave us good advice where to go, what to see and what to avoid which was very helpful as we had never visited Turkey before. For three lady 'travellers' a very good choice of hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: sellsgifts
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at Garden House and the staff just couldn't do enough for us. On arrival we had fruit and wine in our room and delicious Turkish Delight. The neighborhood was very nice and within walking distance of the Blue Mosque and all the sights. We loved that at anytime of day or night there were always complimentary refreshments available in the dining room. I especially loved the outside Garden area for breakfast. On our last night we had to change rooms and found ourselves in a lovely room with a jacuzzi and silk rose petals on our bed. I would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: garyhile
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the service and attentiveness of the hotel. Mr Cikan treated us like celebrities. Our room was clean and actually a pleasure to be in. Service there was outstanding. The breakfast looked like the usual buffet; however we soon learned that we could order to suit by just asking. The hotel arranged a tour guide with our approval and some dinner/show events. This hotel is a real gem near all the major attractions or transportation to what is not near. Thank you Kadir for a great time. Gary and Candy Hile

Reviews.Title: “Plenty to rave about, nothing to complain about.”
Reviews.Author: lindsayt930
Reviews.Content: Oh I really loved staying at the Garden House for 5 nights in Istanbul, the first 4 with my parents and the last night with my friend. The staff was terribly friendly and very accommodating to whatever we needed or questions we had. The bathrooms are nice, the amenities even nicer, the garden extremely pleasant and the food really good. Just a short walk to the Sultanhemet and the metro, it's very easy to get everywhere in Istanbul from her.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkLilly
Reviews.Content: We had an extended stay at the Garden House hotel because of the volcanic ash. The staff couldn't have been more helpful in this difficult situation. The hotel has wifi but we used the computer provided for guests to rebook flights etc. We were able to stay in their hotel for 8 nights when our original booking was for 3. Several times we booked out only to find our flight cancelled again and they sent a taxi to the airport to collect us! They provided a free meal one evening for all the guests because we were unable to get home. This is a small hotel and the facilties are a little cramped but the service makes up for all this. The location is ideal for visiting all the wonderful tourist attractions in Sultanamet. There are many good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Orcherdgate
Reviews.Content: We were booked for a week and had to stay longer due to the Icelandic volcano. Staff were very heklpful and tried to make our enforced extra stay as painless as possible, with suggestions of what to do in Istanbul. As it is a small hotel there is no proper lounge, but the dining room and outside patio are comfortable, and refreshments are available all day. Free Wifi throughout the hotel. Rooms are comfortable (suggest book standard or superior rather than the basic rooms). Area does have some building work, as it is in the old part of the city which is being renovated. The Muezzin call to prayer tends to wake you up, but that is part of being in the historic centre of the city. Only possible problem would be for people with limited mobility, as the hotel is at the bottom of a hill and the early morning walk to the central sites (Blue Mosque, Sultanahmet, Hagia Sophia, etc) entails a short but steep climb up the street. But then Istanbul is built on hills, so that would be a problem anywhere in this city

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary kindness by staff”
Reviews.Author: saffie421
Reviews.Content: Overstayed with 5 others over volcano crisis. Always offerred further nights when stuck plus access to computer, printer, fax etc as struggled to find way home. Even put on a free dinner for other stuck guests despite worries about when the next visitors were going to come. V. friendly manager and staff. Location looked unpromising on arrival but is in a street being modernised into "boutique" hotels and minutes away from blue mosque, Haga Sophia, old city centre etc. Good value considering great location. Some building renovations nearby but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly & thoroughly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: somethingwittie
Reviews.Content: Had a short break in Istanbul and chose Garden House based on reviews from here and a great online deal. Did not disappoint. While slightly tricky to find at first (we walked from the ferry terminal) you soon realise it is actually fantastically well located, 2 minutes from the Blue Mosque and easy walking distance to all the major attractions. The only (though not at all one) criticism I can find is that we ordered a double room and were greeted with a twin. This was immediately rectified by the friendly and helpful staff. A lovely place we hope to one day return to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: erthtrotter
Reviews.Content: WOW! what a nice place to stay in, we got exactly what was promised on email! We got our airport pickups and drops, the pickup at airport was on time, The room was good as expected it was warm clean and very comfortable, hot water in the taps and room heater working very well. The breakfast..... a lavish spread! cold cuts, several types of sausages, eggs, fruit, cheeses, yoghurts, meze, soup, coffee, tea, juice, dry fruits, bread, vanilla cakes, hazelnut cakes and of course the turkish "chai" in abundance. The staff was so helpful & friendly. It was such a beautiful experience staying with them, they are not at all pushy that you take this tour or that sightseeing trip with them at the same time they are there to help you. The building and is very nice restored Ottoman style mansion with all the modern amenities. Internet was the of courese! Our Istanbul trip was all the more better because of Mr Kadir Cikan and his wonderful staff. We would reccomend this to all! Basheer & Manisha

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotell, central, good service”
Reviews.Author: TritFraVang
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in Istanbul in november 2009 to run Istanbul 5-days orienteering championchip. We had a very nice stay at Garden house. We had good service in a little nice hotel, central located in Sultanahmet with no traffic noice. We liked the outdoor garden very well! We will of course stay Garden house hotell next time we go to Istanbul - if we got a good price :-)

Reviews.Title: “a lovely little inviting hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkRuta
Reviews.Content: The Garden House was a joy to stay in last week.The staff,especially Eser who greeted us everyday with a smile,a great recommendation,and even helped me with my very remedial Turkish every evening was incredible.Mah in the breakfast room,was always cheeful,brought fresh bread everyday and showed me the proper way to drink my frirst cup of Turkish coffee.Lovely Nagthan couldn't do enough,bringing us tea and spoiling us bigtime.They changed our room to a larger one because it was available and for the value this hotel was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PetraW6
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed here for four nights in October - really a wonderful place. The staff was extremely friendly and helpfull, breakfast - great - a buffett with fruits etc.. The small - private hotel is in the center - but very calm - everything is very good reachable. The blu Mosque is just about 100 meters away. The room was very clean and nice decorated, the bathroom had even small shampoos, shower gels etc..I would definetly retourn and I can highly recommend this nice place.

Reviews.Title: “For a hotel that is small and friendly with a personal touch, then the Garden House is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: AWCSBO
Reviews.Content: We booked into one of the suits for a wedding anniversary and did not regret the choice. We wanted a friendly hotel with the personal touch, and that was exactly what we got. The hotel is located in a cobbled back street of what is the heart of the old city, and is within 5 minutes walk from the hippodrome and the start of the key heritage sites. The tram was within 5 minutes walk to then go on and visit the spice bazaar , Dommabache palace and beyond. The hotel staff were all terrific, willing to offer advice on local as well as tourist venues. We had a great stay and met some great fellow travelers. If you are looking for a hotel that is small, friendly with a personal touch, then the Garden House is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Tagliatella
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff, which makes the difference to many other hotels we stayed in. Breakfast was also way above average & tasty. Great experience, had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “lovely atmosphere, very close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: ArwenDarlai
Reviews.Content: I personally loved staying at this hotel very much.Its so cosy,staff is very helpful,breakfast is great.3 minute walk from Haghia Sofia,Blue Mosque or Cisterne,but yet so peaceful! Beyazit square and Grand Bazaar are 10 minutes away,and thats a pretty lively part in the evening so you don't have to go all the way to Taxim to have a great night! Definately take a walk to Marmara sea,its just 10 min away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, but...”
Reviews.Author: julioagnelo
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived at hotel we've realized that somethings wasn't that great. All the first floor had been recently renovated, so, we've stayed a week with this smell of fresh paint. When we asked to have another room our options were far away more expensive than our actual room. I'm sure this a problem that soon will be gone, and the staff as I said is very helpful and speaks english fluently, what made us be a little patient. The only two other thing I'd add: be careful with all suggestions: attractions, restaurants, dishes, it happens to be a trap almost everytime (a restaurant that charges too much from tourists, a dishe that is not that good yet is the more expensive at the menu); and about the hotel: be sure your room in the first floor dont have window to the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at great hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveistanbul1973
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife picked garden house after reading to many nice comments on tripadvisor. I always trust in tripadvisor reviews and never been dissaponted. Garden house met all our needs that we wanted. We booked the suite room on the top with fantastic old city sitting room balcony huge bathroom with jacuzzi. Served breakfast was the best so far I had. The staff especially the managers kadir and bulent were very helpful friendly. We are making a plan to go back in summer and want to stay at garden house for sure

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, spotlessly clean- We would return to The Garden House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BSDevon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights over the Christmas holiday. Our room was spacious, well planned and very clean. The staff were amazing- helping us in dealing with luggage which was lost at the airport, and chatting to us whenever we wanted some help or advice. The breakfasts were wonderful and kept us going for the day! From here you can walk to everything you want to do in the Old City in five or ten minutes. The hotel felt like a home for our visit , and we would say that it is excellent value for money. 10/10!! NB there are several flights of stairs

Reviews.Title: “AT HOME!”
Reviews.Author: kiaraPavia
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend Lorena spent 6 days in Istanbul as self organized turists and we chose Garden House Hotel for our stay. It is a small really clean and comfortable Hotel near the historical centre of Istanbul, hundred metres far from the Blu Mosque and about 300 metres from the Tram stop of SULTANAHMET. The position is really quiet and we gained the possibility to give a look at the daily routine of local people simply walking trought the tight alleys all around the district. From the Hotel we have easily joined all the principal cultural attraction of the City by walking or by tramway. The service is really careful at the needs of clients, not only during the welcome time but also day by day. The staff is always available for asking turistic and practical information about the city, the habit and the cultural traditions. Excellent breakfast with international and typical foods.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: InspirationLondon
Reviews.Content: I loved this little boutique hotel! such a nice place, full of charm and with a great service! the staff would do anything to help: recommending a good restaurant, calling a cab for you or just serving you a coffee in the afternoon. Breakfast was great: lots of fresh fruit and juices, and even a banana/honey milkshake! maybe that was seasonal though... Location is good, very close to the Blue Mosque and other attractions and easily reachable from Ataturk Airport.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Dianes_journies
Reviews.Content: Garden House is nestled within a traditional urban Istanbul community. When you walk inside its like you're in another world. Beautiful rooms, abundant breakfasts (free), and great location. My son and I were able to walk just a couple of blocks in various directions and be at the top tourists spots, a variety of restaurants, and historic monuments. The service was impeccable and the price was just right. The hotel corresponded with many as I was planning my trip regarding currency, weather, accommodations, and more with excellent command of the English language. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Loristian
Reviews.Content: Garden House Hotel is conveniently located in the very center of SultanAhmed, 3-5 minute walk from Aya Sofiya. It is has an old, traditional style, and it is very nice, clean and quiet. The rooms emanate an aura of warmth and welcome, and the chef makes the best meals ever. However, the most remarkable attribute is the staff. Their warmth, openness, politeness, and genuine traditional hospitality goes beyond normal, making you feeling like home. Many times they went out of the way to help us with our day-to-day tourist issues I assure you that after many long days walking down the streets of Istanbul coming back to the Garden House Hotel you will always be welcomed by a sincerely pleasant smile and genuine affection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and a peace of mind”
Reviews.Author: Tolocore
Reviews.Content: We stayed in garden house for 9 days this year and my family was there the previous year as well, we would come back again if we travelled to istanbul again. The staff are friendly, the rooms are clean and cozy and the location is great. It's in a quiet area too. The breakfast was good and we always received some guidance in our trips in istanbul. They would arrange Taxis for us and such. All in all, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: NickHViborg
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is on the edge of the touristy part of Sultanhmet, tucked up a cul-de-sac (even the tai driver had to ask directions). The staff were friendly and seemed to have a good command of English. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and there was complimentary wine, water and fruit in each room. The wireless internet was free and functional. The breakfast selection was good. We were only staying one night en route to a meeting and ate both lunch and evening meal out, so cannot comment on those meals. At the time we were there, it was not necessary to use the air conditionning, so cannot comment on its effectiveness or noise. One tip though - take earplugs if you do not want to be woken at five o'clock in the morning by the muezzin calling the faithful to prayer. This must be a problem over most of Sultanahmet so should not prejudice against this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I've never felt more welcome in a hotel anywhere..”
Reviews.Author: BirthdayGirl27
Reviews.Content: The staff really do go the extra mile to make your stay as comfortable as possible - including surprising me on my birthday with a cake and drinks in the courtyard garden. We couldnt have asked for more. The reviews I read on Tripadvisor before selecting a hotel were spot on, this is a wonderful little hotel in the Old City and I'd thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: boomerangAttiki
Reviews.Content: A restored ottoman house, in a quiet neighborhood of restored ottoman houses, so quaint. Just a short walk from shops, restaurants, transport ,Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10!”
Reviews.Author: ssiddique
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms between 9 of us. From the moment we stepped foot into "our home for the next 4 days" we received a very warm welcome, to the very end of our stay when all the staff came outside to see us off in our taxi to the airport! I cannot fault this hotel - the breakfast every morning was superb (and I don't even like breakfasts!), the rooms were spacious and clean. There were nice touches, e.g. the fruit basket to welcome us. The hotel were very accomodating - my mum had injured her leg so walking up stairs would have been a problem for her - the staff immediatley moved our room to the lower floor and catered for anything she needed. The location was fantastic - most of the main attractions were a short walk away. Also free WIFI was very conveniant. But most of all the hospitality of the staff is what made it a truely unforgettable holiday. All 9 of us thoroughly enjoyed our time in Istanbul and would definatley be staying in this hotel if (or hopefully when) we were to have the pleasure of staying in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel at Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ParisFrance2009
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfrined just came back from Istanbul. We picked up garden house among many hotels according tripadvisor comments. This small hotel is within walking distance to mosque blue and all other monuments. We were upgraded into suite room on the top floor with no price difference. This was a big bonus as we liked to book this room before but did not as it was more than our budget. The manager said us, they had this room vacant and want to offer. Each morning we had our breakfast which offers a big selection food in the garden. our room was looking our the garden with perfect view to the sea. There was sitting room, balcony and a huge bathroom with turkish jacuzzi. We definitely will come back and stay at garden house again.

Reviews.Title: “Three nights on top”
Reviews.Author: sonostefano
Reviews.Content: In this little, clean and beautiful family hotel, you can find everything you need to see in the hostorical and ol part of this magnificient city. We experienced an incredible week end in this special place. Something we can never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: jogaby
Reviews.Content: During a 5-day trip to Istanbul, we stayed at the Garden House Hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful offering us a brief overview of the street plan and highlights of the city upon arrival, booking tours and arranging for transportation to/from the airport. The rooms are clean and the breakfast buffet offers a broad variety of choice. There is a lovely garden to enjoy breakfast, dinner or just to relax. If youâ€™re looking for an authentic, small-scale, 4-star hotel close to some of the Istanbul â€œmust-seeâ€� highlights, the Garden House Hotel is for sure a place to consider

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small friendly family run, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Experience23
Reviews.Content: The Garden House hotel is excellently located 5 mins walk from the core historic area of Istanbul. It is a small family run hotel and the service could not be more helpful or efficient. The hosts are determined that their guests should experience and enjoy all that the city has to offer. Bedrooms are comfortable and the facilities good. If you are blessed with better weather than we had you will enjoy breakfasts on the garden terrace! This is definitely one I would like to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality, great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ksnz
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 excellent nights at the Garden House hotel with our 2 young children and had a very enjoyable and memorable stay. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating and provided us with local advice and catered to all our requests. Location : The hotel is situated within walking distance of Aya Sophya, the Blue Mosque and many other central sights but it is also on a quiet street and not at all noisy. There is also a playground nearby to keep young kids occupied for a while. There are also very good and reasonably priced restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Room : We stayed in a room on the 4th floor and had four separate beds yet had sufficient space for all of us. The room was also very clean and tidy. We liked the wooden floors and tall ceilings. Slippers and bathrobes are also provided. Nice soap too. Breakfast : The ambience is very pleasant, coffee was very good and the spread was good and plentiful. Chef was also there to make omelettes on request which was a nice touch. Staff is very cheerful and always smiling, making each morning very welcoming down at the breakfast table. Overall, the reviews we relied upon in picking this hotel were spot on. So we are happy! Many thanks again to the staff at the Garden House hotel, we've truly had a memorable stay and many thanks again for that great birthday chocolate cake!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FilouSalzburg
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was outstanding. Already the warmhearted welcome words of the receptionist Selcuk spread a very familiar atmosphere. We were guided to our room which was in the very last floor. The room was very charming, nicely equipped with all necessities plus some lovely details that make you feel at home immediately. One bottle of wine and some fruits were served as a friendly welcome gesture. The view over the Marmarasea is impressing and invites for daydreams! One morning we have been much too late for breakfast but the hotel staff very fondly prepaired a delicious breakfast for us. Important to mention is the location of the hotel. ItÂ´s situated in Istanbuls historical part Sultanahmet and the Hagia Sophia is in 10min walking distance! Throughout our stay we always had the feeling we were part of the family and the whole hotel team took care of us with delight. The house is very cosy and highly recommendable! P.S.: Special thank goes to Selcuk, who gave us top tipps of how to explore the city! Your open hearted and helpful character completed the charm of the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “October half term break”
Reviews.Author: Family-Riches
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days, Oct 09 Half term, with my wife and 8 year old daughter. Hotel idealy situated in the heart of old Istanbul city. 5 -10 minutes walk to the key attractions. Yes the surounding area is run down but it is a very old city and the area is perfectly charming. I booked a triple room and was upgraded on arrival to the grand suite on the top floor as it was free that week. This is a privately run small hotel who place customer service first. Yes there are no lifts and the TV only has 2 english channels but you dont come to this city to sit inside your room. Only used the hotel resturant in the evening once and it was fine. We ate at local resturants in the vicinity and enjoyed them. A great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Individual attention, administrative confusion”
Reviews.Author: BigMNorway
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for a week while I attended a conference. We had a mixed but ultimately pleasant experience. I had asked to be picked up at the airport when I arrived and also that they pick up my sister when she arrived much later. She was fetched but they forgot me. When I got to the hotel I was told they had overbooked and we would stay one night at a nearby hotel. I was not happy but they insisted that I had been contacted earlier in the week, something that had never happened. Therefore the first night we stayed elsewhere in a nice enough hotel but had to share a bed. When we did check into the Garden House it was my birthday and the staff surprised me with a cake! Very thoughtful. At check in they swiped my credit card as is normal. The room was lovely and large although the shower was a bit weak. Excellent breakfast. When we left I wanted to use up my Turkish lira by paying part of my bill with cash and the rest on my credit card. However I was told they had already credited my card with the entire amount on the day we checked in. I explained that I travel alot for business and this has never happened to me before and I was not happy. There was nothing they could do so we settled on their giving me Euros for the Turkish lira I would have used for the hotel bill. All in all it is a fine hotel with a very nice and accommodating staff but with some pecularlities that you should watch out for.

Reviews.Title: “Best suite ever!!”
Reviews.Author: KassandraD
Reviews.Content: We spend last Christmas in Garden House Hotel, we were 4 couples, a total of 8 people. Everyone loved the place. The Hotel was very clean and the stuff very friendly and willing to help at all times. Great location for sightseeing. Loved the transfer from and to the airport. But I think that the best of all that was the suite I and my friend stayed in the last night. Really worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “not much to complain about at garden hotel, overall above average in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: joo929
Reviews.Content: My review is quite simple, a very good hotel. I was travelling with my parents who are 73 and 75, and I requested a room close to the ground floor, as I read from reviews that the hotel has no elevator. Kadir the manager gave us a really nice triple overlooking the garden. I expected it to be noisy as it was close to the reception and the restaurant in the garden, but to my surprise, it was very very quiet, which was exactly what my parents needed at night in order to sleep well. The hotel has all the amenities you need, but above all, simply, it is 1. convienient (close to the sights in the area) 2. clean (super clean bathroom, crisp fresh linen, super soft duvet covers, cushy pillows) 3. charming 4. quality hotel The morning breakfast has a good spread, fresh fruits, juices, shakes, cold cuts, cheeses, olives, juices, yogurt, great turkish coffee. The staff were always friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable about the sights and shopping in the city. Furthermore, they communicated everything with kindness, patience, and with an excellent command of english. (which sometimes in many places is a rarity) As I was travelling with my parents, I needed things to run smoothly, efficiently, and most of all, with ease and comfort, and that is exactly what I got from The Garden Hotel. I'm very satisfied with my stay there. (five days and four nights) Moreover, it really is a charming and lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel refuses to refund money”
Reviews.Author: travelling_german
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to tell anything about the hotel and its rooms. Unfortunately I can't since I never got there due to a fatality in my girlfriend's family the week before we wanted to travel to Istanbul. We tried to cancel our reservation five days before our planned trip via eMail and over the phone. The latter was impossible since no one who speaks anything close to English was around. We called twice and were told each time that the Manager was not around. That has been it. How can you cancel if no one understands what you are trying to tell them? We never got a reply to our eMail cancellation although we re-send the message twice (three messages in total) asking for confirmation. The most interesting part: the hotel changed its cancellation policy during the week we cancelled! The policy used to say "no penalty if cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival" (1 day). It even said that on the day we cancelled. A week later it said "7 day" (the one who changed it hastily obviously forgot to add an "s"...). We are still hunting our money and fortunately the credit card company is really helpful and will refund it. It is funny that everybody who actually made it to stay at the hotel seems to be quite happy. The ones who need to communicate with the hotel (I found another negative review where the lack of communication was a huge issue) seem to be lost in translation...

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, accommodating, clean and inviting hotel close to the heart of Istanbul "sights"”
Reviews.Author: Mountford
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel which gives a friendly, family feel. The accommodation is expanding with extra bedrooms and now with a full dining facility in the garden patio. Although in a "backwater" it is actually within five minutes walk of the Blue Mosque and ten minutes walk of numerous restaurants, cafes and bars. It retains a truly Turkish feel in a traditional wooden faced building. The staff are extremely friendly, happy and helpful and go out of their way to arrange anything you require eg taxis, maps, advise and, in our case, bent over backwards to accommodate us when we screwed up the booking and arrived a day earlier! We have only just arrived home and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: Kasted
Reviews.Content: Garden house is a lovely friendly and special place, I spend much of my time on the road doing business and this hotel stands out as having very nicely appointed rooms, each one different decor, with the little amenities like a kettle for boiling water and fresh fruits, which makes such a difference. My first room was a little noisy due to the closeness to the street, but I was moved to a truly marvellous room. Thank you so much for taking so good care of me.

Reviews.Title: “a friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayoubLondon
Reviews.Content: i travelled with my two teenage kids and a toddler, the free pick up from the airport was on time that was a great start as i said to my children! in 25m we arrived in garden house we had a good welcome from the sttaf a free fruit basket in the room and kadir offerd us a free drink in the garden while he gave as information about istanbul and where to visit!!! its a cosy small designed hotel with 5mn walk from the blue mosque and a few steps from ayaa sofia most sight are close to each other.the rooms are superbly clean and tidy beds are very comfortable i asked for a baby cot when i booked for my little toddler and had a good one.a good selection of breakfast with a fresh finger licking omelette made by a chef , serving not only cereal but traditional turkish buffet and many more.a very cosy garden with a fiendly atmospher wich hamida offered with lots of love and nice smile to every one but special one for my little monkey ayoub who liked her a lot.yes there is quite a steep climb from the hotel but for me as a fitness instructor it was superb it kept my cardio in good rate during my holiday break! butttt......need a good pair of shoes too as street are cobbled wich still have them in some street in uk.few words with a lots of value to kadir ,nice ,friendly ,honest and loveable person with all the love to hamida as well mr sulcu and all the staff big thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MDavis01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul August 26th. My stay at the Garden House Hotel was wonderful. Arriving at the Garden House was like visiting family you have'nt seen in a while, and they missed you very mush. Hamadi and Selcuk are very hospitable, and went out of their way to make me feel as if I was at home; and I did. The food served was fresh and delicious! The garden of the hotel invites you to stay all day reading and relaxing. The location is excellent...you are within ten minutes (walk) from all major attractions. I can't say enough, except to say I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, central location but not quite 4 star”
Reviews.Author: mamspeed911
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the garden house hotel for 5 nights with our 3 year old son. Its on a quite little street away from the hussle and bussle of the main sites. We booked a "comfy triple room". The double bed was very comfortable but the single was a pull out sofa bed which was more like a camp bed and not comfortable at all. So our toddler slept with us. Our room had all the luxuries of a 4 star in that there were toiletries, hair dryer, mini bar, kettle, bathrobes and slippers. However, there was mould in the bathroom and the room was more like a 3 star in UK standards. None the less, it was a friendly little hotel with a great selection for breakfast and the staff were very helpful. If possible request not to have the room right next to the reception desk as the walls are very thin and it backed straight on the central courted garden which meant that we could hear constant talking and noise from the reception and the courted garden. It is a 5 minute walk from the hotel to all the main sites and a 10 minute walk to the grand bazaar (which is over rated) I was expecting a busy bazaar with stalls and haggling, instead it was more like a indoor shopping centre with shops. The spice bazaar which is a tram ride away is much better. Word of warning:- Always check your change as the locals may try to rip you off. We bought an ice cream for 2 YTL and paid the guy with a 50YTL note, he gave us 2 YTL back in change and when we questioned him, he denied we had given him a 50. After quite an argument, we got our correct change. Istanbul is a beautiful city ideal for couples and adults to enjoy the culture. It is not really a place to take small children as there literally isnâ€™t anything for them to do there and it is definitely not pushchair or disabled friendly. There are small cobbled streets up and down little hills and itâ€™s a nightmare pushing a buggy everywhere. Also, most places donâ€™t have lifts so be prepared to carry the baby and the buggy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: JeaniDoha
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need for a wonderful experience in Istanbul. It sits right in the middle of everything, so you can walk to all the main attractions easily. The staff is the best!!! Everyone is friendly, helpful, and made our stay so enjoyable. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very appealing. The beds were so comfortable with lovely sheets and comforter. A special thank you to Kadir for planning all our day trips during our stay. Couldn't have asked for better service. This great lttle hotel has it all and will most definitely stay again for our planned trip back to Istanbul next year. Thanks Garden House. We'll see you again....

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: BB0777
Reviews.Content: I spent only 1 night at this hotel, however it was a very positive experience. Highlights: - Able to check in early (9am!!) and received breakfast this morning as well - Very friendly and helpful staff either for conversation or assistance with travel plans - The best breakfast in all of Turkey. Many options, great quality and fresh. In addition fresh fruit, tea, coffee and snacks are available all day in the courtyard. Not so great points (and these are minor)... - small shower (as in all but one place we stayed in Turkey and Greece). From previous reviews I understand some of the other rooms may have good size showers. (We opted for a budget room) - The room we had was near the entrance and during the day one of the entry doors did bang alot

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in this excellent small hotel in very well located, just a few minutes from the Blue Mosque. We were met at the airport as promised and received a warm welcome by the super friendly and professional reception staff â€“ all the staff were great and almost made returning to the hotel after some strenuous sightseeing (Istanbul is very hilly) to a warm welcome and complimentary fruit and tea in the lovely garden feel like returning to a friendâ€™s house. The service as you would expect was very good too â€“ the hotel and our room was spotlessly clean and well maintained. There is a PC with free internet connection for guest to use for those who do not travel with their own laptop and laundry gets returned the same day within hours. Breakfast is very good with a wide selection of Turkish and continental dishes available, plus omelettes cooked to order. We also had lunch at the hotel which was equally good. For our 6-night stay we occupied the top floor suite with a small private balcony which was wonderful â€“ it has a real wow factor. Great panoramic views across the marmaris and the old Sophia church / mosque, with the balcony facing another famous mosque. I was woken by morning prayers during the first night but to my amazement slept through these subsequently â€“ the windows are double glazed, so I guess it depends how light a sleeper you are. The suite is modern in greys and light wood, with a larger very comfortable (firm but not hard) bed, plenty of storage, desk, dining table, TV, minibar (reasonably priced), coffee table and sofa / comfy chairs, plus the balcony above the breakfast garden. On arrival complimentary fruit, wine and Turkish delight are provided. The spacious bathroom has a window to the living area (with venetian blinds set inside the double glazing) and contains a full length jacuzzi bath, a shower set above the bath and comes with full set of toiletries, as youâ€™d expect, inc bathrobes and slippers. A minor irritation was that there was no safe inside the room, but safety deposit boxes are available at reception. The hotel has no lift but even the top floor is not that high up (3 flights of stairs, I think) and the stairs are wide and modern. In addition to the garden area the hotel also has a large shared terrace on the first floor where guests can relax. Weâ€™d definitely stay here again when we visit Istanbul next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: spisharody
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find. The location is great...near all the key sites of the city in the old town area. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mukexs
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 10 visiting Turkey for the first time and had the pleasure of staying at this small yet charming hotel twice- at the beginning and at the end of our tour - for 2 nights each time. The rooms were cosy and comfortable with individual personal touches evident every where and the bathrooms, though compact were very clean and fully functional. The small courtyard which served as a dining/sitting area was a welcome relief from the heat and bustle outside and the ever attentive and friendly staff were always there to serve our needs- They even prepared a surprise delicious birthday cake for one of the group, at a very short notice.Thank you Mr Kadir and Hamida as well as the other staff who were always there for our requirements The hotel was , i would say , a home away from home for us all and its location and facilities made sightseeing and exploring Istanbul that much more of a pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “Top place to stay with a homely feel, great staff and very central location”
Reviews.Author: Tashav
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here recently based on the reveiws we had read on Tripadvisor and we were very pleased we did. Great value for money, Kadir and the team of staff they have are really helpful and super friendly. Our initial room was very nice however they kindly upgraded us to the executive suite for our last night's stay which was fabulous! The location is perfect and only 5 minutes to all the main sites Blue Mosque, Sofia etc. There is also a great restaurant at the bottom of the hill it doesnt look like much but really nice staff and yum food. They also do food at the hotel but finish quite early, you can however get a drink virtually all night though! We really enjoyed our stay here and I would definitely go back. Istanbul is a great city to visit!

Reviews.Title: “We cannot fault this hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Australianvisitors
Reviews.Content: Australian visitors We agree with everything said in previous reviews about the hotel, the comfortable rooms and its excellent staff. Nice food, too. We also concur with cautionary tales from guests who had trouble with taxi drivers. They will demand double the appropriate fare, snatch your euros or dollars and, in heavy traffic, drop you a mile away from your destination and claim it is a "short cut".

Reviews.Title: “" PERFECT "”
Reviews.Author: gulayTas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a 7 week holiday from Turkey. We stayed at Garden House Hotel of a total of 3 weeks during our tour I think we couldnâ€™t have made a better choice, certainly worth a stay here. We were looking for a hotel in the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul and found a gem. We found this hotel on the internet and chose it primarily because of its location in the heart of Sultanahmet area within walking distance of the Blue Mosque. I was impressed with the location; itâ€™s in walking distance to all the main historic attractions. You need to walk 10 minutes before getting to the centre of town, tramway etc. No problem for us, but if you donâ€™t like walking staff are very helpful they will call taxi and also direct you to meet your requirements. All rooms have been very nicely furnished and it should be noted the showers have excellent pressure. The rooms were spacious, immaculate and comfortable. Thereâ€™s a cosy and tasteful modernity an individuality that makes you feel like staying in a home. The buffet breakfast is lavish and healthy, what we really enjoyed was the charming garden eating area partly shaded by a gracious walnut tree. The Garden House Hotel and Its staff clearly have as there goal to make your stay in Istanbul as pleasant as possible. They will help you arrange sightseeing tours, Airport transportation, etc. and also will provide you with terrific dinner recommendations. Garden House Hotel offer complimentary fruit throughout the day. A laptop computer in lobby offers free internet to all guests which is very handy. Above all would like to thank Kadir and his team who took care of our need and looked after us like a family member. We were very sad upon leaving and are sure to stay there again. Overall I would highly recommend the Garden House Hotel to other travellers, trust me you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful and friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: SoobyRochester
Reviews.Content: We loved the Garden House Hotel, a relaxing oasis right in the heart of the historical sites of Sultanahmet. Mr Selcuk and his staff were always on hand with advice. We enjoyed a full breakfast in the garden every morning before setting off for the day. Istanbul is a fascinating city and, as women travelling alone, we were not harrassed or intimidated at all and enjoyed the banter in the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. The Turkish Baths were an experience not everyone chose to enjoy, but as one who did, I can thoroughly recommend it. We skipped back to the hotel. Our stay coincided with Ramadam so alcohol was not so freely available but enjoyed all the more when we did manage to acquire some. You will love the Garden House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with Family”
Reviews.Author: fatosRochesterNy
Reviews.Content: Garden House is an oasis in the maze like streets of the Sultanahmet neighborhood. It is ideally placed -walking distance to all the main touristic attractions and it is in a quiet residential area. The hotel stands as a beautifully renovated cherry wood exterior and has a private garden lounge as well as a rooftop lounge. Rooms have beautifully designed decor, very clean with all the amenities. If you can't find what your looking for the staff will go out of their way to find it for you. I feel like I was treated like a family member during my stay except that the chef will cook you whatever you want. and it will be delicious!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: valentilla
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Garden House twice during our trip in Turkey, and we really enjoyed both of them. The location is perfect, every important place to visit is just 5 minutes walking, but itâ€™s in a small street silent and quiet. The rooms were very nice, we chose a â€œsuperiorâ€�, very comfortable, clean and cosy. the staff was helpful, kind and speak a good English. The breakfast, in a beautiful terrace, was very rich. We really recommend this hotel to anyone looking for relax and comfort at reasonable prices, in the best position to enjoy the most attractive monuments of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Your Oasis in the Bustling City”
Reviews.Author: BiffyBoo
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is very intense! We loved it, but it was so nice at the end of a busy day to come back to the Garden House. The garden and rooms are wonderful, but the real gem is the staff. Mr. Selcuk. He gave us many tips about the city and was extremely helpful. A local cab driver tried to give me incorrect change, but I caught him at it because Mr. Selcuk had warned me about that very scam! When our teenage son's asthma got bad, Mr. Selcuk told our cab driver to take us to the international hospital out by the airport. We saw a doctor at this beautiful hospital and were back to the hotel within 1 1/2 hours! We loved Istanbul, but admittedly it is extremely different from Seattle. What a joy it was to have great people like that to make you feel at home. All three of us would wholeheartedly reccommend the Garden House to anyone we could.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accomodation & location (and great value)”
Reviews.Author: juliaredux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Garden House for a whole week - first time in Istambul - and we really enjoyed both location and accomodation. The room were I stayed on 3rd floor was really nice: spacious, very clean and nicely decorated, with all mod cons being present. Room on 1st floor was a little bit darker (windows only on lower half of the wall!), but nice, clean and spacious as well. Free bottled water and tea/coffee making facilities in every room. Very effective air conditioning. Just one warning - watch out if you have problems with your legs: there's no lift in the hotel, and monuments are reachable only after climbing a short slope (everything within short walking distance, though). Nevertheless, the location was really good, and the hotel lies in a very quiet and safe neighbourhood. Breakfast was good (& nice to have in the courtyard), and the staff were very welcoming and friendly. I would surely recommend this small hotel for a first trip (and following trips!) to Istanbul. Giulia - Padova, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Mosque Warning”
Reviews.Author: richardregatta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good and lived up to Trip Advisor expectations except nobody warns you, that if you stay in this area, it is very convenient for the big sites but you are surrounded by competing mosques. At 5 in the morning the caucophany of karaoke which switches from one side to another for a full 6 or 7 mins. is deafening. Be aware. Also, if you take the great room on the top floor (5th) there is no lift and after treading the streets it is demanding so be fit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location is great”
Reviews.Author: ozap77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in walkable distance to the historic mosque, topkapi palace and other tourist attractions. The people who run it are really cool and down to earth. I had a room on the top floor and they are very modern and clean. The fruit basket is great but if you are into a place where the staff will assist with any destination you have. Try the breakfast buffet in terrace...great touch. Rooms are airconditioned..believe me it is essential....great for honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended For Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: LungCher
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute decision to stopover in Istanbul before returning home as I was on a working trip in Bahrain. It was the second hotel found on the internet that I came across Garden House. It had received good reviews and I decided to give it a try. Was also pleasantly surprised that an email enquiry to the hotel manager who responded almost immediately. Great location as it is away from the main attractions yet only a short walk takes you to all the sites. Room elegantly furnished, clean and it was safe to leave our laptops in the room without having to store away whilst we were out. The wireless internet access was great as we were able to work even on a leisure trip. Staff speaks English, friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: martindemant
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Garden House Istanbul several times during the last couple of years, both on business trips and with my family. At all times the staff at the hotel have been both professional and extremely kind and helpful. Travelling with our 6 month old son, my wife and I have been extremely happy to stay at the hotel, and today I could not imagine staying anywhere else when I am in Instanbul

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lyraEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden House last February for a week with my friend and I've been really happy with this accomodation. The hotel in right in the middle of the old city, very clean and comfortable. The room was large enough and the bathroom had a spacious shower. We had complimentary bottles of water and fruit every day! The breakfast too was generous. Finally I have to say that the staff was great. They were very friendly and always ready for suggestions. I work in an hotel in hotel in Italy and I travel a lot, but I have to say that the Garden House is one of the best hotel I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, airy couryard and striking rooms”
Reviews.Author: cultural2urist
Reviews.Content: What better way to see the old city than to be within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia; to be able to hear the call to prayer if one wished (and not to hear it if one closed the window); to sit in a cool pleasant garden with a beer or a glass of wine after a days sightseeing and to have attentive staff available if one wanted them to book/advise about the next days' activities. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This little gem has it all”
Reviews.Author: SallyPerth9
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel. It had everything you would expect for the price and much more. Wine & fruit on arrival, a well appointed room which was light & airy. Quiet efficient air conditioning and an extremely comfortable bed. All the hard and soft furnishings were clearly carefully chosen and both beautiful and practical. The staff were uniformly efficient, warm, friendly & helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was served in the indoor/outdoor courtyard and had all the standards included in all Turkish hotel breakfasts, but again, always with a bit more. The usual breakfast items were supplemented by fresh orange juice & eggs cooked to order as well as a few extras items on the buffet which added variety and interest. We especially appreciated the 'help yourself' facility in the restaurant. At any time of the day there were a variety of fruit juices and bottled water, coffee & tea, and snacks such as biscuits and fruit, all offered to guests for no charge. After spending our time sightseeing in hot weather we were able to return to the hotel and relax in the garden with a cool drink & a snack before heading for our room. A simple idea but remarkably welcome. We stayed at the Garden House for 7 nights and found it ideal as a sight seeing base. We would be happy to recommend it without reservation to other visitors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Charming Hotel and Genuine Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rog2006
Reviews.Content: This is a charming and welcoming hotel set in a quiet residential area on the edge of the Sultanahmet tourist district. A particular highlight was the friendly and courteous staff. The hotel takes its name from the pretty little courtyard garden which contains the restaurant serving good basic Turkish and European food. Because we had our baby with us, we ate at the hotel every night, and eventually found that the menu was a bit limited, although the staff were happy to order in food from a nearby restaurant. The hotel is situated about ten brisk minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome. I would also recommend a quick visit to the nearby Kuchuk Aya Sophia mosque just down the road. Our clean airy room was perfectly large enough for the comfortable double bed and our baby's cot. The plumbing in the bathroom all worked, and the shower produced plenty of hot water. Sadly my father fell ill in France while we were staying, and so we had to curtail our holiday and return home at short notice. Despite the fact that we had booked for several more days and would have happily paid for one or two more nights, the sympathetic manager would not hear of us even paying for the night on which we left. All in all we thought that the Garden Hotel represented good value for money and was a good base from which to explore Istanbul with a family. When we return, we hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff and a wonderful garden.”
Reviews.Author: TyroneLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose Garden House on the basis of the reviews, photos, location and air conditioning. The service we received was amazing. The staff were unfailingly helpful, serving tea, fruit and biscuits all day. Breakfast is wonderful, with omelettes cooked to order if required. The air conditioning works quickly and effectively and the daily water supply was a thoughtful extra. Our allocated room was on the fifth floor, which we found to be too much for our legs after a day's sightseeing, so they offered us a choice of rooms on the ground floor. Best thing: the garden, sitting in the cool shade of the walnut trees during a hot Istanbul afternoon. Tip: book the airport pick-up. It took us a while to find the hotel in the Byzantine maze of streets.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect oasis to stay during your visit to amazing Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: phuberman
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for lovers of the genuine flavours of IstanbulÂ´s most impressive sites. Short walking distance to what you surely want to see in this gorgeous city. Beautiful hotel, with the best staff ! Nice rooms, great breakfast, excellent service all day long, and a charming patio where to enjoy a calm breakout after an exciting day. All the hotel personnel will always be at your friendly service to provide very helpful advise during your stay. DonÂ´t miss visitting Little Agya Sophia, a true architectural gem just two blocks down the hotel lobby. Pablo Huberman Buenos Aires, Argentina

Reviews.Title: “Best service I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: JayDemos
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in lot of hotels including your Hyattâ€™s, your Marriotâ€™s and your Four Seasons but I have never seen service like this. The staff will bend over backwards and then some to make you happy, but more about them later. As for the hotel itself, itâ€™s a quiet little gem on a hidden side street that is five minutesâ€™ walk from Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and other major tourist sites. The neighbourhood may look a bit dodgy but donâ€™t let that put you off. My wife and I walked around after dark and never encountered any kind of trouble. In fact, we only met the nicest people, including Morat, the gregarious waiter at Cesme Restaurant just down the street who will throw in free Turkish language lessons with any dinner order. The rooms are decent size and are exceptionally clean with comfortable mattresses. The only down side was that there is no elevator and our room was on the fourth floor. But, I shouldnâ€™t complain as I need the exercise. Another nice feature of the hotel is the patio/restaurant in the back courtyard which offers free snacks, coffee and non-alcoholic drinks for the guests anytime they want. Of course, you can order a full meal as well if that is what you wish. Breakfast is a decent affair, but if you are expecting an American style Dennyâ€™s breakfast then you better check in to the Holiday Inn as this breakfast offers fruit, boiled egg, bread, etc, etc. And as I mentioned before, the service here was unbelievable with a staff that always smiles, has a good word and will do just about anything to make their guests happy. I also have a word of thanks to give to the day manager since I had a minor medical emergency and he ensured that I was taken to private hospital and looked after. Further, they will make sure you will get to see all you want to see. My wife was a bit wary at first about all the brochures she was handed but in the end was quite pleased with the managementâ€™s suggestions for which tour groups were the most appropriate for the amount of time she had. If you find yourself in the same boat, listen to these guys. They are not trying to rip you off, they actually care about you getting the most out of your time in Istanbul. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels”
Reviews.Author: davidmdf
Reviews.Content: A group of friends (some of them couples) and I visited Istambul in June 2009, just for a night because we were travelling somewhere else, and I my choice was Garden House Istanbul. We got and offer when booking so it was affordable. I was positively surprised. At a first glance, the hotel was just a cozy place close to the Blue Mosquee (5 min walking distance), in the sultanamet area. Once the day advanced, we discovered fantastic points of this hotel: - We arrived without taking breakfast, and there was for free (and 24h), a lot of fruits, cakes, juices and coffee, in the internal garden. The fruit was delicious. A breakfast exists as well, with natural orange juices and more cakes... - The room was very convenient in its size and very clean. The furniture was brand new and very stylish. The bed was very very confortable. You can book rooms for three people as well (as we needed). The toilet/bathroom is very clean as well, with stuff for taking a bath. I was not in the top rooms, but apparently there are fantastic views. - The hotel staff was very polite. They all speak english so you can communicate without any projblem with them. They were very useful. They helped us in the addresses we needed and in booking tables in some great restaurant with the most impressive views I ever has while taking dinner. Unfortunately, I don't remember his name, but there was a man who was extremely nice and active/efficient in the reception. - There is free internet access (with their computers) in case you need to do the chech-in on line. I seriously recommend this hotel. I will book a room there when I will come back to Istanbul with my girlfriend. I hope it was useful. All the best for you travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Oh!how we loved the AC!”
Reviews.Author: 7continentsFlorida
Reviews.Content: My niece and I spent five days at Garden House and found the staff to be fabulous, the room nicely sized -- especially to accommodate all our shopping bags. But most of all, we appreciated the air conditioning after spending two hot nights in Cappadocia. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. Perfect location near all the historic sights

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed at such a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiLand73
Reviews.Content: We are a group of people traveling to Turkey. We are in the coast now. Istanbul was our first stop in this country. We loved Istanbul very much, this is an amazing city where full of different culturels. We found Garden House hotel perfect in all. The rooms, little patio, location of hotel and of course staff of hotel. They all were very helpful with smilling faces. One special thank to Bulent, Amrullah, Selcek. The girl who serves breakfast I do not remember her name maybe Corina she was the most helpful stay in the hotel. I hope we'll have chance to come back istanbul and we'll stay at Garden House diffinetely.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel, well situated with excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Roger080
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel, which had excellent service, with all staff keen to help. The rooms were veyr comfortable and the location was ideal for us, within a few minutes of the Blue Mosque and other sites in the old city - and easy access to other places of interest. A fascinating city with lots to see and do!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenandeddykennedy
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this hotel. The rooms are well appointed, beautifully furnished and immaculately clean. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful and will advise you on all areas of your stay in Istanbul. They will also book restaurants, activities, excursions and taxis for you, which we took full advantage of and were very grateful for, as we only had three days in the city. The breakfast spread is amazing and includes a variety of fresh fruit. The chef will even cook you an omelette fresh to order. The garden is perfect for relaxing with a tea or a beer â€“ the tables are comfortable and well spaced and some are covered to give some welcome shade. The location is second to none â€“ five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and ten from Aya Sofya and The Grand Bazaar. The area is peaceful and we had no disturbances to our sleep from passing people or traffic. There are also several lovely shops in the immediate area (in which we found some excellent bargains) â€“ donâ€™t forget your credit card!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant oasis in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_JC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Garden House met my every need for a long weekend stay in Istanbul. I found my single room to be affordable, clean, quiet and somewhat spacious. The breakfast room and outside terrace were most welcoming and a calm place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. I will likely stay here again upon my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel! Made our trip to Istanbul so enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: KidneyBoy
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4, with 2 children aged 7 and 10, we were slightly nervous about traveling to Istanbul for our first time. This hotel made us feel immediately like we were at home. The staff are incredibly helpful, and everyone at the front desk speaks flawless English, which worked well for me. The folks in the restaurant area are also delightful people. I miss my Turkish Breakfasts of figs, walnuts, and other yummies. I read reviews of this hotel, and everyone seemed very complimentary. Having experienced the warmth of the Garden House, those reviews were no exaggeration. My wife and I are already talking about our next trip to Turkey, and the Garden House Hotel will most definitely be a part of it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous! stunning 110% service with a smile always.”
Reviews.Author: donsbuck
Reviews.Content: From the minute my friend and I arrived the attention to detail was brilliant! so friendly, charming and could not have been more helpful. Lots of advice for 2 girls travelling alone and lots of information on evenings/days out. Breakfast was delicious - so much choice and it had a lovely oasis to eat and drink. Very clean and the BEST location. Do not overestimate distance on map - it only takes 10 mns to walk down to Bospherous along the tram route. If you visit an Hamman - we went to the Suleymain (check spelling!) was brilliant - do this before you get your suntan as they scrub you with glove thingy (not painful thou) - make sure you visit G Bazaar and Spice Market - have a look around first for a few hours. Once you find your feet - barter like mad - its such fun! Take sterlising liquid for after the loos! All in all a fab place- would definitely visit again and definitely go back to Garden House. Donna London x

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel with friendly staff and great service.”
Reviews.Author: rgjacobs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Garden House in Istanbul is a beautiful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. It is walking distance from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The rooms were very nice and breakfast is served every moring on the beautiful patio area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Central and Courteous”
Reviews.Author: EdHamster
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my 11 and 15 year old. On family city breaks you expect to compromise on accommodation but with this hotel we did not feel we compromised on anything. Our triple room was large, bright, clean and comfortable and well within budget. The plumbing worked. The garden/dining room/bar is a plus. We all found something we could eat at breakfast and enjoyed the free tea and wi-fi in the evening. The building is a traditional Turkish merchants house renovated to a high standard in an old part of town. It is short walk to at least five of the top ten sites in the city, and that walk takes you past a playground through a street market, some days, and gives you the thrill of the minarets of the Blue Mosque appearing over the hill. The staff are nice too. They arranged an airport pickup which made arriving easy. This may be free if you book on the hotel's own website and you will get a better room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, great garden”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDocUK
Reviews.Content: Rooms - we were on the ground floor at street level. During the day is was noisy, but we were always out so not a problem. The hotel is located on the backstreets so at night noise wasn't a problem. The bed was great, and there was fresh fruit in the room. The room and bathroom was a little small. Food - breakfast is good. There is: cereals, fresh fruit, bread, eggs, cold meats, cheese etc.. Also, and it was a fantastic touch, there is free tea/coffee/biscuits/drinking water at all times. Just what you want after a day of sightseeing or after dinner and a few drinks late in the evening. They do dinner, if you let them know earlier in the day, but we never ate there. Staff - incredibly friendly and helpful (though on one occasion recommended an aweful tourist-trap fish restaurant, Yengec, that must be avoided!!). Often spent time at the end of a night out with the guys who were working the night-shift, and they were great! Location - backstreets of Istanbul, but walking distance to quite a few of the 'touristy' sights. The area felt safe, and on most nights returned after dark.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: MarijaPristinaKosovo
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake of booking by third party webside instead of directly with the hotel. There where some misleading information about the room, for instance that there would be an individual terrace for the double room. But when the staff found out about our disappointment we were upgraded for the rest of our stay from our double room (which was very nice!) to a penthouse suite with private balcony without any extra charge!!! We were living like kings:)! The hotel is small, quiet and very beautifully furnished. The staff is very helpful without beeing pushy. There is a lovely garden were you can just sit and relax on your way out or in and digest everything you've experienced. The location is perfect for examining the historical sites like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia or the Grand Bazaar. Everything is within the walking distance. The tramway stop is nearby and it is only a couple of stops to the Galata Bridge and the great fish restaurants under it. And upon our departure, they also gave us discount for paying in cash, even it was not meant for those customers booking their rooms by a third party webside! We are already planning our second Istabul trip and we are defenetly returning to Garden House!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely quiet getaway walking distance from main sights, housed in a typical Ottoman mansion, friendliest staff!”
Reviews.Author: Streetjam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 5 minutes away from the main sights - the Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia and the Hyppodrome. Its is located in a restored Ottoman wooden house with a quiet cosy courtyard where you can enjoy a lovely cup of coffee or tea available to guests 24/7. The staff are amazingly friendly and always ready to help or provide useful advice. The neighborhood is safe and provides glimpses of real Istanbul life, despite being really close to the historical center (like women hanging clothes to dry on balconies, children playing in the playground, muezzin calling people to a nearby mosque for prayer and local cats patiently waiting at the butcher's shop for some treats). The only problem really is the bathtub with jacuzzi in the upstairs suite which overflows when water reaches a certain level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel but rooms variable”
Reviews.Author: Miner1
Reviews.Content: We thouroughly enjoyed our two night stay here. We were picked up efficiently at Sabiha Gokcen airport and dropped at the hotel in just over half an hour. The hotel is set in a nondescript but safe area within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque, although pavements are broken and there is a bit of a gradient. Our room was comfortable, and clean, with excellent quality toiletries. The bed was excellent and there was no noise although we were on the ground floor. The staff were extremely helpful without being intrusive. The continuous free coffee, biscuits and fruit was a pleasant touch. The small lounge, breakfast room got a little crowded at breakfast on our second day, but nothing inconvenient. The hotel was full that day due to a water conference in the city. Our only complaint was the room we were initially offered was a twin, when we had asked for a double. The second room we were offered was too small, but the last room was fine. Negotiations were conducted in a very pleasant manner with no unpleasantness. The manager later apologised and said he had misunderstood our request for a double, and admitted some of the rooms in the new extension were a little on the small side and often used for singles. It would be best to be clear when making a booking. This is an excellent hotel run by very pleasant people and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: TurkfanBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, relaxed atmousphere, comfortable clean rooms. Such an obliging place to come back to after sight seeing. So near to Sultanahmet Mosques and palaces - five minutes on foot. Don't miss the nearby leather quarter and mosque in this historic quater of the city. Great hotel, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karlov
Reviews.Content: I was on business in Istanbul. The service is friendly and accommodating. I was picked up at the airport and returned there free of charge. My room was excellent, complete equipped with mini-bar, and a bath- robe and slippers if needed. The attention to details is excellent - in my room there was always a bowl of fresh fruit, as well as a good-stocked mini-bar and tea and coffe making facility. The personnel at the reception was very polite and available for any need. Also, the connection to internet was included in the price . The Hotel is very close to all the main turistic places. There is only a small saloon for the breakfast and for staying during the day (in winter time). I hope to come back again to this Hotel at the earliest. Carlo and Carla

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for some wunderful days”
Reviews.Author: Bavarian031
Reviews.Content: The Garden House is a nice little Hotel in the old part of Istanbul. The service was very good and the receptionist, Selcuk, is a kind man, who gave us good advices. The rooms are clean and modern. The location is near the centre and in the typical area of the Sultanahmet. The hotel has a nice breakfastroom and terrasse. To summarize our experience: We can recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our splendid experience in a jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iznic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet suburb five minutes from the main attractions of the cultural centre of Istanbul such as the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia,which makes it a great base for visits. The area also has many interesting traditional shops such as the shoe making area where you can get a feel for the artisans and traders of the city. The buildings are very old adding to the charm of this place. The hotel is fully renovated inside and out, being therefore well presented. The staff gave excellent service day and night being most courteous and friendly. Reception were most helpful: there was nothing that they would not do for us. The rooms are clean,airy and quiet with double glazing and pleasant dÃ©cor. There was always a bowl of fresh fruit in the room and clean laundry every day. Room service was commendable. Food was good especially breakfast which was a selection of nuts, fresh fruits, cheeses, cold meats and jams with additions if required such as omelette. Lunch and evening meals were available at reasonable prices for those occasions when we just wanted to relax,with a glass of wine or beer.There was always complimentary coffee, tea, fruit juice and bottled water available, which was most welcome. An added bonus is the quiet secluded courtyard at the back of the hotel with comfortable cushioned seats, some under cover. Here there are flower beds and a splendid walnut tree which would give welcome shade in the height of summer.. There is always some one on duty to serve you in the courtyard, including a night porter which was reassuring. The hotel does arrange visits and meals out with transport for guests, although we did not avail ourselves of this facility preferring to be independent. My wife and I had a wonderful time at this lovely hotel and are thus able to recommend it whole heartedly to people who enjoy good service and a quiet .well maintained environment.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RandRTampa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Garden House for four days on our trip to Istanbul. The Garden House is located in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul and is very close to the major attractionsâ€¦The Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, etc. These attractions were packed with tourists and after a long day of dealing with the crowds, we were relieved to return to the Hotel Garden House. The Garden House is a small boutique hotel in an authentic Istanbul neighborhood. There is a lovely garden area which is perfect for relaxing after visiting the city sights. The best thing about the Garden House, though, is the staff. They are very friendly and attentive to our needs. We booked our room directly with the hotel and they arranged for a pickup at the Ataturk airport at no extra charge. They also arranged for a return to the airport at a price much lower than a taxi (or taksi in Turkish) would have charged. We particularly enjoyed meeting Selcuk, who works during the day. He made us feel like we were guests in his home. All of the staff were attentive and made our trip enjoyable. The breakfasts were included and they will make omelets and freshly squeezed orange juice in addition to the other items offered. Thank you Hotel Garden House!

Reviews.Title: “Experience the real Turkish life”
Reviews.Author: asterixRotterdam
Reviews.Content: We were with 4 persons. The hotel is quiet, very friendly employees, beatiful rooms close to Blue Mosque and located in the middle the day to day Turkish life. Nice garden and perfect breakfast.. If compared to the large hotel chains this is why you want to visit Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “The true charm of Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: LilMo_KSA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel as a short romantic getaway.. we wanted to experience the true charm of Istanbul and it was the right choice, right from the moment we stepped inside the hotel.. I didnâ€™t want to stay in the usual chain hotels that we were used to, and I am glad I didnâ€™t.. this is a charming unique hotel, every one in the staff ( especially the manager) tries to make your stay as much enjoyable as possible.. The location is great a few min walk from all the important historic attractions. At night its very quiet and tranquil.. sometime too quiet the walls are thin and if you make a bet more loud noise you will be heard by your neighbors ( they will call you to keep it down).. The room was very comfortable and spotless clean.. if your used to American standards it will be a bet small.. but I loved it.. There are no elevators you have to walk up the stairs to your room. The breakfast had a nice variety ( simple Turkish ) .. tasteful.. in a charming cozy setting. Safe deposit box not in the room but in the lobby, and small wont be able to place your computer in it, only your valuables.
