Transport from the airport was efficient, they will be waiting for you in front of the door out of customs to take you straight to your hotel, I recommend you take it because it can be tricky to get to the hotel and the taxis may try to take you a longer route just so you pay more.. but a tip its cheaper to get a taxi on your way back to the airport just a regular taxi will do. Istanbul was charming and mystical and this hotel with its friendly and efficient staff will make your stay even more memorable. A tip, book your stay with the hotel directly I got a better rate when I called them my self than what was available on the internet travel sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; value for money”
Reviews.Author: WillyenRiek
Reviews.Content: We (elder couple) spend 4 nights in the Garden House Hotel. The staff did their utmost to please the guests. We hired the upper flour with a nice outlook over the sea of Marmara; the balcony was superb. With a lot of traveling experience, we were suprised by the cosy atmosphere and the extended and healthy breakfast. Although the houses nearby looked a bit shabby, workers of building companies are making progress with several reconstruction activities. The Garden House itself, has been restaurated perfectly! To visit the Blue Mosque and other famous places, it's just a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Although taxi's are chaep (5 â‚¬ for a 20 min. ride) we walked to many highlights of the city. Evening leisure easely can be arranged by the hotel receptionists, with a convenient pick up and delivery service. The Garden House Hotel offers a perfect place for a (short) stay in the magnificient city of Istanbul. Willy Roes & Riek Korten, The Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “garden house istanbul”
Reviews.Author: prenseslisa
Reviews.Content: a very nice, authentic,homy hotel.I recommend evreybody this hotel. the staff is very friendly.the rooms are romantic and clean. asspecially during the printemps and summer you can enjoy of the authentic garden in the evenings. zk amsterdam,holland

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous in every way”
Reviews.Author: flickmack
Reviews.Content: I chose the Garden House because of the reviews on this site. All the compliments are not exaggerated! A wonderful hotel in a perfect location, the most picturesque in Istanbul I thought. Incredibly warm and friendly staff who made us feel at home, organised a surprise welcome drink for my husband's birthday, and went out of their way to accommodate us. Had anything happened to us I am confident Selcuk and the team would have done anything to help. We had a lovely room right at the top with view on Marmara and mosque, which was spacious and spotlessly clean. Decor is tasteful, blending traditional and modern design, whilst remaining simple, bright yet romantic. Perfect for a young family, my little boy who is 3 loved his stay, and the outdoor patio and nearby playground. Good breakfast and a haven of tranquility after a busy day of sightseeing in a neighbourhood which is friendly, safe and picturesque. Strongly recommend this hotel! Thank you for such a marvellous stay, we will come back!

Reviews.Title: “My warmest recommendations of Hotel Garden House”
Reviews.Author: travelleraarhus
Reviews.Content: Having stayed now at Garden House Hotel on several occasions, I would like to give the hotel my warmest recommendations. The hotelâ€™s location in the heart of the Sultanahmet district is great, the hotel in itself is a very nice place with clean and cosy rooms with all amenities, and last but lot least: the hotel staff are friendly and very helpful. Due to my work I often travel to Central Asian and the Caucasus and have to stop over in Istanbul because of the bad flight connections. I always look forward to my stay there with great delight, not least because I have found a place that has become my home in Istanbul. Last time I brought my husband who felt very welcome as well

Reviews.Title: “My home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Katarina16
Reviews.Content: Knowing the Garden House from a previous holiday, I returned to this pleasant Hotel after a business trip to Turkey. I was cordially received. The friendly and ever helpful staff, the comfortable rooms, the surrounding area, where you do not have to go far to eat out or visit historic sites, all this and more makes this place very special. I would recommend the Garden House warmly to anybody who plans to visit Istanbul. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere better”
Reviews.Author: Mickb59
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a friendly cozy hotel close to the main tourist area (10 minutes walk), but away from the hustle and bustle of the trams and traffic then I would highly recommend the Garden House. Located down a small side street in the Sultanamet area of Istanbul this charming hotel with its friendly staff is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Though lacking the amenities of the larger hotels (such as swimming pool and gymnasium) the Garden House makes you feel welcome from the minute you walk through the door with its excellent staff that cant do enough for you. The rooms are clean and not expensive when you consider the location. Its within walking distance to all the main tourist areas such as the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque. If you visit Istanbul then there is nowhere better to stay than here

Reviews.Title: “wonderful all round”
Reviews.Author: BlueSueCroatia
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel - moderately priced, immaculately clean, well-positioned and very comfortable. I booked over the internet and always received a prompt and helpful reply. Airport pick-up is arranged by then and when we arrived we were given a very friendly welcome and found the staff very helpful throughout the stay, especially the manager Selcuk.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel but awful quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was not at ease to walk around with all these buidlings completely empty nice hotel thoguh and close to historical part

Reviews.Title: “Warm and cozy!”
Reviews.Author: cmcindc
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Garden House. It is close enough to all the main attractions in the Sultanahmet, yet it is tucked away in a real neighborhood with a wonderful mid-week farmers' market. This was my second time to Istanbul within a four-month period, but my first time to the hotel. I recommend it highly especially if you are looking for a quiet (and maybe romantic!) getaway. Ask for the room on the 5th floor (lovely views!) but be ready to get your exercise in since there is no elevator. What also made the stay extremely pleasant was the staff; they could not have been more friendly, especially Kadir and the men working the front desk. You will not be disappointed! Chris Washington, D.C.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and cosy environment”
Reviews.Author: fahimuzzaman
Reviews.Content: > I was scared to book the hotel for four nights and commit the money before seeing the hotel itself. However based on the reviews by others on trip advisor I made that discision. However I must say that it was not a wrong choice at all. Although the hotel does not have the bells and wistles of a 5 star hotels, where I normally stay during my business trips, I was pleasantly surprised by the value for money this hotel provides. For 70 Euros or 150 Turkish Lira, it indeed offers what you are paying for. I was travelling with two children and the hotel staff, especially, Mr. Kadir Chikan was nice enough to upgrade us from double room to triple room and provided baby cot for no extra charge. Furthermore we took some time to get out of the airport, however the person waiting for the airport pick up was nice enough to wait for us for more than 1 hour. I really fell in love with the setting and atmonsphere of the hotel. > > In the morning I was looking to go for morning prayers and I found a mosque which was less than five minutes from hotel and I ended up in Mehmed Pasha mosque which is more than 500 years old built in 1549. We met another Pakistani family staying there and they were equally satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: maturestudentLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Istanbul at the end of January. We were met at the airport by the hotel minibus, and from then onwards we were very well looked after. The staff were helpful and friendly, and spoke excellent English (we have no Turkish, so this was important). The bedroom was comfortable and clean and we appreciated the fresh fruit and bottles of water (at no extra charge) provided in it. Breakfast was plentiful and include nice surprises, like the milk and honey drink specially made as guests arrived down. When we lost a camera, the hotel staff rang round various venues to try to track it down. The hotel is a short walk from the major sights (up a steepish hill), and could hardly be more convenient. We thought it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: Rolli-Athen
Reviews.Content: The very good rating of the Garden House was our reason to book. We travelled as a couple with a teenage daughter. In general we were very satisfied with our choice. The hotel is in a quiet area close to the Blue Mosque. You can reach the touristic highlights easily by walk. The triple room was nice and cosy, although not very large. But we couldn't expect more in such a relatively small hotel, somehow like family run. The bath was also very nice and everything totally clean. We had asked for a room in one of the upper floors but finally got one in the first floor with view only the courtyard. (Finally I don't know if there is more view from the upper floors.) The room was bright and totally quiet, something that matters most. The breakfast was very good even that it could have had some kind of muesli as well as some meat. (OK, there were small sausages.) The hotels offers free transfer from the airport (not to the airport). I was glad that I called the evening before our arrival because I didn't get any confirmation and it obviously had been forgotten. Although the hotel is not very cheap I think the value for the price is really good. Thanks again to the excellent and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but expensive...”
Reviews.Author: chalkeee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Garden House due to the rave reviews it received on this site. Don't get me wrong, we found it to be cosy and warm and friendly, but did it warrant the superlative ratings it has received on this site? Not really. We found it to be satisfactory in many areas but we could not justify the 139 Euro per night price tag - this is expensive for a small hotel. Breakfast is the same every day (although it's fine), there are no room safes (although you can have a secure box in the lobby) and the rooms are cosy but not luxurious. In my opinion, this is a homely and friendly type of hotel, but more like an up-market 3* accommodation rather than the 5* impression that many of the reviews portray. For example, the lack of a comfortable lounge area downstairs is a shame. There are some nice touches - free coffee/biscuits all day and plenty of travel advice from the friendly concierges - but beware of one of some of the hotel recommendations - a restaurant called Yengec for example charged us almost Â£100 for our first night meal - and was unashamedly touristy, whilst a mixed hamam (Suleymaniye) charges a cute price for a bath only with no proper massage - i.e. not the full experience. However, the recommended tour company - Senkron is very good and gave good value for money. My own recommendation for a great meal by the way is Magnaura Cafe on the Akbryik Caddesi - great value, authentic (not touristy) and brilliant food. We did not get treated to a free pick up from the hotel by the way - it was charged to us at 30 Euros - steep cost when a local firm just around the corner charges only 5 Euros per person!! So, to put it into perspective, a pleasant hotel with some good touches but there are better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: surferboykrishan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden House Hotel for 3 days and 4 nights. It was fantastic! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic and away from the 'touristy' hustle and bustle of Sultanamet. I really liked my room; it was small, but very cosy and beautifully fitted out. Breakfasts were good each morning and I enjoyed eating in the nice terrace area outside. I work for a major travel industry corporation and do a lot of travel for business and pleasure. Certainly, this is one of the better small hotels I have stayed at. Certainly worth a stay here! Next time I am in Istanbul, I will stay at the Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Garden House is Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: EricAlger
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Garden House to anyone looking for a great romantic getaway. I was impressed with the location, it's in walking distance to all the main historic attractions; there are even fresh markets around the corner. My fiance' fell in love with the room too which was a bonus! The staff are polite, respectful, and very knowledgable of the area. I can't wait to visit again, I will surely come back to the Garden House. Cheers Eric Alger

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great location”
Reviews.Author: ptgptm
Reviews.Content: The Garden House hotel and its staff clearly have as their goal to make your stay in Istanbul as pleasant as possible. There is attention to detail like rose petals on the bed, a daily fruit basket in the room, a range of choices on the buffet breakfast, wireless internet, etc.. Its location is excellent, and to re-iterate once more, the staff are really friendly and helpful, always available to provide advice on sights and things to do, as well as help with reservations/taxis/etc. All rooms have been very nicely furnished and it should be noted that the showers have excellent pressure. Some rooms might be better than others; the room next to the reception appears to be a little bit noisy, while those a bit further away and on higher floors are more comfortable with that regard. The suite on the top floor is excellent! All in all a great place to stay in its price range that we would certainly recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: LeoHester
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve never met greater hospitality than in Hotel Garden House in Istanbul. We were picked up (free) at the Airport and we received a bottle of wine in our room when the receptionist found out that one of us had her birthday. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet, near the Blue Mosque and The Aya Sofia. They gave all the information we needed and served fresh fruitshakes at breakfast. We had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tenerifo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our visit to Istanbul and absolutely loved it.The hotel is nestled within a great neighborhood and it is close to everything - which makes it easy to get to and from the hotel. Our room was very nice and clean and spacious .Need to also mention the staff... they were all very friendly and helpful in providing information, advice and getting taxis.Garden house is a great place to stay for value, location. We wish more hotels were like Garden house!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: qq1q
Reviews.Content: Garden house is a small establishment, so no grandness or special services. Other than that is perfect: very clean good rooms, nicely decorated with wooden floors, and decent bathrooms. Perfect location, quiet but just 3 minutes walk to Sultanahmet Square. Helpful staff. The hotel offers a free pick up service from the airport. Pretty outdoor area and breakfast room. Appropriate breakfast for a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Kandol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during Dec 3-6, 2008 with my family for my Eid Holiday. As a regular tourist, I can be sure guests will be pleased with warm welcome by the hoteliers. Very close location to major destinations by walking distance, and very quiet as well due to the location away from main road. Lovely back yard garden next to dining room with simple and well organized landscape. Room was clean and spacious enough for my couple and 11 year old child. I received kind information about the city and my personal tour recommendation from hotel owner. Only one thing, some taxi drivers had difficulty to find this hotel location, but it's good for calm and quiet stay. Tourist from Korea Kyung H. Han

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jstone1984
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to go to Istanbul, I strongly suggest staying at the Garden House hotel. First of all, you can't ask for a better location. It's minutes away from absolutely everything; great restaurants, museums, historical Mosque's (including the Blue Mosque which you can see from the hotel). The hotel itself is amazing. Extremely clean and modern, with a charming glass roofed restaurant. Upon our arrival, Kadir sat us down and advised us on everything we needed to know to make our trip amazing. He also told us what we should avoid and we were assured that the hotel staff would be there to help us whenever we needed. I cannot stress how helpful every staff person at this hotel was. Whether it was asking for directions, ordering 2 a.m. room service, or asking for suggestions, we were cheerfully helped. You really get the sense of Turkish hospitality at this hotel. They took a genuine interest in us and wanted to make sure we had what we needed whether it be in or out of the hotel. By the end of our trip, I was very sad to leave Istanbul. The city is amazing and our hotel was the cherry on top. As we were leaving, Bulant and other members of the staff helped us to our taxi and it felt as if I was leaving a families home after visiting! We even exchanged contact information and will definitely keep in touch! I already miss the city as well as the hotel. I will definitely be back and will only stay at the Garden House. I cannot praise it enough. 5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMike04
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to historical places, restaurants, shops, bazars etc. The staff were very friendly, always willing to help. Rooms ok, goods beds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: slimshady_lp79
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start ..the location is amazing stone throw from the blue mosque,aya sophia, grand bazaar etc etc.. the STAFF are the best part very friendly very helpful couldn't ask for more(taxi they got it,restaurents they'll recommend,shopping ) bottom line on of the best hotels i ever stayed in...

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: PaulaB346
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the perfect place to stay while enjoying everything there is to see and do in Istanbul look no further. What more can be said than the Garden House is a Gem. From the amazing Breakfast Buffet, to the spot on location, to the charm of the sparkling clean rooms, to the numerous amenities [love that wireless], every aspect of our stay was delightful. Kadir and the entire staff were warm and gracious, and went out of their way to make sure we were well taken care of. No question or request was too big or too small, and we were always greeted with a smile. We will definitely return to Istanbul and stay at the Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Batendi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 4 nights at Garden House Istanbul and really loved it. I booked the hotel directly and paid with cash money upon arrival, which gave me some discount. They arranged free pick up from the airport, and since I arrived at 1.30AM that was wonderful. I was warmly welcomed by Bulent, and immediately felt at home. All staff members are very friendly and helpful. I stayed at room 202 which was perfect. Big room, nice double bed (as a single traveler, i loved that!) and clean bathroom. Breakfast was good and enough varieties. Staff was very helpful in advising for the daily program and also about customs and doâ€™s and donâ€™ts in Istanbul. Istanbul for me (as a single woman traveler) was very safe. I didnâ€™t feel uncomfortable at all. Istanbul is a wonderful city, but for sure also visit Taksim in the European area. Nice restaurants, pubs and young people. A visit to Gulhane park is also very nice. Donâ€™t forget to drink some Turkisch tea at the back side of the park. Nice view! I didnâ€™t like my visit to Cemberlitas hamam. Too touristic! But Garden House, yes, I would definitely stay there again. Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff who give you personal attention!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bristolcream
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a fairly central spot near most of the main tourist sites in Istanbul. Friendly, helpful staff. We went without hot water for 24 hours with no real explanation and had to work hard to get them to sort it out - however, on the whole this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrummieGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from 5 days in Istanbul and this was a very good hotel, though there was an initial problem. I had booked a room well in advance but only days before we were due to travel, I was told that there had been an over booking for the first two days of our stay. I was initially offered a room at one hotel for the first two days; but after I found through research that this wasn't very good and costed much less than I had paid for my room at the Garden House, I was instead offered an alternative next door to the Garden House for the first two days, after which I would be upgraded in the Garden House for the remainder of the stay. I accepted this. The first hotel next door was okay; the owner did book my wife and I a room with a very nice view over the Marmara Sea, though the room was small. The water in this place was also undrinkable and smelled...but it was okay for two days as there's plenty of bottled water around. Then we moved to the Garden House...and this was much better. A well designed hotel, friendly staff (especially Kadir who gave help and directions whenever needed), and the water was clean (though I didn't try to drink any - I opted for the bottled water they give you for free every day). The hotel It is situated in an old residential area which adds a touch of authenticity to a stay in the 'Old Part of Istanbul' as the area around the sights has been developed. The buffet breakfast is the same every day but there is a good selection, it is constantly topped up, and the jams are superb!!! The morning call to prayer isn't as loud as some people had said in reviews (maybe it's just me), but as a Muslim, it was enough to wake me up for the pre-sunset prayer - makes a change to my alarm clock which usually performs this function back in the UK. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and another 3 minutes to Ayasofia. Yes there is quite a steep climb from the hotel which my wife struggled with occasionally but it was fine - that can't be changed. Food is available during the day and we ate there twice - it was a tad pricy for what was offered but it tasted good. There are some very good restaurants around though. I would recommend Cesme (pronounced Cheshme) which you find by turning right out of the hotel, then turn right at the bottom of the hill - it is on your left). The food was nice, the staff very friendly, and for less 30 YTL, we ate handsomely - a very good deal. There isn't a no smoking area though and so smoke did come over to our table which was a bit unpleasant. Mozaik Restaurant which is a short walk from Sultanahmet tram station, and Sultanahmet Fish Bar which is close-by to that were also very good experiences which I would recommend - these are pricier than Cesme but the food is very good. If you get lost then the locals would be unlikely to tell you where the hotel is - it is buried amongst a maze of streets. You would be better to use the Blue Mosque as your Centre, as I did, because from there because it is a 5 minute walk back down the hill. Take a good pair of walking shoes too as the the cobbled streets going up from the hotel, and those in the Grand Bazaar can play havoc with your feet... All in all, I would strongly recommend a stay at the Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: cowboy2806
Reviews.Content: Well despite all those enthusiastic comments let me tell you my story: Yes the place is quite nice but when we arrived the room wasnÂ´t ready yet (which was ok because it was round noon) so we went downtown. Coming back at nite we were given a tiny - and I mean not a small room but one you could hardly put your suitcase on the floor. when i complaint at the reception desk (I had made a reservation for a bigger room for 105 euros via internet) i was told that all rooms were the same size (ridicoulus) even when I repeated that i wanted the bigger one i had booked. Then i was told that the hotel is full, blabla.... but finally they offered us a larger one for the next day (which was definitly larger). what i wanna say: please you guys there at the hotel stop messing with your guests when you screwed it up before (what they admitted after all) breakfast by the way was average, location is great, although donÂ´t expect a fancy neighbourhood

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireMash
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last weekend and we had the most amazing time. We arrived on Friday evening and the manager immediately took our bags from us and welcomed us warmly before checking us in quickly and efficiently and having our bags taken to our room. The room itself was lovely (number 603) with one of the comfiest beds I've ever slept in (to the point where we found it hard to force ourselves to get up and go see the sights!). Everything was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was airy and well laid out with some very nice smelling soaps and shower gels. We decided to go out to eat and thought it would be a good idea to ask the receptionists advice but instead of a quick recommendation we were taken to the breakfast room for a cup of apple tea and a virtual tour of the city! Firstly, the manager laid out a big map of Istanbul and showed us where everything was, then he talked us through all the tours he could arrange for us before recommending a couple of nice nearby places to eat. I have to recommend Cesme - another reviewer mentioned it and it is truly fabulous - if you turn right out of the hotel and walk a few seconds to the bottom of the hill then turn right you'll see it on your left. We walked in and were taken to the upstairs dining room where we experienced some of the best food and service ever. The meze is great, the wine is gorgeous (we had a white called Andura), the main courses were varied and well cooked and the puddings divine (have the baklava!!) and after a truly chilled out 3 hour dinner the bill came to about Â£30, wonderful!! For a transfer to the hotel from Sabiha Gokcen (which is where you'll fly to if you go with EasyJet) use www.istanbulairporttransfers.com - they charged only 20 euros each person return and took you directly to your hotel door (the drive can be around an hour if there's traffic so it's a great price). The breakfast at Garden House is yummy and constantly freshened up by the attentive staff and the dining area is light and airy. At night they serve drinks and food in there and it's a nice place to relax after a long day sightseeing (or after your dinner at Cesme!). We took the all day tour that cost 60 euros and it was well worth every penny - it takes in all of the main sights and you have a great local guide who gives you the sort of insider info that you'd never get from guide books. The tour lasts all day and includes dinner so you get your moneys worth. All in all this a great place to stay and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone - it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Gem”
Reviews.Author: dalsubc
Reviews.Content: The Garden House was recommended to me by a friend and proved to be an inspired choice!! A wonderfully retreat after a hard day experiencing the highlights and atmosphere of Istanbul, all of which are pretty much within walking distance from the hotel, as are a whole bunch of excellent restaurants. The staff are all very helpful and, as Selcuk said when I arrived, everybody is treated as family. High standard modern rooms, all kept very clean. Atmospheric and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - But expect a STEEP climb to most locations”
Reviews.Author: RTUT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and staff are friendly. Note that the hotel is quite difficult to find - I spent a couple of hours on the web trying to see the location on a map - and could not find anything... including the hotel's web site which surprisingly doesn't have a detailed map. Taxis also have problems finding this place as it is small and located of the main drag. So it is not clear how you are expected to reach this place initially. Regarding the location - it actually is farily close to the Blue Mosque - one of the key attractions. However, from the hotel it is QUITE A STEEP CLIMB UP TO THE NEAREST TRAM STATION TAKING ABOUT 10 MINUTES. All in all - ONCE FOUND, this is a nice place to stay if you don't mind the climb up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: flygirlnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Garden House and loved it. The rooms are perfectly equipped and lovely. Each day they give you water and fresh fruit in your room along with teas. Breakfast was great and was served in their cafe or outside. The location was great! I highly recommend staying near Sultanahmet....much quieter and quaint than nearer the bazaar quarter or near taksim. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. They went out of their way to help with our needs and wants....go ahead and book!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kronbladh
Reviews.Content: We booked our three-night stay directly with the hotel after having evaluated several hotel reviews on tripadvisor. It turned out that everything good stated in the reviews on this hotel was actually true. The staff is friendly and helpful in every possible wat and you really get the warm feeling that they care about you. We got good recommendations for what to do and what not to do when out on the streets of Istanbul and they helped us with finding good alternatives for transportation to and from the Sabiha GÃ¶kcen airport. After arrived and having been shown our impressive executive suite with its fabulous view over the Marmara sea we were welcomed with some complimentary wine on our room to celebrate my wifes birthday (which they snapped up during my email conversation during booking). There's only a 5-6 minute walk from the hotel up to Hippodrome, with most of Sultanahmet by your feet. The location south-west of Sultanahmet square showed to be a calm and quiet area with no noice from any kind of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: maryIL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden House before leaving on a cruise. I choose this hotel because of the reviews and recommendations on TripAdvisor. We were very happy with our stay here. The hotel is in a great location, an easy walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, etc. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They arranged for a cab/driver to meet us at the airport and for another to take us to the port. Kadir, the manager, answered all my email questions promptly, and offered to make reserations for the river dinner cruise. He really went out of his way to be helpful and make us feel so at home. The entire staff was that way. The hotel and room was very clean and comfortable. The amenities were great, flat screen TV, mini bar, complimentary water, fresh fruit in room, nice toiletries, and comfortable bed. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful and a nice courtyard setting. They have tea and coffee available during the day. The restaurant looked nice also, but we didn't have a chance to try it. The free use of their computer and internet access was very nice. As others have said, you really feel like you are a welcomed friend here. I would stay at the Garden House again when visiting Istanbul. Istanbul is such an interesting city, and so much to see and do. We really enjoyed our time there and our stay at the hotel. We highly recommend both.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for a wonderful stay in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: ViatgerBCN
Reviews.Content: We spend a short holidays in Istanbul in September. We enjoyed the city, the people and the food. All this was perfectly complemented with the hotel we stayed: Garden House. It is situated close to the main city attractions and thus you can go everywhere just with a nice 5-minute walk. The hotel service is really friendly and welcoming. They helped us with the visit planning and they ease the booking of organised trips and other events. In Garden House Hotel, there is a terrace, which we could not enjoy of due to the weather, but we are sure that is the perfect place to rest after a busy day of sightseeing. We are strongly recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but some major problems. No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: VidaLocaRanch
Reviews.Content: The location is ok. The service is ok. Value? We paid US$160/night. What matters to us is a clean, quiet room where we'd be able to relax after a full day of sightseeing. We asked for a smoke-free, pet-free, clean room. What at first sight seems clean turned out to be a filthy mess when I mobbed the floors myself. No wonder with their stone age cleaning methods (no vaccum cleaner). Hotels in Istanbul are a cut-throat business. 4 times more rooms than visitors. You will understand their attitude when it comes to add up the bill. Make sure you keep a record of every detail, or pay immediately. We had a major argument checking out...

Reviews.Title: “sweet home”
Reviews.Author: jwong133
Reviews.Content: James Huang Shanghai China 07-9-2008 I agree with the previous reviews written by AndreaCornell and Macoball. I enjoyed the breakfast, room and patio. I am very impressed by the service. It isn't a service by a waiter. It is like a help by a family member. It's the first time I went to Istanbul, but when I stayed at Garden House I felt it's an old friend's home and Istanbul wasn't a strange city.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AndreaCornell
Reviews.Content: Staying here was such a pleasure! We were greeted by a warm staff and a comfortable room with fresh fruit! The room was clean and decorated well with several amenities (air conditioner, flat screen tv, bath products which were wonderful, bottled water without charge). We were able to navigate Istanbul with the help of Selcuk and the staff. The patio has a wonderful, relaxing atmosphere where tea, coffee, bottled water and pastries are there 24/7. All we had to do was figure out what we wanted to enjoy and the hotel would help us plan. Selcuk gave us advice and made us feel totally comfortable. The boutique hotel is a 10 minute walk from all of the tourist stops such as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, underground cistern, etc. There is also a tram in this area which takes you all around. Each morning the hotel offers a lovely buffet with plenty of fresh food. When we return to Istanbul we will definitely be spending time at Garden House again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Great People”
Reviews.Author: toothbabe
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. We stayed for 10 nights. The best thing is of course the people at the front desk. They always had a top-notch person there. Kadir, Selcuk and Bulent all spoke excellent english and gave us a lot of good advice. They were always very courteous, professional and patient. I had done a lot of research and every day would ask the best way to get somewhere, etc. They would find out if something was closed and when. These guys were like having the best concierges in town at your beck and call 24/7 with minimal wait, unlike some of the big hotels. Our room at garden house was a triple (for two of us). We faced the courtyard and the call to prayer was really beautiful. The first morning we did not realize one of the many windows was partially open so it was pretty loud...at about 4:30 in the morning. On subsquent nights we made sure all windows were closed and most mornings we didn't notice or slept right through and we are both light sleepers. The air-conditioning was excellent--something that was very important to us. It was also very quiet, not a noisy window unit. We had to be careful about space management in the room but there was definitely enough room for everything if you gave it some thought. No chairs in room, which was probably better for space, we sat on the beds. Some noisy construction only in the afternoon. The location is great. Close to everything, a hilly walk, not for people with mobility issues, but you can have a taxi in 2 minutes when you want it. Comfortable shoes are a must. If you need a taxi to get you back to hotel have your cell phone ready, they may need to get instructions from hotel , it is hard for drivers to find. Another suggestion is to have them drop you off near the Hippodrome/Blue mosque area and walk to hotel. Room was decorated prettily and fruit basket and bottled water were always on hand. We brushed teeth with tap water and had no problems. Our airport transfers were included due to the length of our stay and they really took care of that well. They know how much time you need depending on the day and time. I would highly recommend you use them for transfers. Breakfast was outside in a sheltered courtyard, some covered tables available if it rained, which happened once. The weather was perfect in the morning and large trees kept it even more comfortable. There were no bugs and no mosquitoes! They have a cook ready to make eggs or omelets to order. Everyone in the restaurant area was courteous and helpful. Housekeeping staff were also very attentive and meticulous. We sure hated to leave! This city and this hotel are well worth your time and money, I think at least 5 days!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: macoball
Reviews.Content: The Garden House is a charming, quaint, clean and comfortable hotel conveniently located in the Sultanahmet neighborhood in old town Istanbul. Many famous sights and delicious restaurants are within a short walking distance of this place you can call home during your stay in Istanbul. The exemplary service from the hotel staff, particularily Bulent, Hamza and Selcuk; will make your stay all the more enjoyable and will only make you wish you extended your stay in Istanbul. The breakfast which awaits you in the morning on the lovely patio is filled with many choices of fresh fruits, yogurt, cereals, and made-to-order omeletes that can all be washed down with a steaming cup of fresh and fragrant Turkish coffee. The rooms are modern and slightly out-of-touch from the old world feel of the surrounding neighborhood, but they are very comfortable and have wonderful showers with seemingly endless hot water. We'd would go back to this place in a heartbeat! If you're a light sleeper, ask for a room that doesn't have a window located next to a loudspeaker. You may just get enlightened with Islamic chanting from the Koran at 5:30 a.m...

Reviews.Title: “Great Emplyees”
Reviews.Author: nowelt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. Staff were very helpful. Within walking distance from all main attractions. Quiet location. Dont take tips on were to eat, as you end up sharing the bill with the hotel. Try and find out your own way to good restaruants.Apart from that excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Garden House Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peracha
Reviews.Content: nice, neat hotel. everything is meticulously done. and above all, the staff is very friendly and courteous. they are doing a great job. the hotel is just a five min walk from sultanahmet so one can conveniently go to blue mosque and hagia sophia museum and can also easily catch the tram.

Reviews.Title: “good location and above average”
Reviews.Author: beccasparkles01
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a really good loaction - close to the blue mosque and bazaar so great for sightseeing... the rooms are ok - nothing fancy but nice enough and the breakfast is really nice... there a beautiful little garden to have breakfast in and a drink any other time if you like... free internet is always good... the guy at the desk tried to rip us off with a transfer which is disappointing but helpful otherwise - mostly very happy here

Reviews.Title: “Space and air, close but quiet”
Reviews.Author: troonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We moved to Garden House after one night in a small hotel close to Aya Sophia. It is in a quiet neighbourhood, 6-7 minutes walk downhill and S of the Blue Mosque. Our room on the fourth floor was much more spacious and airy than in the previous hotel, and much quieter, the call to prayer aside. In the June heat, having a breeze through the room, as well as the air conditioner, is a boon. The large airy courtyard downstairs made breakfasts a relaxing start to each day, and a welcome haven for a drink in the evening. Garden House is a recently-renovated old building, with relatively large uncluttered rooms. It is still undergoing renovation to the top floor rooms, which will have sea views. Toting two heavy cases, we appreciated the wide main stairway. The staff were helpful and friendly, assisting us with mail and internet access. The room was spotless. We are experienced travellers who prefer to stay in small locally-run hotels, and Garden House is one of the best we have used.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: abusabiq
Reviews.Content: I want to commend Kadir/Selcuk and their extrermely cordial staff (Bahtiyar, Yasin, Remzi, Aysun) for making our stay very enjoyable. We spent a week and found that this location was perfect, only about 5-10 minutes walk (slight uphill) to the blue mosque, Ayasofia, Hippodrome, metro station, etc. The hotel is very clean and tidy, and the beds were totally comfortable. Breakfast items were plenty with good coffee, tea, juices, breads, eggs, fruits, cereals, and plenty of water bottles etc. The outside food court is fantastic. There are many restaurants around where you can either dine or get a take out and eat in your room. We had rides airport-hotel-airport and the driver was friendly and on time. We really miss the friendly GardenHouse staff and highly recommend this hotel to anyone without any reservation. Use www.gardenhouseistanbul.com to make reservation directly. Nusrat & Zillur Rahim & family - College Station, Texas, USA.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with lots to offer”
Reviews.Author: Hosta_La_Vista
Reviews.Content: We were in Croatia when we wanted to try something different - Istanbul seemed to fit the bill. We booked Garden House via Venere.com for a last minute price of 99 euro per night. When we arrived, we took a taxi to the hotel for 26 euro - already we were impressed with the prices in Istanbul. The Garden Hotel is well known for its warm welcome from the front staff, inclusive of directions and recommendations (in english) and choice of cocktail to start you off. Location is awesome, 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and St. Sophia. A 5 minute walk and you will end up at the ocean near the fish market (I wouldn't recommend you be there at night). The hotel offers a daily newspaper in many languages and free internet. Tucked in the middle of a neighbourhood, we were lucky to be provided the 2 best rooms on the 4th floor. They were very roomy, appointed well with lots of windows, mini bar and coffee machine. One room faced the garden which became quite noisy when the prayers resinated from the mosques at 4 in the morning. The other room faced the neighbourhood road where families could be seen enjoying life. Lots of fun listening to the venders walking up the streets calling for rubbish disposal, for sale of watermelons or propane. The breakfast (included) is very good however, good luck getting any cooked eggs. The restaurant staff have very little english and they don't really seem like they want to make any eggs for you. One staff member, a woman, just simply ignores you - oh well, the beauties of a different culture. We were actually entertained by this and ended up talking to the front reception person who asked the staff to cook some eggs. The rest of the breakfast includes very good coffee, buns, meats, cheese and juice. Very nice to have breakfast included. A 2 minute walk to many amenities - liquor store, restaurants, farmers market on some days, and a great leather store called Trust Leather. We were so impressed with 2 jackets we had made for us, we bought 3 more. Trust Leather is just around the corner from the hotel and has is attached to a scarf & turkish delight store. The owner speaks excellent english and is very strong about what type of jacket fits what type of body shape - he did not lead us astray. Never leave the hotel or restaurant without a few crumbs for the neighbourhood cats - they are everywhere. We highly recommend the Garden House - its safe and comfortable and has all the cultural attraction you want when visiting a place like Istanbul. Stay away from any tours, Istanbul can be easily walked and enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “A haven!”
Reviews.Author: RebelarmyIreland
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel at random for a stopover on our long retreat from a Turkish holiday. Having previously "done" Istanbul, we just needed comfortable lodgings and a base for a quick sortie to bars/restaurants and the Garden House fitted the bill. We needed a triple room and that is what we got - not a double with a dodgy camp bed shoehorned in. Comfy beds with proper duvets followed by a top class breakfast set us up nicely for our trip back to Ireland. We will be back in Istanbul and we will be back at the Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: traveler9999_7
Reviews.Content: This place was a true gem. The front desk could not have greeted us with warmer hospitality. After we settled into our rooms, Seluck took the time to sit us down on the beautiful patio, offer us drinks and give us a wonderful orientation to Istanbul. He went over a map of Istanbul and pointed out all the highlights, suggested a number of tours and went online to get answers when he was not sure. It was the warmest welcome we received during our 3-week trip. Throughout our 5-night stay, the front desk continued to be wonderfully helpful- very warm, attentive and eager to assist in any way. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. Breakfast was quite a spread and the patio was fantastic. The location is very central to the major attractions and the metro is not far for when you want to venture out further. A great place and I highly recommend for any kind of trip!

Reviews.Title: “Outright good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel as a romantic getaway. Clean, quiet, great breakfast in the garden. Spacious room (203). Location is good, to the south of the old center. You do need to walk 10 minutes before getting to the center of town, tramway and all that. No problem for us, but if you don't like walking... Staff was very helpful, very kind. Helped with finding turkish bath, taxis, directions, newspapers, boat trips. No doubt, a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddmanley
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in the Sultanhemet section of Istanbul and found a gem. This is the type of place where the owner is hands on ( and in fact often on-site) and attention is paid to every detail. The entire staff is genuinely friendly and helpful. Kadir even arranged for us to be picked up at the airport upon our arrival at 2:30AM. The rooms are spacious and very clean and included a fruit basket that was refreshed each day. They offer a fabulous buffet breakfast complete with a variety of fruit, cereal and omelets. We were even treated to fresh fruit smoothies each morning. We were told they will soon offer a dinner menu and I'm sure it will be to the same high standard as the breakfast. They even offer complimentary tea and coffee throughout the day. A laptop computer in the lobby offers free internet to all guests. The Garden House is a beautiful well kept building in a neighborhood of buildings that are in various stages of disrepair. Don't let this put you off since it is a safe neighborhood of mostly families. There is a small playground nearby and children can be heard playing during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianhdc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Garden House for four nights in June 2008 and had a fabulous experience. First of all, the location is terrific. The property is three minutes away from the Blue Mosque and about five minutes from the tram line that gets you all over the city. It could not have been easier to see the city's historical sights. Second, the rooms are pleasantly done. I stayed in a remodeled room that had a granite sink countertop and new shower. The bed was comfortable, and the staff left a nice fruit basket in the room each day. Third, the property itself is in nice condition. Each morning there is a continental breakfast and coffee/tea available in a beautiful airy garden courtyard. I also found myself hanging out in the courtyard with a glass of wine after a day of sightseeing and before dinner. Finally, and most importantly, the service is impeccable. The proprietors are extremely nice and helpful. They will help you arrange sightseeing tours, airport transportation, etc. and also will provide you with terrific dinner recommendations. They could not have been more pleasant or accommodating to their guests. If you stay at the hotel, make sure to bring earplugs, as the call to prayer from the nearby mosques will wake you each morning very early (at 4:35 am when I was staying there). Also, note that most of the nightlife and modern shopping is across the Golden Horn in Beoglyu, which will require you to take a cab to the hotel if you go out at night. Overall, I would highly recommend the Garden House to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nilsi
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, good breakfast and excellent service. We had a very nice weekend in Istanbul. Sundqvist Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ubii
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 5-night stay at the Garden House and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff was extremely friendly and the location was perfect for exploring Sultanhamet. We got the pickup at the airport, which is a great service. We brought our 10-month old baby and they went out of their way to accommodate him, including playing with him! The staff and location made this an excellent choice for us. If you like exploring this is a perfect base camp. If you like staying around the hotel then this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Garden House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stelov
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Garden House and want to especially thank Celcuk and Kadir for their exceptional service. They helped us with our restaurant reservations, ordering taxis, explained to us how to get around and where to go, and seemed genuinely concerned about our welfare. The location is great, the rooms clean and nice. Pleasant patio for breakfast or a drink. Stephanie and Eivind, Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and friendly hotel in a beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: FB6
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel few minutes of walk away from all the beautiful monumental sites in old Istanbul. Rooms are clean, fully equipped and comfortable. Breakfast is rich, various and served in a beautiful open air lounge. Service is top quality: all the hotel stuff, beginning with the site manager Selcuk, has been friendly, helpful, corteus, supportive and speak good English. We got good recommendations for restaurants and excursions and Selcuk organized our transfer back to the airport at very convenient conditions. You leave knowing that you got more than you paid for: for example at our arrival we were offered a welcome drink and every evening we found a basket of fresh fruit waiting for us in our room. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ZakLondon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights at the Garden House in May08 and really enjoyed the place. The hotel is tucked away in a by-street 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia, which means it is very quiet but for the prayer calls from the nearby mosque. This is, however, unavoidable in central Istanbul. Our room (203) was very spaceous and cool, temeprature-wise. We asked to be in a non-smoking floor and were not disappointed. Most importantly, all the staff were very pleasant throughout and even brought us breakfast to the room on departure day at 5am!

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight!!”
Reviews.Author: tony77
Reviews.Content: The beginning is always a good place to start!- we were met at airport as promised, right on time, helpful & efficient, short & pleasant car journey to the hotel [ in Sultanahmet ] the room was spotlessly clean, fresh fruit every day, beds were very comfortable, good power shower with endless hot water, the small garden was a delight as we ate breakfast every day here, the breakfast was excellent every morning, omelettes/ eggs cooked to order, freshly made fruit smoothies & very good coffee indeed, as others have said -yes you can hear the calls to prayer but for us this added to the whole experience, the owner kadir was always pleasant & helpful, gave good advice & always found time to say hello, we didnt meet a member of the team who didnt do their very best to make our stay a happy one. In terms of location we found it excellent-during our 5 days here we never needed to use taxis or trams at all. Our departure home was a very early one but the staff were there to assist in any way they could, coffee on tap etc, car arrived at the agreed time & the journey was again fast & friendly. Would we stay here again?- like a shot!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Turkey_Baster
Reviews.Content: This was first stop on our 12 day, 4 hotel trip around Turkey, all booked in small hotels using Trip Advisor. We stayed for 3 days, should really have stayed a couple more days to do some other stuff, in retrospect. The car from the airport was there to meet us and although our room wasn't ready - we arrived very early- they gave us a room to freshen up in and breakfast before we went sightseeing for the morning. Our room was ready by lunchtime and was clean and comfortable. The tours organised were good and advice and help spot-on. Breakfast was excellent. The hotel was in the middle of the old district of Sultanhamet area and so we walked everywhere - I loved it. Very close to all the major sites in that part of the city. I'll be recommending this hotel to any friends and relatives wanting to do Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great position for sights”
Reviews.Author: janhewitt
Reviews.Content: Just had a long weekend in Istanbul. This hotel is in a great location to walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace the Bazzar and an evening stroll to the restaurants. The staff are extremely helpful, breakfast will see you through long after lunchtime so you can get lots of sight seeing in before you need to eat again. The room we had was recently built and very clean although still had a slight smell of paint, but that didn't bother us as we had windows onto the garden to open. If you go in winter time, not sure there is anywhere to sit to have a drink other than the garden area which is lovely in the summer months. It is a bit tricky to find on the map they give you so sugest looking at a more detailed street map before getting into the thick of the traffic as street names are hard to find. Will visit Istanbul again and would definately stop at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Garden House: beautiful place, central position”
Reviews.Author: ciofella
Reviews.Content: Garden House Hotel is a very beautiful place: central position (near the Blue Mosque), staff very kind and helpfull, rooms clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Selcuk - a wonderful stay at the Garden House”
Reviews.Author: Joancanberra
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 marvellousdays at the Garden House Hotel where the manager Selcuk looked after our every need from our online booking to every aspect of our visit.It is a very well run establishment with Secuk and the other staff providing friendly,helpful and efficient service.The hotel is very well located,within walking distance of all of the sights of the old town and also of the ferry/tram to the new town.The rooms are spotless,light and airy and much better that those in other higher priced hotels in the area.The excellent breakfast is served in a lovely garden courtyard area where drinks,coffee etc ate available at other times.A range of good restaurants are nearby and I understand that the Garden House is about to itself offer meals in the the courtyard.We would highly recommend the Garden house to other travellers tioistanbul. Gwen Mcneill and Norma Laing,Canberra,Australia

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: rjalex
Reviews.Content: I wanted an hotel that had spacious rooms, quiet and near the monuments and sites I wanted to visit in Istanbul. Booked the hotel via their website through email and was promptly contacted by the hotel and was fully supported by their very kind staff amongst which Mr. Kadir Circan went out of his way to ensure my wonderful stay. The hotel sent me a car to pick me up at the airport and so my arrival was smooth. The hotel external appearance is very nice with the ottoman style building totally in dark wood. The room was exquisitely decorated in a warm way and the room and bathroom were very clean, quiet and full of light and air. The warm wooden floor and rugs made walking barefoot a wonderful experience and the bed was really comfortable. The hotel is located in a very quiet road and the only noise was the beautiful chant of the muezzin, and I have never perceived noise from the other guests. A little nice thought was the hotel leaving a little basket of fresh fruit every day in my room. The breakfast had a very ample choice and was taken in the nice backyard garden with a choice of eating in open air or inside. I have been in Istanbul only 4 days and left in love with the town, it's people, it's food and hope to go back to see more of it. The day I do I will surely go back in this beautiful, friendly little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly”
Reviews.Author: FishermanSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at this small, friendly hotel situated very close to all main attractions of the city. We were met at the airport (complimentary) and whisked through the deserted streets of 12;30 am Istanbul to be warmly greeted and shown to our tastefully furnished room. Continental breakfast was taken in the small coffee shop/terrace. The staff were anxious to please at all times and ready to offer advice on places to eat and sights to see. As our booking was made at short notice it was necessary to change rooms during our stay and both were equally well appointed Two restaurants within easy walking distance worth a try were Oceans 7 (moderately priced small Turkish restaurant) and Balikci Sabahattin (traditional Turkish fish restaurant , more expensive but offering excellent quality and service and much better value than those on the Galata Bridge).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: silverswimmer
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here after seeing the good reviews in TA. The conversion from a traditional Ottoman mansion has been done very well. Prompt and efficient airport transfer and spacious and well equipped room with air.con,mini-bar,good size bathroom and large flat screen TV with 20+ channels .You can use their laptop in reception , which we did to reconfirm and print boarding passes for our BA return flight. Ideal position with a 5 min walk to the rear of the Blue Mosque and restaurants and shops. Tram stop a further 5 min walk. Good breakfast with new egg station and free tea/coffee all day with bar drinks also available. Weather was cool/damp so breakfast was indoors and this room can get very crowded with the recent expansion but management assured us they have plans for extending the room. In good weather there is lots of room in the outdoor patio area. They have recently converted the large ground floor area to 7 further rooms-very smart and modern with swish bathrooms but they are somewhat smaller than the traditional rooms and a bit noisier. Reception were really helpful with advice on tours and eating out and were exceptionally good at making arrangements by phone/fax for us to visit the Florence Nightingale Museum at the First Army HQ over the Bosphorus.(Will post under Istanbul Forum) We ate well at Ocean 7 and Boukoleon and although the Hotel recommended and booked us in at the dinner/cabaret at the Galata Tower it was not to our taste. The views are fabulous and food and wine is included in the price as is an International Show but the last hour was audience participation sing song - not our scene. We will return to the Garden House - the staff are very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy rooms, we had an excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelaroundandsee
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, located in central old Istanbul. The breakfast was ok, but the rooms - we had a triple â€“ were very nicely designed and were very clean. We felt at home. At the moment, there is some development works going on, however this did only happened during day time and we have not been disturbed in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Kadir”
Reviews.Author: gardenhouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights only. I wished it would have been longer. Very polite and helpful team. Hotel in the middle of the old fishers district. Wooden house! Good located! Best recommendation. I would always come back! Thank you guys! Mirela & Jan

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Garden House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seven1113
Reviews.Content: Arriving by ship, the hotel sent a large van for the four of us traveling together. The van arrived promptly and took us right to the door of the Hotel. There was a fee for the pick up, which we had discussed earlier. The Hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful. everyone greeted us with a smile and were very nice at all times. Our rooms were on the third floor, and there is no elevator. The breakfast ws very well presented and there was a wonderful selection. The Hotel is expanding and will have additional rooms very soon. The Hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood and very close to everything that tourists are interested in seeing. We walked to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Ayasofia and the Grand Bazaar. The Hotel is very clean and the rooms were very nice and spacious. We were in rooms 301 and 303. Both were just fine.I would definitely stay at the Garden House again. Carolyn

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ShahabS
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at this hotel and found everything to be just perfect. Breakfast was great, dining room serving free tea/coffee until 10 pm, clean rooms, friendly staff always there to make your stay comfortable and to guide you. Hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Blue mosque and the Sultanahmet metro rail station. Although there are plenty of Hotels in the area, I feel high rating for this hotel on trip advisor is truly reflective of their service. I will definitely recommed this place for singles as well as families.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and vaue for money”
Reviews.Author: Marpleboy
Reviews.Content: Fully enjoyed our stay. Very helpful staff, relatively quiet location close to many of the main attractions. Not an exclusive neighbourhood but still feels very safe. You should expect the early morning call to prayer but we only heard this on the first morning and it simply added to the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: girlfromnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Garden House in August of last year and really enjoyed it. We were looked after well and especially enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning with lots to choose from. It was really pleasant eating our food on the patio and enjoying the sound of the waterfall. When we stayed it was especially warm and the coolness of the patio was a real bonus! We were able to book an excursion to Gallipoli which went well and without hitches. The complimentary transfer from the airport was really helpful as we were hot and tired by the time we wrrived and it was nice to know that we would be going straight to our hotel without delay. I loved Istanbul and I will definitely be returning one day. I would definitely stay at The Garden House again! Only a few minutes easy walk to the glorious Blue Mosque!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service and Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: immij
Reviews.Content: Apart from the hotel being slightly tucked away I cant say anyhting negative about the hotel. The rooms were a decent size very clean comfortable with all mod cons being present. The staff were very helpful and adviced us lots on places to go and see. Food was great as well so all in all a very good place to stay. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Eurasia!”
Reviews.Author: SalisburyPat
Reviews.Content: Genuinely friendly, helpful staff who make it their priority to ensure you enjoy not only your time at the hotel, but in Istanbul as well. Extremely affordable and centrally located (can almost see western obelisk of the Hippodrome from front door). 5 min walk to Blue Mosque, 7 to Ayasofya, 15 to Tokapi Palace, 15 to Grand Bazaar, 7 to nearest tram stop. Pretty garden for morning breakfast buffet. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Of all my travels throughout Europe in the past 12 months, this was far and away the best hotel deal I found.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: NaxLondon
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and friendly, no sign of typical high pressure selling. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good, with nice variety of items. And FREE internet avaiable 24-7. Overall very good valeue given very central location The owner was really helpful - letting us pick up some forgotten items onthe way to the airport. Transfer service is very convenient The hotel is a bit tucked away down a miriad of side streets and a couple of times taxis got lost...safe bet is to get droppped off at Blue Mosque and walk

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler22222
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Garden House in Istanbul and my brother and I were extremely pleased with our stay. The staff were all so helpful - giving us directions, recommending restaurants and making reservations. The rooms were very nice and clean, and the breakfast provided a great start to very busy days in Istanbul. I would definitely recommend the Garden House to anyone visiting Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: elo77
Reviews.Content: We were two girls travelling the first time to Istanbul. Thanks to the Hotel staff (in special Kadir and BÃ¼lent :- ) ) we felt very welcome and in god hands from the beginning. They gave us a lot of information were to go and how to behave and I found there concern very kind. The rooms are great, they are big enough and very clean! In since it was February and we even end up having big snowstorms, they managed to keep them warm and cosy. Unfortunately id didnâ€™t work out in the breakfast area, were we had to get a bigger jacked, since it was pretty cold. The variety of food offered for the breakfast was for us more than enough. Kadir told us, that they are planning to make some changes, so weâ€™re looking forward to see how the hotel will end up looking like. Weâ€™re thinking to go to Istanbul again, maybe in the fall, with warmer temperatures and in that case weâ€™ll definitely stay at the Garden House Hotel again. Thank you for such a nice stay â€“ Garden House Hotel â€“ Team. Elisabete & Sigrid (14.-17.02.2008)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a lovely weekend!”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: For two adults on a first ever trip to Istanbul, the Garden House was an excellent choice! It has been complimented on this site for its cleanliness and the friendliness of the staff, and I subscribe to all of that. It is also extremely conveniently located, a couple of minutes' walk from Sultanahmet square and otherwise within easy walking distance from all major sights and experiences in this area. The most direct route is steep and may make you short of breath, but walking around the steep rise is easy and only takes you a couple of additional minutes. We also found that the staff provided us with very good advice on where to go and what to see, as well as restaurant recommendations which were spot-on. The hotel is not in the very poshest part of Sultanahmet, which we came to discover is wall to wall hotels and shops. There are, however, plenty of small and what seem to be relatively recently refurbished hotels and guest houses around the Garden House, too, and for your added benefit, you may get a feel for what the area was before the renovation started. It also allows you a small respite from the constant hassling that goes on (admittedly in a very friendly way) around the shops and main tourist attractions. We completely loved it, and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: martin0257
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late as we stayed here in Feb 2007 for my 50th. Apologies to the owners. The hotel was ideal, a great location just down the hill from the Blue Mosque, the room was clean and comfortable and the owner couldn't have been more helpful. The only noise was the call to prayer but that applies to all Istanbul. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. Oh, and I stanbul is great! Just one helpful hint. If you go to Istanbul in February take a warm coat and scarf.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ambience”
Reviews.Author: Ojah
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights. We were 4 adults, 1 child and 1 infant. Great location; friendly staff; clean; sufficient breakfast. If hotel had an elevator and provided tea/coffee making facilities in every room, it would be almost perfect. From Fawzia Hanoum Ariff of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Garden House, A Perfect Match for the Charm of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MJC-Miami
Reviews.Content: The Garden House, along with it's entire staff, can only be described as "best-in-class". A perfect place from which to explore Istanbul. The accommodations, the breakfast / food, the staff: Selcuk, Kadir and all the other Garden House (GH) team members, were amazing. Not a detail escapes them. They are Istanbul's ambassors of good-will, making all guest comfortable - not only while in the GH, but throughout Istanbul as well. They have great recommendations, and city-wide relationships with guides, restaurants and other relevant services. I was a guest for 10 consecutive days and enjoyed every minute while in the GH. Additionally, my Istanbul guided tours and subsequent self-directed tours - all of which were coordinated and/or planned with the help of GH staff, were incredible. Book the room at the Garden House and focus your energy on learning more about one of the most fantastic places in the world. It's no wonder the Byzantines, Romans and Ottoman Turks made it (Constantinople / Istanbul) their capital throughout history. M.J. Charves

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Koit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Garden House for three nights in November. Nothing negative can be said about the place, The room was beautiful, absolutely clean, the service was great. Location is excellent, just behind Blue Mosque. All the must see sights are walkingt distance. Just a remark - there is quite a steep climb to get to the Blue Mosque b ut this is something that is to be expected in Istanbul. Rooms have a wireless connection and if you do not have your own laptop there is one in the lobby that can be used free of charge. There is a number og good and cheap kebab houses and restaurants close by. It was a great stay and I would definetly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Garden House”
Reviews.Author: pazzi
Reviews.Content: Great experience at Garden House: location is amazing (few minutes walking from Sulthanamet), service is excellent and rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel management can arrange taxi service at very competitive prices and is always polite and willing to help. We definitely recommend this Hotel for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable at Garden House”
Reviews.Author: culiseta
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a three night stay at the Garden House Istanbul. The location was perfect - just a short walk to the major sites. The staff was helpful, the breakfast excellent, and the room lovely and clean. Airport transfer was complimentary with a stay of three nights, which was an added perk. A ten percent discount was given off our final bill for paying in cash. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tahoebob
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Garden House Hotel in Istanbul. I found the hotel on TripAdvisor and found it to be everything the reviews said and more. Location is great - in a quiet neighborhood yet very close to the Blue Mosque, etc. I found the staff to be extremely helpful in many ways. I was using Istanbul as a base from which to tour Central Asia, so I actually stayed at the Garden House on 3 separate occasions in October 2007. Each time I returned, I was greeted like a long, lost friend. I highly recommend the Garden House and will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “friendly quiet yet excellent location”
Reviews.Author: harryMansfield_uk
Reviews.Content: my wife and i enjoyed an excellent three night stay. the room was superb with a nice modern en suite. the staff were very friendly and most helpful and arranged some trips for us as well as a nice evening out at a galata tower show. the location was excellent down a cobbled quiet back street with little traffic yet within easy walking distance of many of the major tourisr attractions in the sultanhamet district. the hotel also booked our transfers from the sabiha gocken airport for us at a very reasonable price. overall a really nice small cosy clean hotel, we will certainly stay their again when next in istanbul. harold and jackie yelland UK.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all ways”
Reviews.Author: aberczaj
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Garden House. The location is central for tourists, the rooms are clean, spacious, and have all modern amenities. The staff were exceedingly friendly and always willing to give advice on things to see, do, and eat. Also very helpful in arranging transfers to the airport. We stayed one night at the beginning of our trip to Turkey and enjoyed our stay so much that we booked again for 3 more nights at the end of our trip. The warm and friendly staff, the ample rooms and the generous breakfast really made for an excellent place to rest after a weary day of exploring all Istanbul has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sslazio
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel where I would definetly stay again. It is a small hotel located close to the Blue Mosk, Hagia Sophia and the Topkapi Palace. Having said that, it is out of the main tourist streets on a small quiet street. The room looked really nice and spacious. The personnel was very friendly and helpful. For me and my girlfriend this hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: Kaygeus
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice hotel. The location is great for tourists -- just 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and on to some other key sites from there. The staff were very nice and polite. The rooms very clean. The garden itself is a nice quiet place to sit for breakfast but got little use by us or from other guests otherwise -- not all that inviting, really. One caution: if you book a suite, be prepared to receive a double room. There's nothing suite-like about it. I guess the management thinks that because one double room may be a bit larger than another, and have a bathtub instead of a shower, it qualifies as a "suite". Hopefully they'll fix this confusing point on their website soon. Also, the rooms on the street can be a little bit noisy at night. Not too bad except for very light sleepers. If you're one of those, you may want to request a room in the back.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpainFreelander
Reviews.Content: Very nice and obliging management and personnel, clean hotel but difficult to find for taxis. No bathtubs in any room. My main objection: a very unimaginative breakfast. Worth only if prices are substantially reduced.

Reviews.Title: “It's all true”
Reviews.Author: Wideeyedandlegless
Reviews.Content: All the reviews on the place are pretty close to the mark, Sercuk is charming and helpful, the breakfast acceptable by Istanbul stds., it's in a great spot close to the Blue Mosque, cafe's etc. We were given a nice room which effective A/C, which was both clean and comfortable. It was also in a good state of repair and had nice fittings. It's a little expensive, but it's an expensive though tranquil location. No problem recommending this one.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TraveltimeSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Garden House on 16th and 17th August and could not have expected any more from our stay. Selcuk was extremely helpful and friendly prior to arrival and during our stay - he went out of his way to make sure our stay was perfect. The room was spacious and very comfortable and the location was very handy - just a short walk (up a hill) and you are at the Blue Mosque and Hippodrome. Was one of the very best hotels we stayed in during our trip. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: AandHScotland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Garden House at the end of August for 6 nights and again at the beginning of September for another night. Although we arrived 02.00 the staff were there to meet and greet us with warm smiles and a very welcome drink. Sercuk and his wonderful team looked after us very well and we can't wait to go back again and hear Sercuk's wonderful funny stories and see his smiling face. The hotel is spotless and the quiet air conditioning was a blessing after a hot day in Istanbul.
