Istanbul is our favourite city and now it's even better since we've found our own home from home in the Garden House.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars for service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Hans_Soesterberg
Reviews.Content: ***** Five stars for hospitality and service. The staff have welcomed me as if I came home. In fact I did, because I stayed one week in this beautiful accomodation in February. The room is beautiful decorated in Turkish style and very spacious. The airco works very well as it is 36 degrees outside! My second stay this year was at least as nice as the first time. When I stayed in this charming boutique hotel last February I had a wonderful stay. The staff was very friendly and they made me feel at home. Although the weather was nice, I couldn't eat my breakfast in the cosy garden. In July I could! I just want to strongly recommend this hotel to everyone who is planning to visit lovely Istanbul!!! The hotel is located in the old part with Ottoman houses and very quited. On walking distance you will find the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Ideal for families I would say. If I visit Istanbul another time, I will definitely come back to 'my' Garden House hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, lovely haven”
Reviews.Author: Bontaks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the beginning of July and had a delightful time. We toured the city during the morning and early afternoon, came back to our little haven for a rest and a cool drink in the garden in the afternoon and then went to one of many charming places for a meal in the evening. The staff, led by Selcuk and Mustafa, were amazingly helpful, friendly and competent. Nothing was too much trouble. Mustafa was even going to arrange a day trip (admittedly a very long one!) to Gallipoli for us, but there was enough in the city and its surrounds to keep us happy for the time we were there. The location was perfect - such easy access to everything you want to see in Istanbul. The free internet access in the lobby, and even free wireless if you had your own laptop, was so convenient. The rooms and bathrooms were immaculately clean, the decor lovely and the beds very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was ample and varied. The transport to and from the airport was included in the accommodation and was so convenient.. While the streets and houses around the hotel were not immaculately clean, we found it to be no different to anywhere else in Istanbul. Part of the charm of the city is its old houses in varying states and conditions and its friendly people. Overall, this hotel is great value for money. I would not hesitate to recommend the Garden House to anyone and would definitely stay here when visiting Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: vic81
Reviews.Content: Horrible environment. Surrounding the hotel is just dirty & old houses, rubblish station. Looks not nice. Although it only takes 5 minutes walk to Sultanahmet Cami, it has to pass thru dirty & narrow lanes. The room is ok but it only provides a small glass. The breaskfast doesn't taste good as well.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the garden hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sil55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at the Garden Hotel in Istanbul and I was very happy with the experience. Everything written about this lovely hotel is true: the staff is very kind and helpful, the location, central but quiet, is very good and the rooms and very well kept. I lovely place in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in a busy tourist area”
Reviews.Author: eesneverappy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a few weeks ago, and were impressed. The hotel takes pride in providing a service which ensures clean rooms and a level of service which is rare. We checked out the hotel on the Internet, and then phoned to confirm details. The hotel is small â€“ I guess it only has about 10 rooms. We were collected at the airport as part of the deal, which worked very well. It is well-located, (within 5 minutes walk) for the primary tourist venues, such as the Blue Mosque, the Haigh Sophia, and the Topkapi Palace Our room had a large double bed and a single. I was a bit disappointed that there was no comfortable chair but my wife tells me the room was great, so clearly Iâ€™m wrong! In the old city there is no shortage of mosques and each is equipped with loud-speakers so that you donâ€™t miss the opportunity to listen to the local mullah calling the faithful to prayer. Unfortunately at any given point in Sultanhammet you can hear three or four mosques competing in volume and anguish for the available Muslims to come and visit. The net effect of this is that there is a regular cacophony. And the good news isâ€¦â€¦â€¦..The hotel has a quiet, secluded garden, which is a god-send, (or perhaps that should be an â€˜Allah-sendâ€™) and a comforting retreat from the noise outside. The front desk was manned throughout by English-speakers who had a good command of the language and who seemed always to want to resolve all of our problems and did so; in fact one is an ex-biology teacher who says that he chose to do hotel work because he likes to see happy people, and he is good at making that happen! All-in-all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: RWCDubai
Reviews.Content: The warm and knowledgeable management team at Garden House Hotel contributed to a memorable trip to Istanbul for our family. Highlights: -Hassle-free transfer to and from Ataturk Airport (30 YTL) -Selcuk, Mustafa, and the dining room staff did a superb job - friendly service, ample breakfast, complimentary afternoon tea whilst we were waiting for a flight. -The triple room was very clean and bathroom spotless. -Sultahmet sights walking distance - Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar (but Spice Bazaar is better value and only 20min walk), Cemberlitas Hamam, Divan Yolu, Haci Bekir ali Muhiddin the original lokum (Turkish delight) shop -Free internet access was very useful. -Selcuk gave precise instructions for reaching Istiklal Caddesi in Beyoglu by tram. Great restaurants. He booked a Bosphorus night cruise for us (fresh seafood, very entertaining Turkish dancing) and organised dinner at a seafood restaurant in Kumkapi. You are driven to and from the dinner which is handy. A homely oasis in the centre of bustling Istanbul. R. Chang Dubai

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best ***** Five Stars*****”
Reviews.Author: Skylar01
Reviews.Content: As a spoiled New Yorker, who has traveled extensively, I can tell you without hesitation, that the Garden House rivals some of the finest hotels worldwide. It is a boutique hotel, with lovely, clean rooms. The location in the Old City is perfect and charming. The staff is warm, delightful and extremely helpful. I stayed in room 103, right off the garden. The room was spacious, bright and beautifully furnished. If you're looking for delicious food, try Doy Doy, right up the hill from the hotel. Very simple decor, moderately priced ... but, some of the best lamb chops that I've ever tasted. And, they deliver to the Garden House, should you want "room service"!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a little gem! I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: janeknycEastHampton
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Trip Advisor for this hotel, and booked it because of the great reviews. This website is a great service as the reviews are really what counts in booking a hotel. This was a great experience, and I highly recommend this wonderful hotel. The rates are very reasonable, the hotel is charming, the location is fabulous..right in the old city of Istanbul...combining the charm of the old city with wireless internet in the rooms! You can't beat that! The rooms are lovely, the housekeeping service is excellent and the room is very clean. For the price you can't beat it. Most of all it's about the people who run the hotel. The service is fabulous, and you are made to feel like you're at home. My friend and I are leaving tomorrow, and I feel sad about leaving this hotel, and the nice people who work here. They tended to every one of our whims...gave us honest advice...helped us to avoid being ripped off, which is very common here in Istanbul, especially at the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. Selcuk, the Manager, was very helpful, and the other manager, Mustafa, was an absolute delight. He picked us up from the train station the day we arrived from Athens, and he is taking me to the airport tomorrow, and he even brought me to the Spice Market and came shopping with me! I adore him and wish I could take him back to NY!! He would be a great manager at any top ranking hotel in NYC. He is a very special person. He recommended a local restaurant near the hotel, and we've gone there every night. It's called DOY DOY...the food is fabulous and cheap. It's where the locals go. In fact, tonight I was too lazy and tired to walk up the hill, and the restaurant has a delivery bike. The delivery is very different here. They bring the food on regular plates....you eat...and then they come back and pick up the plates, and then you pay. Very interesting! This hotel is in the old Sultamanet area of Istanbul, which is where you want to stay. It's very centrally located, and you can walk anywhere from here. Enjoy the Garden House in Istanbul. I am off to Budapest, and am staying at the Starlight Suiten Hotel, which is number one on Trip Advisor there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kaaawa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Garden House Hotel. It was everything that reviewers said it would be and more. Seljuk, Mehmet and Mustafa, "Boo" and the rest of the staff attended to our every need. I don't know at this point whether I'll miss Istanbul or them more. Thanks Seljuk for the tour and Turkish bath recommendations. They were among the highlights of our trip. It was cool when we first arrived, so we were fortunate enough to sleep with our windows open. Their was a nice cross breeze and we were able to immerse ourselves in the sounds and activities of a real Turkish neighborhood. I particularly liked the breakfast and beers in the Secret Garden. Thanks Mehmet for the early coffees. Mehmet-Mustafa says you want a pink PB's T-shirt. What is he talking about? I am a retail pharmacist and owner of a rental property in Hope Town Bahamas. I know how difficult it is to make all of your customers happy. Maybe I'm easier to please than most because of it, but when I return to Istanbul, I won't stay anywhere else. Paul & Yoshiko Bruening Virginia Beach, Va and PB' S Place, Hope Town, Abaco, Bahamas

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: A64
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the friendly way we were treated by Mr Selcuk Topcu, the daytime manager and Mr Mustafa Ozduman, the evening manager, but also by the other staff! We were really made to feel at home by the good care, good service, very nice rooms, good food, good advice and very important: improvisation when needed!! The rooms have been recently redecorated and are very comfortable; free internet in the lobby. The location is good, in a nice and quite part of the 'old town', yet within walking distance of all attractions of the old part of the city. This hotel is good value for the money. Staying seven nights was too short, we hope to come back and will certainly choose this hotel again and will recommend it to friends and relatives. Arie and Louise Fakkert, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Garden House is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: luisa1SantaMonica
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Istanbul May 12. My stay at the Garden House Hotel was wonderful. It was a comforting feeling to arrive at the Garden House after the long 22 hour journey from California. Even at midnight Mustafa and Mehmet welcomed me warmly. Upon entering my room, it was a pleasure to find a truly inviting, lovely room (with modern bath) that poved to be very comfortable for my long stay; the soft linens and scented towels were a plus. The staff are all great. Selcuk, the manager, gives each guest his special attention, as do Mustafa and Mehmet also at the desk. All are knowlegeable about their city, friendly and extremely helpful always taking the time to answer questions of their guests. The comfort and needs of the guests are definitely the number one priority at the Garden House. The breakfast buffet is abundant and good. The restaurant is open for dinner with an excellent menu, which is a plus after a busy day. The Garden House is situated within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and much more, all the must sees of historic Istanbul. As a frequesnt visitor to Istanbul, I feel that the Garden House is my home in Istanbul. I look forward to returning there soon. I will highly recommend the Garden House Hotel, Istanbul to my friends. Many thanks, Louisa Santa Monica, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Garden House”
Reviews.Author: DerekM47
Reviews.Content: We (a party of 4) arrived at the Garden House on 31/03/2007 for 7 nights. On arrival Selcuk the manager made us feel very welcome and gave information on Istanbul and the various trips we could book. Both rooms were very nicely decorated and very clean and kept that way throughout our stay. The room was well soundproofed and we had no bother with noise from adjoining rooms or the street. Istanbul is a great place to visit and the Garden House is nicely situated for visiting the main sites. The only slight drawback would be that old or infirm people might find the hilly streets hard going. There are plenty of good restaurants within a reasonable walking distance of the hotel. The buffet breakfast was good with a reasonable selection, and omelettes could be ordered. All the staff were very friendly and eager to please, the nicest we have met on our travels so far. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation in recommending Istanbul and the Garden House Hotel to our friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Garden House
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Mah. Sehit Mehmetpasa Sokak | No:11/13 Old City, Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
